I'd like to set a "definition of done" for each task, set a score (with customizable score options) and define epics (groups of stories), releases (delivery wave of a product or milestone in a project), features, chores and bugs.
I also want to be able to report on sprints in regards to velocity, burndown or burnup.
I also want to report on epics or releases' progression.

header: Office365 group calendar notification is not working
idea_text: Office365 group calendar notification is not working. Even if the option to notify is turned on.

comments.text: i am also unable to make this work.

header: Provide a way to convert security groups to mail-enabled security groups.
idea_text: The ability to convert security groups to mail-enabled security groups is currently available if you run Exchange locally.  This function should also be available in O365.

header: Rename SharePoint Tenant Site or be able to use company sub-domain using CName
idea_text:
When creating a Office 365 account, we got a generated tenant name (which includes my first name) which ofc is not what the end-users would expect to use on daily basis.So two solutions, 
1) Rename the Tenant name2) Use Company top-domain and create a subdomain with a CName pointer to the SharePoint site, 
 => None of which are working today.

comments.text: Please fix this Microsoft!  It's been 4+ years your users have been asking for this basic feature.

header: Sent Email with Voting Option to Exchange Global Distribution List from Outlook 2016 via Office 365 & Vote button not showing up on recipien
idea_text: Sent Email with Voting Option to Exchange Global Distribution List from Outlook 2016 via Office 365 & Vote button not showing up on recipients' end. Please fix on your next Office 2016 update rollout.......

comments.text: yes
We recently migrated and this feature is used extensively.
We just migrated to Office 365 and this feature is one we use regularly.
Please help to add voting function to Global Distribution List. Thanks.

Voting only works when a message is sent to individual users or a Static DL, but not to a Dynamic DL. We use Dynamic DLs for our office locations rather than trying to maintain all the static lists that would be required, but just found out that voting does not work for these messages. If Exchange only evaluates membership of the group when a message is sent to it, there should be a way to return that membership back to the sender's Outlook for the tracking.

header: Office 365 Group Calendar Entries
idea_text: Have the ability to edit the Office 365 Group Calendar instance or series directly from my Outlook Calendar. Currently, if I edit the instance or series of an Office 365 Group Calendar entry - these changes are only reflected in my copy of the meeting and not update for all other participants

header: Teams Chat - delete threads or messages
idea_text: Teams chat quickly becomes very cluttered with junk. I want to be able to delete an entire chat thread if its no longer useful. I want to be able to delete a specific message in a chat thread. Sometimes they have annoying stickers or GIFs, or it was sent by mistake.

comments.text: Administering the students' chat is a task that the teacher should do as a manager, avoiding comments that do not correspond to the pedagogical work

Totally agree: I am trying to delete an automated message from a bot (connected service). Being the owner of the Team/Channel, I would expect to be able to moderate the chat thread. It is weird that I can't delete chat messages as owner. And while the workaround to ask team members to delete one of their chats messages is tedious but an option, this is not possible for automated non-member messages.

header: Remove or disable Groups and Favorite Group Calendars
idea_text: hi, i've just upgraded to outlook 2016 & now have two additional options listed in the folder pane, - groups & favorite group calendars. i want to be able to remove or disable these so they don't show as they are taking up too much space & i cannot see all of the mailbox below!

header: Ability to create Dynamic Distribution group based on user's domain.
idea_text: Currently, dynamic distribution groups in O365 can be created with a certain set of rules: "Membership in this group will be determined by the rules you set up below." One of the options should be user's domain (i.e.: contoso.com).This would greatly help those O365 tenants who harbor several domain names and have multiple users per domain AND when users want to send out an email to the rest of those who belong to their specific domain.Hope that makes sense.Thanks!

comments.text: Support this recommendation - I have many customers with multiple businesses, and being able to target each one individually is a must

I totally agree. Not having the ability to use "Recipient Containers" in Office 365 is very restricting. Been on with Microsoft who recommend using Custom attributes. When we have over 6000 users, who may change SMTP address frequently, having to deal with custom attributes just adds another admin overhead. DDL based on Primary SMTP Domains would get around these issues.

header: Teams Allow to take over mouse and keypoard of an external attendee like its possible in Skype
idea_text: If an external attendee shares his screen in a Teams session it should be possible, that the external attendee gives remote control to internal attendees on request. The external user just uses the Teams App without any Office 365 login. This functionality is available in Skype for Business and when Teams will replace Skype it should have the same functionality!

header: Full fledged Group Calendars
idea_text:
Ability to share the group calendar by a link outside and inside the domain, and have it look the same across both OWA and Outlook. Enable permissions for more fine grain permissions to calendar files and convo. Allowing a more fine grain control over who can view the calendar. A public calendar allows all users in your domain to add events to that calendar. This is a little awkward when students, teachers, custodians, and administrators are within the same domain. Then when using a private group, the calendar can't be shared outside the group members.The group calendars cannot be exported in anyway ....   Since it does not work in outlook.I would think that permissions would work like so:
Members - Can add or edit files, calendar or Conversations
Owners - Members that can change memberships and permissions
Guests - Permissions for anyone else

comments.text: I also agree that we need the ability to share the calendar publicly, which also requires the ability to independently set permissions for the calendar vs the group.Currently, the group calendar is private to the group regardless of whether or not the group itself is public. In other words, when a group is private, it makes sense to default the group calendar to private viewing only, but there are many cases where you want to make the group calendar public, so anyone can see the event details (read only), but only group members can create/edit/delete the events. I expect that either 1) the calendar in a public group is also public (just like SharePoint content for the public group), or I at least have the ability to share the calendar publicly (iCal URL).Ideally, all Outlook calendars, including group calendars, are shareable via an iCal URL, but also there should be a way to make the group calendar public/private independently of the group's overall public/private setting.

One of the main reasons I cannot suggest Groups for my users group tasks is they have multiple calendars with multiple levels of access. Multiple calendars in a single Group
Levels of Read/Write permissions
The ability to export a calendar to a ICS or an HTML calendar would be great as well.

I agree...the current calendar options are unworkable for many scenarios in our organization.  Please add the ability to add events that are NOT meetings, but just an event.  We tried to create a Vacation calendar for our office, but when someone adds their vacation, everyone else in the office is invited.  By default, no one is subscribed to the calendar, but everyone is getting invited to go on vacation with everyone else.  Please let us add a normal event to the calendar instead of forcing everything to be a meeting request.

header: Centralized management at tenant scope
idea_text: Provide a user interface available to tenant admins to manage all groups and their associated properties (name, discussions, files, etc) and enhance ability to manage metadata.

reaction.note: Thanks for posting. The updated Office 365 Admin portal (in preview) includes a Groups center for managing group properties – name, description, membership, privacy type, lifecycle, etc. Reports on usage will also be released in the  Office 365 reports center this summer. What isn’t addressed in the preview portal?

comments.text: I see O365 Group sites in the SharePoint Central Admin preview, but I cannot do any of the SharePoint administration task that I can do on site collections.  I can do some administration of groups through Exchange Admin.  I can also do other task through AD Admin. It would be useful to have a One-stop-shop for O365 group administration where I could handle all O365 Group administration tasks.
Please add the ability to allow on Tenant Admins to add external users to a group from the admin portal. Currently only Group Owners can add external users from OWA.
How is group proliferation managed? Show the last used date for groups. Give ways to control and govern groups so they're effective. Ways to enforce governance. Two people does not make a group, etc.

this is a problem....

Site collection in Office 365 group cannot be displayed on SharePoint admin center.

header: Guest must accept Terms of Use before joining Office 365
idea_text:
Office 365 Groups owners can add guests (if tenancy allows).  However, there are no further checks, etc.  When an invitation is sent, it would be great if
 - the message could be customised with some wording
 - the guest must accept terms published at, for example "GuestUsageGuidelinesUrl" setting
     - these terms include who owns what, who's responsible for what, the guest should have anti-virus, etc,  If they accept, their invitation is processed.  Ironically, this is *exactly* the same as me posting a suggestion here! Above the "post idea" button, it says "I agree to the terms of service". :-)

reaction.note: Today we have Group usage guidelines; For Guest specific guidelines we are currently working on it, it will be mastered in -B2B.

comments.text: We do a lot of work with external collaborators, so we are looking for a method to accept terms and conditions when they receive and accept the invitation

I would also like to hear an update on this.Our company is also looking for some sort of way to implement a company custom Terms or Service (TOS), Terms of Use (TOU), End-User License Agreement (EULA), Technology Usage Guidelines (TUG) or similar that would span across all applications on the O365 platform including SharePoint, Onedrive, etc.Thanks,
Hi, may I know if we have any update on this so far?

I would like/need to have this for the whole O365. When ever external users are invited they would need to accept the use whether the invitation is for SharePoint Online, OneDrive for business or any other where you can invite externals.

header: Enable removing full control permission from the Office 365 group owner.
idea_text:
*English follows Japanese
 
■Title(件名)：
Office 365 グループの所有者から、サイトのフル コントロール権限を削除する方法
Enable removing full control permission from the Office 365 group owner.***************
■Description(内容):
現在 Office 365 グループのメンバー管理の為、所有者の権限を付与しているが、Office 365 グループに紐づくサイトについてはフル コントロール という強い権限を与えたくないと考えています。
Office 365グループの所有者として指定しているユーザーから、サイトに対するフル コントロールの権限を削除し、一般のユーザーと同じような編集権限を付与できるように希望します。Currently, an owner of Office 365 is granted a full control permission to manage members of the group. However, we do not want to grant strong permission of full control  for sites associated with the Office 365 group.
Therefore, I hope you to provide the ability to remove the full control permission from the user specified as the group owner and grant an edit permission like other general users.Thank you for your consideration.

header: Do Not Automatically Send Group Invitations on Paste of Event
idea_text: Currently, if you want to take a personal calendar (such as vacation day) and paste it into your Group calendar, you can copy and paste easily from your personal calendar to the group calendar BUT group invitations will automatically be sent to all members.The system should allow a user to copy/paste into the Group calendar and indicate if they want invites to be sent (or not).

comments.text: Great idea!

header: O365 Groups classification available on creation form
idea_text: Groups classification is available from Edit Form. It would be really helpful to have it available while creating new group

reaction.note: Thank you for providing this question and feedback!We are working to provide the ability to select a classification at all endpoints where Office 365 Groups are created/edited, e.g. Outlook, SharePoint, Planner, Teams, Yammer, +more. Refer to the following items on the Office 365 Roadmap to track progress:  – search for ‘classification’.If this is a hot topic for you, please submit additional requests, thoughts and feedback regarding Groups Data Governance (security, privacy, lifecycle, etc.).

comments.text: Just to add color. Modern Team Site creation experience already enables users to pick the Data Classification before TS is created, and request here is to expand the same experience to other end-points and make it consistent across all the end-points that Office 365 Groups include.

header: Know room reservation status summary with recurring meetings when using Teams Channel
idea_text: I scheduled a recurring meeting using Teams Channel (so that everyone in team can join meeting) that also has a conference room. Frequency of this meeting is every work day (M-F).Now because this meeting is scheduled in Teams Channel, Office 365 Calendar shows Teams Channel as an Organizer but Microsoft Teams shows me as an Organizers.Traditionally when scheduling this kind of meeting with Outlook/Office 365 Calendar, I get a summary with occurrences that declined (for whatever reason - like room not available).And then I update individual meetings that my conference room declined and change the room that is available for that particular meeting.But when using Microsoft Teams channel to schedule meeting, after saving/creating this meeting I don't know if room is reserved or not as I didn't get any emails that says conference room accepted or declined. Only way to know whether the room is reserved or not is to open individual meeting in my calendar and check whether conference room accepted or declined - this is very very cumbersome experience - especially for daily meetings.Can we get Teams channel meeting to send out summary to Organizer (creator of meeting and not Team Channel) and also set the meeting location to be the Conference Room selected (regardless of reservation status)?

comments.text: Never schedule a meeting that is owned by the Team IFF the meeting includes a room. So no channel meetings and no meeting manually created from the group's calendar in Outlook. Probably not the message Microsoft Teams wants advertised.Workaround: Schedule the meeting with you as organizer and invite the Team (without expanding it to see members) if you want it to show on the Team's calendar, also invite all team members that you want included.

header: It should be possible to not get ANY email from the group.
idea_text: Since the group is integrated in outlook next to your Inbox, I (and my colleagues) want to keep everything that's been said in the group, inside the group.As soon as someone replies to a message you posted in the group, you start receiving those replies in your inbox, but the answer is also inside the group, and again my mailbox overflows. If the conversation only stays in the group, the context would be clear immediately.Currently there seems to be no way to set preferences on when you want to be informed by email (for example on reply, when your name is mentioned in the message, etc.). Cfr. Slack where you can decide when and if you'd like to be notified (if at all).Without this, groups are useless, since they don't make our inbox smaller, they'd just add more clutter, when groups could be helping to reduce that.Some people like to get emails, some don't. Please allow us to choose ourselves.

reaction.note: Please see this:

This is a cross-post of this scenario:
We currently have no plans to change the setup as is. However, you could try ignoring the conversation: This is a cross-post of this scenario:
Sorry about the earlier response, it seems like I have misread the original Idea.This is a cross-post of this scenario:
As commented, you can unsubscribe from a group, so that only @-mentions are sent to your own inbox.Here’s how to do so:

comments.text: I joined several groups.  Never posted anything to them.  My inbox loaded-up with Groups emails that should have never been in my inbox.  Unsubscribe.

I suggest to give different way of receiving group mails (as an alternative).
Instead of receiving a mail with full message, the user could get only link to message in the group. 
After the link is used the message can disappear.
So no, I do not agree that you close this ticket...

Microsoft seems to be emulating some competitors behaviour, to reduce the damage, but you do not seem to have grasped the basic idea here : People experience Inbox ****. All the information is scattered through endless mails, those mails (or even the mail threads) do not offer enough CONTEXT for our brains to cope with all that information. The solution is as simple as it is elegant : you need a contextual GROUP where conversation stay in one place (you can replace PLACE and CONTEXT in the above as much as you like). Please make sure the product manager sees these comments. Someone with actual analytical abilities should follow up on this !Otherwise Slack and your other competitors will continue to eat you market share....

We would like to keep group discussion in the group and avoid unneccessary e-mails
When I write a response to a group post, the author of the initial post is automatically added to the recipient list. We need a configuration to switch off this automatic behaviour. We don't want to have these responses in our mail boxes.
Isn't this available?In Outlook 2016 click 'Membership' and then 'subscribe' or 'unsubscribe'.

header: OneDrive - receive copy of email invitation sent to invitees
idea_text: When sharing a OneDrive folder to internal users, the system will make a copy of the email notification to the inviter.  However, if the folder is shared to external users, the email will be only sent to the external user, NO copy is sent to the inviter. The inviter should receive a copy of the email sent to external users as well because then the inviter has a confirmation that he sent the invite. This also allows the inviter to refer back to the email to make sure he has already sent the invitation (or ensure the correct email address was used).

comments.text: Very interesting to follow the invitations!! I need it too

header: Add IRM option to Office 365 Groups
idea_text: Give users the ability to enable or not enable IRM for their files, whether the group is public or private, this should be available..

header: Ability to Share SharePoint Site with all members of an office 365 group
idea_text: To email a group of users, we can use office 365 group. To share a site with a group of users, we can use SharePoint user groups. We need to do both often and has to rely on 2 different things. It is good to have the ability to share a site with all members of the group instead of with the group email id.

comments.text:
There has to be a more efficient means of creating either a SHAREPOINT Group or a DOMAIN Group, rather than by one email address at a time.
Moreover, these Groups need to function across all apps!  Imagine creating a Sharepoint Group with 400 people, only to be able to manage this Group in increments of 30 names at a time.  There is no means to PRINT this list.  Or import it or export it.
A Domain Group doesn't work in SHAREPOINT.  
Where Domain or Sharepoint, a list of names needs to be easily managed, including PRINTING the full list and VIEWING the full list.  With all these wonderful apps, the process is stalled by requiring redundant inputting of names.

idea_text: add attachments to MS forms (Google forms has included )

header: Ability to prepend to subject for distribution groups.
idea_text: Currently this is not a feature of Office 365 (Confirmed by Microsoft Support today 31-03-17) as it is only possible to prepend the subject line on individual accounts not distribution groups.

comments.text: This is my assumption.  Given that distribution groups can't munge headers for DMARC compliance (similar to Mailman and Google Groups), Microsoft can't implement the feature to modify the subject because it would break DKIM signatures.
Agree with the others, our company is migrating from another service where this was a simple feature to setup. Kind of shocked to see it's not possible with Office365
Yes from me to! Should been in from start!
definitely a needed feature. It is genuinely useful for the recipients of a distribution group email to have clarity that the email was sent to (by name) a distribution group.

header: Audit Log reporting i.e. viewed, accessed, deleted items
idea_text: Ability to audit on who accessed a file, downloaded a file, deleted a file, edited/modified a file

comments.text: Are files audited for download/access in the Sharepoint logging?  I've seen the info there for accessing files.  However there doesn't seem to be any auditing of accessing conversations or files attached to conversations?
And to have a count on #downloads, etc.

header: Use workflow on documents in Office 365 Groups library
idea_text: Use SharePoint like workflows to apporove or review documents. There is no tool to manage document status and start a controlled process.

header: Allow ability to map drive for group files
idea_text: Ability to map a network drive or location to access group files without having to use the browser and without having to sync all the files to local drive.

comments.text:
That will use webDAV which is horrible. You should really just use the newest OneDrive Sync client.
I have created a script to fully automate the provisioning of the sync relationship with the Group and OneDrive.

You can actually do this already.  Here are the steps:
1. Open the group document library in Internet Explorer. (Do not use EDGE).
2. Make sure your group site is in your trusted sites in Internet Explorer.
3. Click the Upload File button.
4. On the screen that comes up click the Upload Files using Explorer link.
5.  When Explorer opens you can use the link that opens in explorer to map a drive to.

header: Set the PrimarySmtpAddress of a Group without Global Administrator permissions
idea_text:
It is not possible to set the PrimarySmtpAddress of an Office 365 Group without granting the service account global administrator permissions.  I've already explored this option with Microsoft Support and we both came to the conclusion that the least privileged approach currently requires global administrator.  Commands explored:Set-UnifiedGroup -Identity guid -PrimarySmtpAddress ""The ProxyAddresses property is read-only in the Graph API for Groups:
No options to update the PrimarySmtpAddress:
We are running Azure automation scripts and Azure web jobs to scan our Office 365 tenant for specific object states.  We would like to limit the number of service accounts requiring global administrator permissions with a least privileged approach.

comments.text: It would actually be nice to be able to do this in the Team App

Can't afford to lose the vast Amazon community to the Amazon Cloud.  $50 to $200 market for Amazon Tablets makes the upside for Microsoft as vast as the size of Amazon's community. header: Drag and Drop supports folders
idea_text: We need the basic function of folder support for drag and drop (and uploads).

reaction.note: We agree, and we’re working with the SharePoint team to resolve this limitation. Follow their uservoice request here: .

header: Add a function switch to enable/disable Planner, Teams, StaffHub etc.
idea_text: An O365 group has many different functions, e.g. Planner, Teams, StaffHub, Connectors, OneNote, OneDrive, Calendar etc.It would be great if an admin could block/unblock the individual functions of each group, because not every group needs all of those functions.

header: Remove the unsubscribe option.
idea_text: We would love the ability to use Office 365 groups to allow our users to manage their own lists. Sort of like distribution lists. However, since the users can unsubscribe from receiving them in their Inbox that defeats the purpose of why we would use them. If this could be removed we would use these groups a lot.

comments.text: Should not have been flagged; my apologies for the mouse error.This item has been posted several times, with one marked as answered by an admin, but the admin answered the OPPOSITE question instead.  Yes - we need to be able to KEEP people in required groups.  MS is pushing us to quit using DL's, so we need to set some groups up with mandatory membership.

header: Possibility to upgrade a security group to an office 365 group
idea_text:
If you want to upgrade security groups to office 365 groups there is no option to do it except to delete the security group, wait for the e-mail adress to be approved and create a new office 365 group.
The waiting period is very long and if you have permissions coupled with the security group all users can't use their permissions.

header: Do not FORCE Office 365 groups when SysAdmins are trying to create distribution groups!
idea_text: When trying to create a distribution group, you still INSIST on routing the admin the the Office 365 group creation. There are very specific reasons someone would chose Office 365 vs Standard distribution group. You force us to that stupid option even though we specifically chose Distribution Group. Remove this, and make the fields actually what they are supposed to be. If I chose Office 365 group, send me to office 365 group creation. If I chose Distribution group, send me to distribution group and not Office 365 group. If I chose Shared, send me to shared. For you to do this is in bad taste, and really horrible and I hope this is not the direction your company plans to move in. You will be giving your competitors help because they do what the Admin wants, not what you are trying to promote.

comments.text:
As a workaround you can create the distribution group from  the O365 admin center.
It will specifically let you create as a distribution group and not a O365 group.
Amen!! It's almost as though Microsoft thinks they know what I want better than I do. This is so annoying.

Is this for real?  I'm trying to create a DG, not an O365G, but it's forcing me to do latter regardless of which selection I choose from the drop-down.  Do I need to go through PowerShell to create a DG now?
I can't believe that more people have not voted on this.  Someone must not have been QCing another's work when approving this.

header: Prevent users from closing the install status window
idea_text: We're doing a small pilot with users where the installation of Office 2016 ProPlus is not done silently - done such that users can see that the installation is in progress.  However we have some users on slow networks and thus the installation may take quite a while, some of these users think that something failed and they end up closing the progress status window which causes issues for our installation process.  It would be nice to have a way to disable the close on the progress status window, similar to installing a MSI application - the progress bar is there but the user cannot close it.

comments.text: Agree this would be a nice feature since when users interrupt the process this leads to issues and support calls.
This is definitely needed

header: Hide members in a group from each other. Conversation is from Group Creater and read only.
idea_text: Hi, We're a medical weight loss center with multiple locations (franchisees). We're about to expand nationally. We want A Group with members of each location, but they need to be hidden from each other. This would be great. The OneNote would be used as our Training Manual. Planner would be used to reveal new products and services in development. The files would be available to all members. We want the conversation to be announcements which is a one way conversation from the group creator to all Members (who can't see each other) and can't respond to the conversation. We use Groups between corporate and individual medical practice locations already. Groups are great, but we need the ability to update training manuals, documents, flyers, and brochures in one special group for easy distribution. At the same time we don't want the medical practices to know who's a member of the group for privacy reasons. If this can't be done then we'd love the ability to share documents, trainings, manuals, flyers, brochures, etc to our Medical practice groups, but we need to shut off the ability for the practices to see who has access to the files, i.e, to whom the files have been shared. Hidden members of shared documents would be good for Security and competitive reasons and would save us time. Documents mentioned above would always be up to date the Modern Way, but with hidden members for privacy. Keep up the great work. We don't know how a business can remain competitive without Office 365.Thanks.

header: Enable confirm/modifying the Storage of the Office 365 group site in the modern UI.
idea_text:
*English follows Japanese■Title(件名)：Office365 グループ サイトの記憶域の確認、変更についてEnable confirm/modifying the Storage of the Office 365 group site from the SharePoint Admin Center in the modern UI.
***************
■Description(内容):
新しい SharePoint 管理センターにて、Office365 グループ サイトの記憶域の確認や変更ができるようにしてほしい。​​It will be very useful that you can confirm and modify the Storage of the Office 365 group site from the SharePoint Admin Center in the modern UI.Thank you for your consideration.

header: See Group Calendar Meeting Response Comments from Attendees
idea_text: See Group Calendar Meeting Response Comments from Attendees - When a user responds to a Group Meeting request, we would like a Group conversation to be created to track the responses and related comments, or add the comments to the Group Meeting tracking information.

header: When a member leaves a group, that groups calender item should be auto-removed from users personal calendar
idea_text:
Our teams collaborate in Office 365 Groups and also adds/creates meeting appointments for the group, which is an expected behaviour. As team members move across different teams, members are frequently removed from the Office 365 Group. The problem is that the scheduled meeting will still be on the users personal calender, even after being removed as a member of the Office 365 Group. The user must MANUALLY remove the meetings from his personal calender. 
 
Is there a way to automatically remove scheduled group meetings from the user calender when the user is removed from the group?

header: Group Calendar disable default notifications
idea_text: Our office wished to implement a vacation calendar that would house every employees vacation schedules. However, we would like to disable the automatic notification every member of the group gets when someone adds their vacation/meeting time. Apparently this was implemented earlier, as noted here:We shipped the ability to add an appointment that is only shown in the groups calendar. The minimum build to get this feature is 16.0.8429.1000, and the flight is now rolling out to Insiders fast, and will rollout to the other channels in the regular cadence over the next few months.

comments.text: We are having the same issue.  It is inefficient and a waste of everyone's time to see all calendar events through email as well as on the calendar.  That is the purpose of the calendar.
We have the same issue at my office and am looking for a response to the above.  Is this possible and if so, what is the process to disable?  Thanks!

header: Add topics or tags to conversations
idea_text: Similar to Yammer conversations/posts, I'd like to be able to tag group conversation posts with a topic and have an easy way to filter by tags within the group

header: Document management in Files tab
idea_text: Within the Files tab in Office365 Groups, only View, New and Upload options are visible. This should be much more in line with normal document libraries where we have options to view the document information panel and delete a document. It seems as is this experience is being rebuilt within the Files tab of Groups, whereas I would expect that the experience is reused from what it already present in SharePoint. Please provide a more consistent experience, preferably just use the same thing as SharePoint uses so that both experiences also update simultaneously when something changes there.

comments.text: I agree with this suggestion; it makes more sense to have all options available from each view. I also feel that the browse library field is actually a better starting point when you enter into the files section - it does not really make sense to me that there are this many different ways to view documents.
Yes, this would, as Jasper says, provide a consistent experience to have options to delete a document from the main "Files" view.

header: Distribution Group Default view
idea_text: When accessing the "Groups" section of the web app and trying administer groups, the prem version of Outlook used to have a "Groups I own" pane that made it easy to scroll a list of groups the user owned and make changes quickly.  The O365 functionality requires the user to go through a number of steps to filter for groups the user owns.  It would be helpful if the "Groups I own" pane came back or the user could save their filter as a default, rather than needing to recreate it each time.

header: Convert Shared Mailbox to Office 365 Group Mailbox
idea_text: Can we have the ability to either convert or import shared mailbox data into Office 365 Group Mailbox.

comments.text:
Have  a look here: 
It is an exchange migration software called Kernel Migrator for Exchange may be it helps you to solve your issues..
This is a duplicate idea of

header: Ability to remove from folder pane if not being used
idea_text: Having the groups options permanently in the folder pane is annoying as if they are not being used, these take up valuable space & restrict the amount of mailbox folders that can be seen underneath without scrolling. There should be an option to remove these from the folder pane if they are not required.

idea_text: Disable user create office365 group but at the same time they can use planner and teams and sharepoint

Here, you can find the manual solution for NSF to PST file conversion. But before performing this operation, recommended to have a backup copy of NSF file. Step 1: Export NSF to CSV
(a)	Launch IBM Lotus application
(b)	Open File > Open > Lotus Notes
(c)	Now a window appears, browse the NSF file and click on Open button
(d)	On the File menu, click Export option
(e)	In dialogue box, enter file name, location and file save type
(f)	Select the CSV format for the file
(g)	On the dialogue box, click on OK button
(h)	Now, exported data saved in CSV format.Step 2: Import CSV file into MS Outlook
(a)	Open Outlook
(b)	Click on File menu > Open & Export > Import/Export option
(c)	In Import & Export wizard. Select Import from another program or file from the options. Click Next button
(d)	Select CSV as file type and click on Next button
(e)	Click on Browse and select the CSV file
(f)	Select Outlook folder where you want to export all data
(g)	Select the Import “file name.csv” into folder: Drafts. Now, click on Finish button
(h)	Now, all data imported to Microsoft OutlookIn case this solution doesn’t work then you can try professional tool as well. I have found Stellar Converter for NSF professional tool in IBM forum. Through this you can easily convert NSF to PST file.Visit here:

header: Consistent navigation pane/menu for Office groups
idea_text:
Currently there is no consistent navigation menu when browsing through Office goups sections. It is very confusing for an end user going from conversations, to calendar, to files and then to planner.
The UI/UX is terrible.

comments.text:
Add a dedicated app page which consistently links across all tools, including Planner, Teams, SharePoint default library library, SharePoint site homepage, Outlook Groups (only place to manage users and icon at present).
This goes along with my request for more consistent naming across those pages. (SEE here )
This really does need fixing.  There is no way end users will be able to navigate effectively in O365 groups.

header: Stop sharing folders
idea_text: The "stop sharing" feature is now available for files (at least in one of my first-release tenants), but is still missing for folders. Please add the "Stop sharing" function to folders to work similar as for files.

comments.text: Please also allow us to specify which users we want to stop sharing with. Currently I can only stop sharing with everyone except owners. I just want to stop sharing with one user.

header: Be able to view Group calendars in Outlook on iOS
idea_text: The Groups app on iOS no longer works (it just links to Outlook), so now we cannot view Group calendars on iOS.

comments.text: I agree. When will this functionality be available on outlook iOS?  This doesn’t show up as functionality you are looking to add on your iOS outlook roadmap but it should be!!

header: merge 0365 email groups
idea_text: Merge dublicate 0365 group

comments.text: Can I use mail merge with office 365?

header: Provide Outlook Notifications or Emails When New Group Conversations are Made
idea_text: Users who are a member of a group will only see notifications for new conversations or group assignments if they go and search for that specific group.  Conversations to group members will go unnoticed especially for those who are a member of a number of groups.

comments.text: Im surprised there isnt a small desktop notification app published yet

header: Create categories or flags for Group e-mails
idea_text: If you could in someway mark an e-mail for everybody in the group be able to know what happened to each e-mail, it would help a lot the productivity of the group. On large groups, where each e-mail needs to be read and processed, knowing which one was already processed or which one needs more attention or which one you can postpone is very important.

header: features to migrate the Office 365 Groups between tenants.
idea_text: The groups cannot be selected when importing/exporting PST files in Outlook. Currently, we don't have any features to migrate the Office 365 Unified Groups between tenants.

comments.text: One can try Kernel Migrator for Exchange migration software, which can help in Office 365 to Office 365, Exchange to Office 365, Exchange to Exchange to exchange migration. For more information, visit:

header: Group mailbox spam filter
idea_text: At present the spam filter default policy is not applied to Office 365 Groups or distribution Group mailboxes. If you attempt to add a new policy and define the "Applied to" as a Group mailbox the new policy will not save. We need to be able to filter mail sent to Group mailboxes.

comments.text: this is crazy!  no spam filter on Group emails.  wtf are they thinking.

We tried creating the New Spam Filter Policy with the Office 365 Group mailbox and Distribution Group mailbox, in Allow list with the given option ... < Recipeint is ...>
We got the error as < Sendto predicate does not allow distribution Groups ...>Resolution: Further we tried creating the New Spam Filter Policy with the Office 365 Group mailbox and Distribution Group mailbox, in Allow list with the given option ... < Recipeint is the Member of ...> then tried adding the Office 365 Group mailbox and Distribution Group mailbox and we were able to Save the changes

header: Set domain name of Office365 Group at time of Group Creation
idea_text: When creating a Distribution List or Mail Enabled Security Group through the admin panel, the domain portion of the list/group is enabled and you can choose any domain that's been set up for the account.  For Office365 groups it's locked to just the default domain.  We are a family of differently domained companies in the tenant and we need groups for all of our domains.  I keep seeing multi-domain support as being 'Boom it's Done' but the ability to create groups in any domain is not done.

header: Add a settings to control the Group automaticlly creating the SharePoint Site Collections
idea_text: Dear Microsoft Office 365 designers,I would like that the Office 365 admin center has the setting to control or prevent Office 365 Group automatically generating the SharePoint Online Site Collections. Current SharePoint Online Admin doesn't even have the permission or the SharePoint Admin dashboard doesn't even can see these site collections!. These site collections can be opened to the outside world and under control of the group owner. If the company has 2000 groups it will be the IT nightmare to manage them site collections. The bottom line is the Office 365 SharePoint Online Admin should able to access all the site collections naturally and automatically. George

comments.text:
SharePoint Service Administrators should be site collection administrators for all SharePoint sites in their tenant regardless of how they are created (Office 365 Group, Planner, etc.)
This has become a big problem for us from a support standpoint.

header: Include Unified Groups in Get-Recipient Results
idea_text: Get-Recipient lists all mail enabled objects, except UnifiedGroups. When searching for the object an email address belongs to, we would normally use "Get-Recipient <>. It would be great for addresses assigned to unified groups, which are not included in the results, to show up in the results.

header: Creating folders for managing files in a group
idea_text: We love that our group has access to all of the files (uploaded, emailed, etc), but we have tons of files and it's difficult to find what we need.  Please enable just the owner of the group to be able to create folders and move everyone's files into those folders.

header: Granular notification settings
idea_text:
Please provide a more granular way to opt in/out of notifications both via email and the notification-feature in the mobile app, e.g. based on:
- when I am @mentioned
- when a message is marked as important
- when files are changed
- when specific planner tasks are created/updated/edited/deleted (something like "observe task" in Trello)
- for messages from specific connectors (not all connectors)

comments.text: This is a clearly thought-through solution.  Shame it will never be implemented.

header: Office 365 Groups moderated by owner
idea_text: Mails from members of that group can always send to this group. But mails from senders outside this group need to be accepted by moderator / owner. This is like set-distributiongroup -ModeratedBy

header: Add group ID header when message delivered using group
idea_text: When a mail is delivered using Office365 distribution groups, there is no trace of what group the message was delivered to. For efficient filtering, a message header should be added to uniquely identify the distribution group that the message was delivered through. Today, I can only filter incoming messages on the recipient address and besides being unreliable, this fails when a message is sent with a BCC to a group or when the sender is sending it via a remote distribution group where our group is a member.

comments.text: Our users are members of dozens of O365 Groups, and are often following the groups to receive messages to their individual inboxes. We will BCC the O365 Group when communicating with external users, in order to keep our internal team included on updates/communications. Since there is no way to filter incoming messages when the O365 Group is BCC'd, our inboxes are exploding and there is no way to tell where the messages originate.This would be so easy to do with a message header, identifying the O365 Group, which we could then use for inbox filtering rules.
Sadly, almost 3 years later, and still no movement on this one.

header: system.structuredquery.virtual.from in feld search in outlook
idea_text: when you select mail adresse in field search in outlook you have recherche system.structuredquery.virtual.from in field and search is nul

comments.text: Can you please answer same problem for me thanks

header: Add an Office 365 Group Calendar to your Outlook Calendar
idea_text: You should be able to add an Office 365 Group Calendar to your Outlook Calendar. Currently I cannot use the group calendar in Outlook, and many users prefer to be able to use both Outlook and Office 365.

comments.text: Also see this thread:

It would be great if all the group features (OneDrive, Calendars, etc) that are available in cached mode in Outlook client were also available in online mode. Our school cannot enable cached mode for several reasons but its a real shame we can't use these awesome features in the client and have to switch to OWA
Also, open the group calendar on a smartphone in the default calendar app (so I can put it next to my personal calendar)

header: Allow Group Notebook Permissioning From Staff Notebook Creator App
idea_text: The Staff and Class Notebook Creator Sharepoint Applications add additional permissions on a OneNote notebook. It would be helpful if the option existed for the Groups Notebook to take on the permissioning characteristics from this Application. For those of you not familiar with the App, here's a walkthrough:

comments.text: This should be submitted to the OneNote team. There they can add an option to the creator app to allow the user to choose the notebook location when they create the class/staff notebook, that would be more flexible.

header: Add folder view and sort capability to "Files" view
idea_text: I just got off a tech support call with Microsoft where the tech told me that the lack of a folder view in Groups' Files view was by design.  I don't believe it, and if it is true, it doesn't make sense.  Please enable the ability to view folders and to sort them by clicking on the headers.

comments.text: PS also see:

I agree with the others that this is counter intuitive. Knowing the technical background I understand why it's so, but users are confused by this. They create a folder structure in the SharePoint Documents library and when viewing things from the Files tab, the structure is gone and they see the documents in a flat view. To users, this comes across as "they deleted my structure!".
Agree, we're getting the same request. Customers want to see folders in the files view of a group without having to go the extra clicks of "browse library".

I've learned that this folder view contains files from various sources like Email Attachments, Files Shared with Me, Files from OneDrive and Files from Sharepoint.  I would like to be able to browse this folder view using the sources as the top level "folders", if you catch my meaning.

header: Site content, Site Settings, Add App pages
idea_text:
Site content, Site Settings, Add App pages  listing when clicking on the gear icon, currently redirects to listing the documents in the default document library. 
Can we have acces to the proper pages to add document libraries, lists, and manage the site collection like in regular sharepoint site?_layouts/15/settings.aspx
_layouts/15/viewlsts.aspx
_layouts/15/addanapp.aspxinstead of being redirected to _layouts/15/GroupsDocuments.aspx
If groups are not meant to propose those options, why having the links proposed in the gear menu?

comments.text: This is a bug for some users, not all! For some (us myself) it actually works as intended on the same site as it doesn't for others.
I need this answered as well, please.  Microsoft??

header: Improve Outlook online and Outlook desktop perfomance when user is member of 500+ groups
idea_text: When user is member of 500+ groups, on click of "More" button under the Groups, Outlook Desktop become unresponsive for period of time and is slow to load the groups. Improve the performance so the groups can be loaded faster.When user is member of 500+ groups, on click of "More" button under the Groups, Outlook Online become unresponsive for period of time and is slow to load the groups Improve the performance so the groups can be loaded faster.When user is member of 500+ groups, on click of calendar icon, Outlook Online become unresponsive for period of time and is slow to load the calendar page. Improve the performance so the calendar can be loaded faster.

header: Expand the calendars of individual group members in Outlook 2016
idea_text:
In Outlook 2013 it is possible to expand the individual calendars when adding a Office 365 group. This is currently not possible in Outlook 2016. You can only view the group calendar.
It would be very usefull to see all the calendars from the different group members – in addition to the group calendar – if you choose to expand the group in calendar view.

comments.text: Until we can do this, groups are nearly useless for our company. We rely on distribution groups instead so we can expand.

header: Do not create duplicate calendar invites when forwarding an invite to an Office 365 Group
idea_text: TL;DR: Forwarding calendar invites to an O365 group creates a calendar invite in the group and re-sends the invite to all original recipients on the invite (whether they are in the O365 group or not). I would expect this to work like a traditional distribution group where new members are added to existing invite.So, imagine this... There are two groups A and B. Group A is a collection of individuals already on the invite. Some members of Group A may be in Group B, but there are those in Group A who are NOT in Group B. Group B is the O365 group that I want to get the invite. However, since I do not "own" the invite, I Forward the invite to Group B. This forwarding action then adds the invite to the Group B O365 Calendar. Because of the action of adding to the O365 calendar, it re-sends the invite to Group A as well as Group B. I have attached a screenshot of what this looks like to a user.This has nothing to do with the calendar on the web. It's not an overlay, it is a duplicate. When I veiw the O365 Calendar and my calendar on OWA, I see 4 of the SAME invite as it is duplicated in both my personal calendar and the O365 calendar (I'd expect to see 2-one in each calendar).The issue isn't that the Group B members are getting the invite, the issue is that the invite is being duplicated and re-sent to EVERYONE on the invite.

header: Implement webhook capabilities for Office 365 Groups
idea_text:
IT Administrator might have the requirement to trigger some actions before, during, or after the provisioning of Office 365 Groups. The same holds for the decommissioning of Office 365 Groups.Example: we would like to apply group policies to an individual group after it has been provisioned. Today, you can achieve such goals with individual services such as SharePoint Online. You might have similar requirements coming from other services too. Or you might have the requirement that needs to be applied for all services in your tenant (e.g. disable third party apps for groups coming from SharePoint Online and Exchange Online but not Teams).A required webhook that comes handy is the one that is triggered immediately after the addition of a group. These are the webhooks that I could imagine:
- Before-creation: validate with the webhook if the group can be created or not. if not return an error message specified by the webhook
- After-creation: apply some changes to a dedicated group after it has been created
- Before-deletion: validate with the webhook if the group can be deleted

header: Office 365 Group Proxy addresses and Domain Deletetion
idea_text:
Hi Microsoft Team,Found a bug within Office 365 groups and the way it handles the proxy addresses.A client of mine wanted to remove a domain from their Office 365 tenant although they had issues doing so because an Office 365 Group was using a proxy address of the domain they wanted to  delete. So I went ahead and removed this proxy address from PS and even changed the primary SMTP address to another domain and it would still popup with an error. I confirmed and checked to see if the proxy address was removed from the Office 365 group in Powershell and it looked OK! I discussed this with Microsoft Support and they said to backup the office 365 groups, delete the groups and re create them.I decided to run the fix like this.1.	Changed all primary SMTP addresses for Office 365 Groups that                need to be deleted
2.	Deleted all Office 365 groups using the old proxy address (Allegedly)
3.	Deleted Domain in Office 365
4.	Restored all Office 365 GroupsImport-Module AzureADPreview
Connect-AzureAD
Get-UnifiedGroup -Identity | Remove-UnifiedGroupRemove Domain
Remove-MsolDomain -DomainName "Domainname"To Restore:
Get-AzureADMSDeletedGroup
Restore-AzureADMSDeletedDirectoryObject –IdIf you have a huge list to restore, run
Get-AzureADMSDeletedGroup | Restore-AzureADMSDeletedDirectoryObject

header: Add a "find & replace" function in OneNote

Let's add a simple feature to find one piece of text and replace it with another (one by one or for all instances in a page/section/notebook) - just like exists in Word.

header: Allow msExchExtensionCustomAttribute1 to 5 to be consumed by Exchange Online.
idea_text:
Allow msExchExtensionCustomAttribute1 to 5 to be consumed by Exchange Online.
This would allow the replacement of distribution groups with dynamic distribution groups, eliminating the use of long-running PowerShell scripts to populate the static distribution groups.

comments.text:
As an example of how useful this would be; we are a school in the UK and use distribution groups for everything (classes, pupils guardians, roles within the school such as Head of Year 9, extra curricular groups) and are regularly synchronising 4,500 groups and 55,000 members!
The staff love these groups and it's greatly improved accuracy and reduced the time to communicate effectively - which means emails do get sent rather than being lost in the ItsTooHardForMe box; except there is a massive overhead behind the scenes.
Being able to use extended custom attributes would reduce our powershell traffic with Office 365 by over 95% and massively simplify a dozen nasty powershell scripts and hundreds of recipient filters (this example was for just one value being in the list; the GAL filter is a nightmare!) :
New-AddressList -Name "AL_IT_Support" -RecipientFilter  {((RecipientType -eq 'UserMailbox') -and ((CustomAttribute1 -eq 'IT Support')-or(CustomAttribute2 -eq 'IT Support')-or(CustomAttribute3 -eq 'IT Support')-or(CustomAttribute4 -eq 'IT Support')-or(CustomAttribute5 -eq 'IT Support')-or(CustomAttribute6 -eq 'IT Support')-or(CustomAttribute7 -eq 'IT Support')-or(CustomAttribute8 -eq 'IT Support')-or(CustomAttribute9 -eq 'IT Support')-or(CustomAttribute10 -eq 'IT Support')))} -DisplayName "IT Support"

header: Allow non-cloud mailbox users to create O365 groups
idea_text: Having just spent nearly four months (!!!!!) on a support call with Microsoft...It turns out that if you don't have a cloud mailbox (in Exchange Online), then you can't create O365 Groups.Assigning an Exchange Online License isn't enough.So all those organisations who are still using on-prem Exchange.... you're out of luck.MS please support organisations who don't use Exchange Online.BTW the current work-around is to create a cloud based user (not one sync'ed through AD -> AzureAD), give them admin rights and then use that user to create O365 Groups...Poor, very poor.BTW Planner doesn't have this limitation, even though it goes off and creates O365 Groups....

comments.text: We have a similar problem in trying to support an environment with GMail for email, and O365/SharePoint/etc. for collaboration.It was somewhat painful, but workable, that we had to ensure we don't provision our users with Exchange Online mailboxes, as SharePoint doesn't look for an MX record for the domain if it knows about a Cloud Mailbox for a given user. Now that more O365 features are being released that require this we are forced to find external solutions.This means that as our processes evolve, we are using O365 less and less.

header: Amalgamate all document library files into the FILES tab in Office groups as a single flat view
idea_text: Currently the FILES tab is only linked to the Document Library when you create a new Group. This FILES tab will display all documents within this document library, in a flat view. However, if you create other document libraries, they are not visible in this FILES tab view, forcing the users to go to the SITE tab to find the additional document relevant to the group. My idea is that the FILES tab is able to read all the documents within the site and roll those up into the FILES tab, as a flat view, sorted by modified date, or use office graph to show you the most relevant document based on the user accessing it.

comments.text: We also have users that do not like the flat view and would prefer to see files in the standard sharepoint doc library view (that shows folders), as was the default before changes to the files view.  This appears to be a per-user setting, so allowing users to configure this option for themselves would be helpful.

End Result: I created 2 dynamic O365 groups. One which contained all employees and one which contained all contractors. 1.5hrs after they were created, I was notified that thousands of users were receiving an email. Some were getting 40+ emails spammed to their inbox. Those users with more than one email were generally getting Out of Office replies from other members. In addition, some users were replying to the group saying “Remove me” which was then getting spammed to everyone already added. So, I deleted the groups immediately 1.5hrs after they were created. However, emails continued to send for many hours after; they were probably queued. Unfortunately, we didn’t have the knowledge at the time to check/flush the queue.

header: Add/remove attendees from an event without emailing the other attendees
idea_text: Using the Office 365 Calendar REST API (specifically the "Update Events" calls) to add and remove attendees. Would like to add and remove attendees without triggering an update to all attendees.The docs clearly state:"If the user is the organizer, the server sends meeting updates to all attendees."Currently we are using the EWS API, which has a SendInvitationsMode flag which is basically the behaviour we desireIs it possible to get the same behaviour via the Graph API?

header: Email Notification for New Files Added to a Group
idea_text:
When adding a file to a Group Folder an email notification is provided to all within the group.
Same too for file modification.
Notification should be optional with the user controlling their notification level.

header: Disable calendar notifications
idea_text: Just simply have an option to disable default notifications when an event is created in the shared calendar. The organization has multiple events for various teams and everyone is getting notifications at almost every hour. This is not necessary.

header: HiddenGroupMembershipEnabled
idea_text:
Enable set HiddenGroupMembershipEnabled parameter to true/false after office365 group creation with cmdlet 
Set-UnifiedGroup -HiddenGroupMembershipEnabled $true
Set-UnifiedGroup -HiddenGroupMembershipEnabled $falseThis option (HiddenGroupMembershipEnabled) is today read-onlyPlease enable it soon as possibleThanks

comments.text: Yes, please add it.

header: Navigation buttons
idea_text: Make the conversation and notes link more clear inside files. People find it hard to navigate back to conversations within the files view

header: Dynamic Distribution List support for Manager field/property
idea_text:
Dynamic Distribution Lists should support using the Manager field/property. This would allow Managers to quickly communicate with Direct Reports in their organizational chart hierarchy without having to maintain a distribution list, or duplicating the Manager data as a CustomAttribute.
(duplicated from )

header: Prevent users to subscribe to a group
idea_text: We have a global O365 group with all the employees as members (joined). It is primarily used as a space for the main company shared calendar. In such global groups, it is sometimes desirable that employees do not subscribe to such a group at all, even by mistake (in order to avoid cluttering the personal calendar when appointments are created for only some employees as attendees i.e. not all). Can you add the possibility for the admin to disable subscriptions for a particular group (while still allowing joining the group)?

comments.text: this is a blocker in a Customer of mine, they don't want users receiving emails in their Inbox for complaince reasons...
In some cases is very important, if the user can submite will lose the tracking

header: provide a feedback button that can be configured to give feedback to the group owner
idea_text: The current feedback button helps Microsoft with product development but it would be nice to have an option to feedback to the site owner for matters relating to the content or layout of the group to help the owner to make it more relevant to its users.

header: Please make Dictate available in the Dutch language.
idea_text: We think Dictate in the Dutch language can really make work easier for our employees, especially those who are not working at a desk. There's 23 million people who speak Dutch as their first language.

header: Provide the function to set the Timezone according to each user's location when creating  Office365 group sites.
idea_text:
*English follows Japanese■Title(件名)：Office 365 グループ サイトのタイム ゾーンについてProvide the function to set the Timezone according to each user's location when creating  Office365 group sites.
***************
■Description(内容):
Office 365 グループ サイトは、作成時にタイム ゾーンの設定画面がないため、自動的にタイム ゾーン設定が "(UTC-8:00) 太平洋標準時 (米国およびカナダ)" ​で作成されてしまう。 
設定者のＰＣのタイムゾーンに合わせて設定するか、明示的にタイムゾーンを確認して設定する事が「あるべき仕様」と思いますので、改善を依頼します。​Currently, we are concerned about that the Timezone is automatically set up in the "(UTC - 8: 00) Pacific Standard Time (the US and Canada)" due to there is no Timezone setting available at the time of the creation of Office365 group sites.Since so many users are using the services in all over the world, we hope the feature will be improved enables explicitly confirming the Timezone which has set and setting it according to the Timezone of each user. Thank you for your continued support.

header: Office 365 グループに紐づいたサイトにおける社外共有の既定値について
idea_text: (English follows Japanese)SharePoint 管理センターから新規に作成したサイト コレクションは、外部共有オプションが既定で [組織外の共有を許可しない] に設定されていますが、Office 365 グループに紐づいたサイト コレクションについては、[組織のディレクトリに既に存在する外部ユーザーとの共有のみ許可します] に設定されています。Office 365 グループのサイト コレクションにおける既定の設定値を、SharePoint 管理センターから作成したサイト コレクション同様 [組織外の共有を許可しない] に変更したいのですが、その方法がありません (Set-sposite を使用することで、個別に設定値を変更できますが、既定値の変更はできない)。管理上困るので、Office 365 グループに紐づいたサイト コレクションに関する既定の共有設定値を変更する手段の提供を検討ください。Regarding default sharing setting for Office 365 group related site collectionsIf you create a new team site via SharePoint admin center, it has "Don't allow sharing outside of your organization" value for sharing option. On the other hand, Office 365 group related site collection has "Allow sharing only with the external users that already exist in your organization's directory" for the same option. I want to change default value for Office 365 group related site collection to the same one as the site collections created via SharePoint admin center but there is no way to do so (using Set-sposite will change value for each site collection but you cannot change default value). This is troublesome as an administrator and please let us have way to change default value for sharing option for Office 365 group related site collections.

header: Please! Please support mobile devices fully with Outlook eg:Shared contacts
idea_text: Make Outlook on Mobile devices more fictional (active sync!!)Mobile Devices are used by everyone now days, if not then email will fade away.

header: Default "allow outside senders" for groups

idea_text:

There is script that can disable post creation.  This is not sufficient since the script would have to be run many many times.

idea_text:
In AzureAD you can limit the invitation of guests to admins and users with the role "guest invitors". Then Disable members to invite guests.
This currently leads to users with the role "guest invitors" not beeing able to invte users to teams.
It would be nice if Teams could adopt the way it works within azure ad.

comments.text:
I now "Enabled members to invite guests" in AAD. Now The Owners can invite new external Guests, but not anyone with the role "guest invitors".
Regular Users can´t invite guests, that´s what i wanted to achieve. Nevertheless it would be cool if the role would work.

header: Stop Office 365 groups disappearing from personal OneDrive
idea_text: Stop Office 365 groups disappearing from personal OneDrive. Across both organisations I work at we frequently have staff complaining to say that they cannot see an Office 365 group listed within their personal OneDrive.The solution to this is to revert to 'Classic OneDrive' or 'Follow' the group.After following the group overtime this option is removed and staff then have to go and follow this again.We think that we shoudl have the ability to pin groups so that they are never automatically 'unfollowed'

comments.text: Some of Office groups missing on user OneDrive is bad user experience and leads to many support cases. Tapping "follow" from site settings is frustrating. All groups should be seen by default at Onedrive.

header: Automatically share attachments with members using Office 365 group email address
idea_text:
Customers want to check how to automatically share attachments with members using Office 365 group email address, but automatically attach image attachments sent to Office 365 group，
that can not be browsed on the SharePoint site.
So, 
・Want to achieve by using SPS 2013 workflow + Web API.
・Want to achieve it by using Microsoft workflow foundation

header: Add Sharepoint Groups Document folder to Explorer (Not IE) Favorites
idea_text: Users are used to saving documents quickly to mapped network drives by choosing File, Save As and then selecting the drive/folder from the navigation menu on the left side of the Save As browse window. When migrating data from a SAN based network drive to Groups, it doesn't seem easy to add shortcuts to a Group Shared Documents folder without sync'ing the entire group first.  Even if you can get a shortcut added to the left side menu of the Save As window, you cannot rename it from the default "Shared Documents".  If the user needs to create more than 1 location on SharePoint Groups, it'll also be named Shared Documents or Shared Documents(1), adding confusion. You can't create a link and add ti Favorites or Quick Access. All the ways to get the shortcuts there are clunky workarounds that you can't document and send to an inexperienced user base so IT staff will visit every user and manually or the users will save docs to their desktop, then open sharepoint and drag and drop the files there. Mapping a Network drive requires three steps (add to trusted sites, etc) resulting in a call to IT.My idea is to make mapping locations to Sharepoint Groups Documents folders, adding them to Quick Access or Favorites and giving staff the ability to name them appropriately so easy a caveman can do it. If this is already possible, then my idea is to make the documentation easier to find and make sure o365 support technicians are aware of how to accomplish this.

comments.text:
We're trying to do exactly the same. Apparently it IS possible, but the people who know how are few and far between.....
I'm waiting on some info from "someone who knows". Will post back if I find out.

header: It's impossible in OWA to select all messages
idea_text: If you check the select option (mailbox) in OWA, only the first emails are selected and not all the messages.

comments.text: As a workaround - try to control-minus the zoom level to include more messages on the screen.  The 'select all' behaviour appears to only select messages that fit into the current viewfinder of the message list pane..  One vote since it's not a deal-breaker of a problem.

header: Restrict Owner of group to edit group name
idea_text: If users cannot create groups then owners of groups should also be restricted from changing the group name / description.

comments.text: Hi, I believe this should be implemented.
I feel in an effort to maintain standardization in larger and more restricted orgs, group names should locked down so that the owner should not be able to change them...

header: Enterprise Setting for Modern Features in O365 Groups (separate than SharePoint)
idea_text: Currently we have all modern features turned off in O365/SharePoint because they are jacking with our designed/custom intranet.However, we havent rolled out Groups to anyone yet, and are experimenting with them.  It would be nice to have an enterprise setting to TURN ON modern features in O365 Groups, separately from the SharePoint setting.If turned on, then the default list/library/page would all be Modern unless the users explicitly turned them back to classic.  As it is right now, we have to manually turn on modern features in groups because of that setting, and Groups by nature are more ready for modern than SharePoint intranets that have been carefully designed and crafted.

I want members of the Office 365 groups to be changed by changing members of AD security group.
I links personnel information with the AD security group.
By changing members of the security group at the time of a personnel change, the SharePoint side set the right permission without changing the permission.

header: Recent update removed group member who sends the email will not receive in Inbox
idea_text: Office 365 group member who sends email to the group will not receive that email in Inbox - Can I have this feature back?

comments.text: I agree - we don't live in the 'Groups' area of Office365, mostly in the Inbox or a mail app on a phone. A lot of people rely on sending to a 'Group' (that used to be a distribution list) and then if they are a member of the Group they think the email didn't get sent correctly. We converted a DL to a Group to test it and the ability to have a shared files for the group is nice, but we really need to let the sender's email appear in the Inbox of all group members, even the sender if they are a member.

header: Customisability of Left Navigation on Modern Team Sites
idea_text:
Left navigation on modern team sites need to be more customisable. 
1) Ability to change font sizes
2) Ability to resize the navigation so that nav items don't get truncated.
3) Ability to choose whether to collapse or expand by default
4) Provide spacers / lines for organisaing the nav panel.

comments.text: I agree, more flexibility within the navigation pane would be useful. Especially around the truncated text. Users have notified me that when using more than one word, the navigator entry is difficult to understand. You can hover over the text to reveal the full entry, but this isn't obvious to all users.

header: Outlook 2016 support for groups in a hybrid Office 365 setup
idea_text: Office 365 Groups in a hybrid setup are not visible in Outlook 2016. I think Groups are a great concept, but this is holding me back of promoting their use in our organisation.

comments.text: O365 groups suck for people using hybrid.  Microsoft ties lots of things to them and so you have issues when you try to disable them, but even if you don't disable them (as if anybody in education wants all their students to be able to create groups willy nilly), you have lots of problems because you have to use an exchange online mailbox for them- unless, I guess, as Dirk commented- you can pony up the $6 - $9 per user, per month, for an Azure premium subscription.
The groups support also does not allow owners who are not using their mailbox on the cloud nor does it allow for people with on premises mailboxes to view message threads in the group mailbox.

Whilst in Hybrid groups will only apppear if autodiscover DNS record is pointing to an IP on the autodiscover.outlook.cvom list.I have edited my hosts file and confirm that groups now appear within Outlook 2016.

I've opened a case for this. These are the requirements to use Groups in a hybrid setup:-An on-premises exchange 2013 or newer server 
-AD connect 
-A subscription to azure AD premium - this allows group write-back

I support the request to unlimit the number of groups shown on Outlook for Mac.
