(We are a school, we decide what groups they are in, not them).

header: O365 Group incorrect behavior for newly added members
idea_text:
O365 Group incorrect behavior in the following scenario:
a new group is created with the following checkbox ticked off: "Send copies of all group messages and events to members' inboxes" (in the Admin console, the equivalent checkbox is named "Subscribe new members").
After that, some new members are added to the group. They have the status Joined and are not subscribed (as is expected based on checkbox above). Powershell confirms this as the following returns no users subscribed:
Get-UnifiedGroupLinks -Identity <group email> -LinkType SubscriberHowever, when a new calendar meeting is created in the Group, which is not sent to the whole group (or to any attendee for that matter), all newly added members receive the calendar meeting into thier private inbox and calendar, as if they were subscribed (and they're not!).
The meeting does show a message offering the user the option to Unsubscribe to stop receiving all future updates.
Only after that click the users are truly unsubscribed from the group (but still joined, as it should be), although they should have been unsubscribed from the start as per checkbox above.
Effectively, this makes the checkbox mentioned above ("Send copies of all group messages and events to members' inboxes") non working.
There is no way to control this default behavior either via Admin panel or Powershell (the users are effectively shown as unsubscribed, although they initilly ARE subscribed).Please fix this ASAP!

comments.text:
This is apparently by design as per Microsoft service request: members added by the group owner are automatically subscribed regardless the status of the checkbox  "Send copies of all group messages and events to members' inboxes". This checkbox appears to have meaning only when users themselves request access to a group.
That should probably be clarified in the documentation or GUI somehow.
Also, there is no way to unsubscribe users either via GUI or Powershell cmdlet (Remove-UnifiedGroupLinks) nor a way to at least see who's subscribed in such a way (again, Get-UnifiedGroupLinks does not show that kind of "initial" subscription).
Can you please at least update Get-UnifiedGroupLinks cmdlet so it really shows ALL subscribers (i.e. even those subscribed when added to the group by the group owner)?

header: Allow Office 365 group SharePoint sites to use the Communications Template
idea_text: The communications template allows for a full width page design, unlike the template that is used by default for O365 groups.  Users/admins should be able to choose which template they would like to use when creating the site, as well the ability to change the template for existing SharePoint sites that are part of an O365 group.

comments.text: Yes please!

header: Stop sending emails to individuals when a calendar event is scheduled
idea_text: Allow the user the option to send an email to all individuals in the group through Outlook client for a calendar event like it does in OWA.

comments.text: This is a terrific option.  The only way to do it today, that I know of, is to get your exchange administrator to disabled outbound sending of message types, but that still will not work when the application tries to send updates and such.  I would love the idea, and definitely will work to get more up votes.

header: Option to add Personal calendar entry to Group Calendars in Outlook
idea_text: When adding a calendar entry to your personal calendar, should have option to add to Group calendars.

comments.text: also the ability to select a sharepoint calendar to share a single event.
Agree. I would also suggest that users should be able to select what calendar to add the event/meeting when creating it.

header: We very much need O365 to support nested O365 groups.
idea_text: It will reduce the no. of groups to be created in the org as well as will reduce the complexity of adding 100 of users manually to O365 groups.

reaction.note: Can you please tell us more on the end user scenario you are trying to solve?

comments.text:
I am unsure if the linked  is covering this, but I have the same issue:- RBAC (role based access control) in place based on active directory groups
(User --> isMemberOf(ROLE-GROUP) --> isMemberOf(someAccessGroup)
- synchronizing thouse groups into Azure ADI can assign that "someAccessGroup" as Owner or User of Azure / O365 stuff, e.g. enterprise application access control, but it will not work as long as the user is not directly member of that "someAccessGroup".
Managing direct group membership in all groups is really a mess when your organisation grows and you want to have some standardization (e.g. due to compliance).
Microsoft - Please refer to the other Feedback item that is a year older than this and has over 1,400 up votes!

header: Enable custom "new file" templates
idea_text: I like to set the templates for new file dialog for Excel, PowerPoint etc.

comments.text: I felt dissapointed when realized there is no way to publish an Excel Template for new files. The functionality exists in SharePoint, but for some reason it has been disabled in Office 365 Groups

header: Admin Forced "Send on Behalf of" or "Send As" behaviour for external email sent from Groups
idea_text: Say for example I host  in an Office 365 Group, as the Knowledgebase Article nicely describes.A customer sends an email to the group and I reply. By default the reply would come from my personal email address, not the group, and subsequent replies from the customer come to me, bypassing the group.I can change the 'From' address, but only if I remember and only if I'm using Outlook 2016 or Outlook Web App on the PC. This behaviour is not available in Outlook on Mobile.If I do remember to change the from line I must also CC the group, or again, the message will be in my sent items folder bypassing the group. In other words, there are two (2) manual steps which must be taken for every single message in order not to bypass the group.As an Admin, I want the ability to force all external mail sent in reply to these group messages to be sent to the external user, either 'As' or 'On Behalf of' the Group, thus ensuring all subsequent communication comes right back into the Group.

comments.text: We have just updated BCCtoGroup tool. Now it auto-populates the From: field when you reply.

@Brad,the tool named BCCtoGroup can solve the part of the problem.
Unfortunately only on Outlook 2016 and only if you have changed the From: feild.Anyway it will be one manual step instead of 2 ones.

@Victor,If the message came directly to me, when I reply it should be 'sent from' my email address.If the message came to me via the group, when I reply it should be 'sent from' the email address of the group it came to me via.In the event I was also in the To or CC list, in current behaviour Exchange does not deliver to me via the group, only delivering to me directly.  The second 'Group Copy' is not sent to me.  To accommodate the behaviour I would like to achieve, I would need to get a copy of the group version of the email somehow, either by receiving both copies or by receiving only the copy sent to the group.Normally messages received via the group are indicated with "To stop receiving messages from [Group_Name] group, stop following it.".

"As an Admin, I want the ability to force all external mail sent in reply to these group messages to be sent to the external user, either 'As' or 'On Behalf of' the Group, thus ensuring all subsequent communication comes right back into the Group."Hello Brad,the problem is how to detect  an "external mail sent in reply to these group messages". Let's suppose an external user sent a message1 to you directly and message2 to the group, You have replied both. How the software can understand that "RE: message2" is sent in reply to a group message? Searching in all groups is not an option.What do you think about that?Best regards,
Victor Ivanidze

header: Prevent Team Site Been Created In SharePoint
idea_text: We want an option to stop users creating a SharePoint site with document libraries for their Groups This is because we want users to store documents in libraries that we created with formal project documetns with template control.

header: Groups, Files and iOS
idea_text: Please add the ability to selectively sync files within the Outlook Groups app.  If this won't be added to One Drive, it needs to be added in the Groups app.  People in our industry often need offline access to files.  SharePoint Groups offer a great interface to simplify the access to shared info if we could also get some minimal offline files ability in iOS.

header: Make an option in Office 365 Admin Center to prevent users in creating an Office 365 group without purchasing another license.
idea_text:
- The article in preventing users in creating office 365 group () requires a powershell command and another license to purchase which is not very user friendly and inaccessible.
- The feature should be available in Admin portal which provides admin the option to allow and restricts users.

header: move files
idea_text: We need the ability to move (and copy) files between groups. It isn't practical for users to download everything and then upload it to a different group (and then delete the local files again). Users are not going to get on board unless they can do this kind of thing seamlessly.

comments.text: Absolutely necessary.  Groups are temporary places for documents, but there's no way to move them easily between Sharepoint, onedrive and groups.  Frustrating.  I would like the files to be tagged to specific sites or groups from OneDrive.
My office desperately needs this feature. The 'Copy to' feature now allows users to copy files between groups but the Move to feature is still lagging behind.

header: Share personal calendar with an Office 365 group
idea_text: Allow users to share their personal calendar with (the members of) an Office 365 group.Currently they can only share it with AD security groups.

header: Rename tab "Conversations" to "Mails" and add tab "Chat" (Teams)
idea_text: Currently it is hard to understand when to use Groups conversations VS Teams chat. IMHO it would be much easier if there is a clear naming: (Group)Conversations should be "Mails" while Teams should be "Chat". I would imagine it like this: Within the Groups web UI, there would be the Tabs "Mails" (currently the "Conversations" tab) and "Chat" (embedds the Teams chat of the group). Within Microsoft Teams this should be applied as well: The "Conversations" tab (the Teams chat) should be renamed to "Chat" while a new tab "Mails" should be added to embedd the inbox of the group.

comments.text: I don't really understand the functional difference between a Team Chat and Group Conversation. Primarily, when should one be used over the other.  More confusing, other than the conversation/chat, the rest of the data, files/calendar/onenote in Groups is mirrored in Teams. So when should I tell users to use Teams to chat and when to use Groups to communicate. You can even mail enable a team channel as you can do in a Group. I could see how some would end up using the Group Conversation and some using Teams Chat and the two sets of people who are on the same organizational team / group end up missing communications. It almost looks like Teams is a replacement for Groups, but it's not fully feature complete so they're keeping both active at the same time.  If they mean Teams to just be an alternative client to the same data in Group, then I think the conversation and chat should be the same data (and if mail enabled, they use the same email address).  It all seems quite jumbled.

header: groups take too long to propogate to local client
idea_text: Groups in Outlook 2016 for Mac take WAY too long to propogate, I was told it can take up to 72 hours to do so, 48 hours in we decided to remove account and re-add which got the group name changes to come down to the client but they appear almost instantly in OWA, 72hrs to sync locally is too long.  Perhaps a 'sync now' button on the right click of the menu like you can do for the mailboxes would fix this issue.

comments.text: This is an important fix. Please implement ASAP.GaryK

header: Office 365 Group deleted notification on admin, owner & members email
idea_text: Mail sent like when owner create groups via Outlook or directly from Planner. Once someone delete groups esp Office 365 group, mail sent for notifying IT admins or any person in charge. So it will be useful as a record for company's audit check.

header: Right-click send to > mail recipient should actually send the email, not just place it in outbox
idea_text:
Currently, users are fooled to think that their emails are sent when they right-click a file and hit Send to > mail recipient. A mini outlook window pops up, giving the impression that the email is actually sent. But it won’t, until you open the main outlook program AGAIN (Sometimes perhaps a week later). 
Outlook should either:
1. Inform the user that they need to open outlook again to actually send the email
2. Initiate the opening of the full outlook program when Send to > mail recipient is selected in the right-click menu.
3. Or, simply, execute the sending of the email, like any other normal email client would do (including Windows live mail).

header: Support automatically uploading documents through incoming email
idea_text: On-premises SharePoint (2007 and up) supports email-enabled document library (see )  however, SharePoint Online doesn't offer the same capability.

header: allow each user to access there individual spam quarentiene folder from portal not just email once a day
idea_text: the admin should not be forced to check the quarantine folder for each user, they should be able to access via portal to unblock or white-list spam, and not have to wait for the once a day email to see if something was stopped.

header: Enable management of groups in Partner Portal
idea_text: Currently you can not create, edit, manage or even SEE the new "Office 365 groups" in the Partner Portal.This is the tool that almost ALL partners and MSPs use to manage their customers and a growing number of customers are using the new  groups.As Partners we should be the people encouraging customers to usitlise these new and exciting features, but if we cannot even manage, see or create them then how are we supposed to do this?

comments.text: I vote for this to be corrected. I spent a lot of time debugging a group problem, only to find out, MS does not allow partner portals to see 365 groups. My partner support rep did not know either. I thought it was a bug and together we spent half an hour determining this.

Yeah this seems like one of those duh MS moments.  What's the point of having a partner portal that delegates admin access but block the ability to make changes to a) a new feature MS is trying to push and B) a rather trivial feature to block partners from administering?Like I really have to log in via one of my clients admin accounts to do this work... whats the point of the partner portal.  Think things through MS!

header: Summary view of own tasks in Planner
idea_text:
When Planner is used in many projects at the same time, it would be good to have summary view for yourself about your own tasks in different groups/projects.
In some cases I'm just interested about my own tasks, not the status of whole project.

comments.text: I agree that this would be a valuable feature.

Small detail to this.
There is "My Tasks", but I'm looking for same kind of circle graph of tasks stutuses which can be found on "Planner hub".

header: Microsoft planner
idea_text: Currently email notifications are not working when getting assigned a task in Microsoft Planner.  An email notification is only assigned to the group, which needs to be viewed in OWA.

comments.text: Since multiple people can be assigned to a task, then needed is away to assign a lead assignee to the task.
Need away to assign buckets to leaders. They may not have a task but still need to know which buckets they are assigned to.
When in planner needing away to go back to SharePoint files.
Put a search feature in there that allows one to search through titles and descriptions.

header: Hide group calendar appointments from the Main calendar
idea_text: I've created several Office 365 groups so that my work associates can all have access to team calendars that cover certain aspects of our activity (raw material orders, lab activity, regulatory deadlines).  However the entries made to the team calendar also show up in the member's personal calendar. We have more than 15 group calendars, personal calendars become very crowded.

header: allow external domain to distribution group
idea_text: I have a distribution group that we use internally that has restricted delivery enabled. I want a partner to be able to send in to that distribution group. Is there any way to allow an entire domain to send to a delivery restricted distribution group?

header: outlook icon
idea_text: Outlook and Word icons are really similar, I was used to the orange Outlook and keep confusing them :(

comments.text: Older versions of outlook allowed you to customize icons.  Example the delete icon I changed the background to yellow and the X to red.  you were able to right-click and then adjust icon.
The new icons, general layout is a step backwards.  Looks like it was designed for kids!
Yes, change the Outlook Icon back to Orange. Let the supervisor's kid with the shiny new graphic arts degree play with the Skype and LinkedIn icons - i don't use those probrams

header: Group calender visible in the app
idea_text: Make group Calendars in Outlook for visible in the app for iphone/ iOS or others/ Android. As it is now, you can only see the group calender on the computer interface.

header: Trigger the content organizer rules when a document is approved in a drop off library
idea_text: Kind of defeats the purpose if you have to wait an entire day for content to be routed once you have approved it.

header: We would like to move emails from Office 365 Groups to Inbox or other folders through OWA or any application
idea_text: As a user we would like to move emails from Office 365 Groups to Inbox or other folders. This feature is very important so we can organize emails and can be easily backed up as PST file. Right now there is no way we can move the emails from group to other mailboxes even on the new OWA view. please vote to this feature

comments.text:
Hello,I agree it is essential to be able to do this. Even though we use group email address, but we cannot expect clients to always use it, or even us for that matter. I did find that I could move emails from inbox to groups, and also from groups to inbox through OWA new view. However from groups, I could only move messages that are part of the conversation, if a message was a stand alone, I couldn't move it from a group to the inbox. 
I really don't want to use public folders, and also it requires to have domain set-up as relay and not as authorative, in order to receive emails from the outside. This can leave domain open for spam vulnerabilities.

header: Double click Group message in Outlook to Open
idea_text: In Outlook 2016 if the user disables the reading pane, they are unable to view the group message contents. Double clicking on the group message in does nothing. This should work to open the message the same way it works for mail items. As a work around the users are clicking the "forward" button to open the message.

header: Upcoming group events message shows events in UTC, not in local time zone
idea_text: The times listed for upcoming group events are in UTC, not the US/Pacific time zone that’s relevant to my office (and to most of my team). These messages should reflect a time zone that’s relevant to my team or, at the very least, should indicate which time zone they’re using.

comments.text: This is also the problem with Calendar list of SharePoint Online. When All Day Event is selected, the time zone changes to the UTC, regardless what the user's time zone or the site collection's.

header: Delegate Mailing moderation for nested groups
idea_text:
We use nested Security groups/distribution lists within our schools. We set moderation for groups to avoid spamming from students. If we send a mail to a group that is moderated and the nested groups are moderated as well, the message needs to be approved several times. 
Can a feature be set that if a mail to a group has been moderated/approved on a higher level, it is automatically approved for any nested group on a lower level?

header: Microsoft Teams feaures update
idea_text:
Hi, Team! We are facing several features shortness of MS teams when applicaion in large-scale. 1. When we are trying to use MS teams client at Win7 system, it always claims that they are repairing and will start in a while. 
2. There is no screenshot hotkey or application inside. 
3. We cannot @ anyone in chat. 
4. We cannot customize groups in chat. 
5. We cannot add in customized emoticon in teams. 
6. All pictures, shared in MS teams, will be compressed and get decreased to low definition. All files sharing have to be transferred from public server but not point-to-point transmission if in intranet. Would you please help us update in future? Cheers!

header: Utitlize File and Folder Permissions in Group Files
idea_text: As in Team sites, Files and Folders can be assigned permissions to prevent or allow certain users rights to those items.  In a 3 hour call with MS Partner/Tech support the workaround of moving everything to Team Sites was not much of an option.  If this "feature" is available to users of Office 365, then why isn't the same functionality available across the various products/apps?  I had a user of a Group move an entire folder to another location, by accident, and we tested and he could also delete files in a folder the should have been able to be flagged as read only to prevent this from happening.  Only managers should have permissions to modify or delete files, in this case.

comments.text: I have been able to achieve this today, though the UI isnt neat so it clearly isnt intended.  I created some extra groups, created some folders, disabled inheritance on the folders and applied the new groups, and despite a bunch of blank browser screen during the process it seems to work.  Not sure if it will still work tomorrow.

We have requirement to move network shared drive folders into O365 Group->directories->Files. As permission at directory/File level is not available for example 'Read Only' .It means any group member can edit/delete the file. It is major short coming not having file/directory level permission.I guess if permission is available similar to OS level or at least SharePoint Document library kind of permission then I am sure Groups will be a big winner.

header: Colour Outlook inbox folders
idea_text: I have large numbers of inbox folders.  It would be nice to be able to colour them, so that I can find them easily.

header: O365 Group Expiration Date
idea_text: Allow the creation of multiple expiration date policies.   This would allow groups used for certain functions to have a longer or shorter lifespan than the default.  Some groups may only need a very short lifespan and being able to assign a different expiration date policy cuts down on the number of requests to the Helpdesk to remove the group.Allow them to be assigned during group creation in Powershell.

comments.text: Can't believe that this has so few votes. Multiple policies are definitely needed!

header: Teams, more than 4 video in a meetings
idea_text:
When me and my colleagues (more than 5) have a meetings on Teams. The window shows only 4 video streams from 4 contacts, but not the rest of the members.
Is it possible to activate more than 4? Is it going to be included in an upcoming version of Teams
Thank you.

header: You should not require a license to administer Office 365 Groups (or anything else for that matter.)
idea_text: An administrator including Global Administrator and Delegated Administrator should be able to manage Groups without a license.  This is the purpose of an administrator, to administer things, like groups, and they are not users, and therefore do not require licenses.  They administrate.  Please change this.

header: Allow a Flow to be built off a Group not a person
idea_text: "Groups" are built off the concept that Business functions are not based on people but the group.  That flexibility allows a team to move forward with documents, plans, etc. without having to transition of a person's local account.Workflow built in "Flow" remains tied to the person, so the workflow has to be rebuilt if that originator leaves the team.It would be great if workflow items built in "Flow" can be associated to the group rather than a person's account.

header: Allow .PNG format to be used with transparency for Groups icons
idea_text: Otherwise, you end up with an ugly square shape behind the icon.  Looks outdated :(

header: Office 365 group classifications: How to restrict users from changing classification after the creation of the group   Can you please add th
idea_text:
Office 365 group classifications: Feature to restrict users from changing classification after the creation of the group
 
Can you please add the functionality to restrict owners from changing group classification after they create the group? Users should be able to choose from classification options when they create the group (as they are now), but not after creating the group.

header: Provide access to staff notebook in office 365 groups
idea_text: It would be nice if the staff members in my office 365 group could directly access their staff notebook.  The current Notebook tab does not provide private space.

header: I want to disable the auto -complete feature . Candidate is too much, it was sent to the wrong address .
idea_text: I want to disable the auto -complete feature . Candidate is too much, it was sent to the wrong address .

header: Forwarding to multiple recipients
idea_text: I think it would be helpful if it could be possible set up multiple addresses at once in the forwarding function of users

header: sub-groups
idea_text: Need to be able to create sub-group communications with in groups. For example we have a team of 9 working on a project and for a specific sprint only 4 need to be communicating on that topic. Need sub-group abilities so that everyone's emails are not cluttered.

comments.text: Please merge this idea with

header: One Drive for business backup solution
idea_text: IT should be able to backup OneDrive for users.

comments.text:
I would like to back up HDD from my laptop and external HDD. Currently I can do this with TimeMachine from Mac OS. I back up regularly my laptop HDD and an external HDD into a second HDD, where everything is backed up. It would very nice to be able to use OneDrive to synchronise, but also to be able to back up HDD. Maybe, users should be able to say how much space they want to use for each of these two options.Regards,
Germán

header: Add "Site" to Outlook 2016 Ribbon for Office 365 Group
idea_text: Similar to Outlook 2016 on the MAC it would be nice to have a "Site" button in the ribbon for your Office 365 group in Outlook 2016 for Windows. The site button would take you right to the SharePoint site for your Group.Why add this feature to Office one the Mac and not Windows.

header: Office365 Group Subscription
idea_text: If we wish to prompt people to Join a new group and provide a link to do this (currently with subscribe as the only available option) they should be automatically joined and subscribed to the group if they click the link provided instead of being prompted to join first.This is new behaviour as previous testing did not require the additional "join" step

comments.text: This change of behaviour is really annoying! please revert back to the one step procedure

header: Alias/proxy email addresses for Distribution and Security groups
idea_text: We would like to request for the enabling of proxy addresses or alias for distribution and security groups. This should be enabled because other tenants have multiple domains. We need our group email addresses to have multiple domains. Thank you.

comments.text: In the middle of a domain name change. This would be a really helpful tool vs having to build rules or .duplicate groups just to ensure external people can reach either domain.

header: Allow admins to disable Office 365 group auto-subscribe
idea_text: We don't turn on auto-subscribe when creating Office 365 groups but owners typically do. Currently, if group auto-sub is on and a new member is added, and then later deleted by the owner, the subscription continues without the owner's knowledge. This is a security risk for us. We would prefer the auto-subscription to be removed when a member is deleted (like it does when a member self-subscribes).

header: Show details on Conference room calendars
idea_text: When we create an appointment on a group calendar and add a conference room the details of the appointment are not available on the conference room calendar.  The details show up fine if you are a member of the group and look at that calendar.The issue is our receptionist prints the conference rooms calendars so she knows what meetings are scheduled and the clients name.  Right now when she looks at the calendar it only shows the Group Name and the Room name.  However when you look at the group calendar it has our employee's name allow with the client's name in the Subject.

comments.text:
This happens not only when groups create an appointment. Also when single users create an event in a room, the details of the event doesn't appear in the room's calendar. Only the name of the user who made the reservation does.
If it's a matter of confidentiality, please at least give the choice to admin to hide or show the details (at least "subject" of the meeting).

header: Display Office 365 Group Only for Members
idea_text:
User can create Office 365 group as Private Access Type which is "Only members can see content".
But the Private Access Type group is also displayed in the Global Address List.
The group member User prefers the group is visible only for members.
Currently there is no option to achieve User’s request.The Additional option which could modify that Private Type group is displayed only for the group members would be a useful function for Users.This feedback is based on a customer voice from support SR.

comments.text: is it possible to not show in global address list? as the  group name can be funny name that user create via the webmail.

header: Group Deletion policy
idea_text: The current deletion policy process doesn't work. An email is sent to the OWNER(S) of a group every x days forcing them to click a link otherwise the group is deleted. If the group has no owners, then a central address is emailed instead.However, its possible that the OWNER has left and their account is 'disabled' but still present (for retention purposes). In this situation, the email is sent to the disabled account which cannot respond, and so the group gets deleted because no email is sent to the central address.Either detection of a disabled OWNER account is required, or ALL deletion messages need sending to the central address every time.

header: Create URL tabs in Teams
idea_text: We'd like to be able to create a tab in the group menu that connects to any URL

header: Allow Global Admins to manage O365 groups
idea_text: Allow global admins to create / delete / edit O365 groups even without any license attached. As global admins most probably do not have any licenses attached. They should also have the ability to convert current distribution list to O365 groups too.

comments.text: Global Admin permissions are currently not working as per name suggests when it comes to Groups created in O365.The role implies that admin role user will be able to handle and make changes where needed. It also should be able to fulfil issue resolution in a localized DR scenario.As William suggest, this should be rectified.

header: Allow an O365 user with Send As permissions to select cached email address instead of having to select it from the global address list
idea_text: Allow a O365 user with Send As permissions to select cached email address instead of having to select it from the global address list.  There is a workaround, but a solution would be preferred.

header: By default, team owners and team members cannot be distinguished from default SharePoint groups
idea_text: Currently, this is the biggest issue for less experienced owners in Microsoft Teams.If you create a team called ABC, team owners and team members are called ABC Owners and ABC Members on your team site in SharePoint Online. By default. ABC Owners are added to Site Collection Administrators. ABC Members are added to a SharePoint group. Unfortunately, that SharePoint group is also called ABC Members. By default. When they (try to) manage permissions, horrified team owners find a thing called ABC Members inside another thing called ABC Members. Does Microsoft even begin to realise what a problem that is?Ironically, it's easy to avoid. The name of the Office 365 group should be NOT be ABC. It should be ABC Team. By default. Team owners and team members should appear as ABC Team Owners and ABC Team Members on your team site in SharePoint Online. That way, less experienced owners (and anyone else for that matter) can distinguish them from the SharePoint groups ABC Owners and ABC Members.Which is crucial. If you can't distinguish them, you can't manage permissions on your team site in SharePoint Online.Using a naming policy to accomplish this should not be necessary. That requires an Azure AD Premium license and will sometimes be overlooked, even by companies that have such a license.

header: OWA messages displayed in collumns like in Outlook
idea_text: OWA is displaying messages without columns. This disable us to sort them by some metadata. This is the reason that our colleagues look for a way to display messages only in Outlook, what makes OWA less interesting.

header: Enable Hiding Group Email Address  in the Global Address Book
idea_text: Enable admins and users to choose whether a group email address shows up in the GAL.

header: Site collection administrator only should be creator of Groups / Teams
idea_text:
All groups members are registered as a site collection administrator at this moment. This means everyone can change the settings which is related with compliance function.
So, I think that it's more better only creator of Groups / Teams is set as a site collection owner.

header: Enable sharing documents with Groups of other tenants that belong to the same company
idea_text: Nowadays, the docuemtns can only be shared with a person of the other tenant but not with a group office365. The tenant is considered as a external enterprise in spite of the tenant belongs to the same company. It will be useful that documents of several tenants belonging to the same company could be shared by groups besides by people.

header: Allow group calendars to be exported in Office 365
idea_text: Need a way to be able to export a group calendar when working online in Office 365.   Right now you can only export/publish your own personal calendar.

comments.text: This is a much needed feature.  It will enable our timekeeper to reconcile PTO

header: Enable Outlook Customer Manager group email address top be edited.
idea_text:
Not option to select the email alias on creation of the OCM group, so we have this beauty :
AllSalesTeam-c036c9b0-d80c-423b-afed-8642ce2d6076@<myco>.onmicrosoft.com"  when what we really want is sales@<myco>.com

header: Show all Office 365 Planner plans without entering the Group
idea_text: Give admins the opportunity to show all Office 365 Planner plans within the organization without entering the Group.

comments.text: I second this.  We are moving out of Basecamp into Planner.  Before, our president could look at all the projects that were ongoing within our organization.  Now, she will not have that ability unless people add her to each and every plan.  She doesn't want to receive any notifications, she just wants to review what is going on.

header: List my groups in main Onedrive interface
idea_text: When I go to my onedrive through the tiles menu, I see my personal Onedrive. In the left sidebar I'd like to see the groups listed in which I'm participating, so I can easily click through the files of my groups. Now there is a list of groups in the left sidebar, but it contains also groups I'm not part of (I really don't on which criteria this list is composed). That's a very inconsistent experience. For example, when I go to my calendar, I see my personal calendar and my group calenders.

header: Allow for better PDF collaboration in Sharepoint Sites
idea_text: There is no cloud-based edit tool in Sharepoint to work on PDFs. Users need to download, edit, save, & upload static documents. Can a plugin for an Adobe acrobat license be created to work seamlessly on the cloud?

header: Search-UnifiedAuditLog ObjectID is "Not Available" in Powershell results
idea_text: Unable to search for groups by ID using Search-UnifiedAuditLog using this cmdlet:Search-UnifiedAuditLog -StartDate 6/14/2018 -EndDate 6/18/2018 -ObjectIds <guid>I believe it is because the Object ID is not being populated / indexed for searching.  For example, if you run this:Search-UnifiedAuditLog -StartDate 6/14/2018 -EndDate 6/18/2018 -RecordType AzureActiveDirectoryThe AuditData -> ObjectID property is set to "Not Available".  Should be the GUID of the group.

comments.text: Also want to add that the group's Object ID is reflected accurately when viewing this through the Azure Portal.

header: Allow external contacts to have the same email address
idea_text: For some reason, a mother and daughter share an email address.  We want to set them up as external contacts so we can add them to different distribution lists.  We request that two different contacts be allowed to have the same email address.

comments.text: If you set contacts up in Active Directory that sync to the O365MT Global Address List (GAL), I have found it is possible to set up multiple contacts with the same "targetAddress" attribute provided the "Mail" and "proxyAddress" attributes are unique. Since such contacts are only used for outgoing mail, you can "dummy" the Mail and proxyAddress attributes to satisfy the GAL requirement of uniqueness and the contacts will properly route messages to the same targetAddress. Although I do not know if there are any unintended consequences with this approach, it does seem to work.

header: Allowing domain change for an O365 group from Central Admin Group creation
idea_text: The Admin Centre group management section does not allow you to change an O365 groups domain. You have to go into the Exchange admin centre, this seems odd and rather annoying, make it available within the Admin centre. Also why does Exchange by default as you as the owner, this should be blank like it is in the exchange admin centre.

header: Using Office 365 Planner
idea_text:
Office 365 Planner automatically creates Office 365 Group.
And User prefers to hide the group from Address lists.It is possible to hide the Office 365 Group by setting HiddenFromAddressListsEnabled and HiddenGroupMembershipEnabled parameters as $true.
But in this case the Office 365 Group is not able to use from Office 365 Planner, too.
This is not good situation for Users.Users prefer to be able use Office 365 Group in Office 365 Planner while the Group is set HiddenFromAddressListsEnabled and HiddenGroupMembershipEnabled parameters as $true.This feedback is based on a customer voice from support SR.

header: Recover a deleted channel
idea_text: Give the option to recover a deleted channel or atleast let a team reuse the name of a previously deleted channel. After testing and playing to set up a hierarchy for my team at work, I discovered that I was unable to recreate a channel I had previously deleted. So when trying to come up with a name that would be similar any options forced the new channel to disrupt the uniform or seem unprofessional.

header: We need an auto reply for distribution groups for out of office such as holidays
idea_text: When we are closed for holidays, Ice storms, etc we have no way to notify clients that email orders to our distribution groups

header: Planner - Automatically display images from web links instead of uploading an image
idea_text: In my experience with Planner so far, I have noticed that adding a link to an image shows a default image icon (which seems to disappear and reappear often even when set as preview). It would be good if that image was automatically displayed rather than having to upload an image file.

comments.text: Support for Imgur albums would also be sweet

header: Add option to allow all members to Send As

comments.text: Agreed - the group admin should have an option for each member to 'Grant Send As', just as they can 'Make Admin' for the group.  So, they can designate certain members to have this ability at the click of the button.  The Powershell command to do this is a one-liner, so this should be relatively simple to implement.

I agree, we have a number of distribution groups and regularly change membership. Currently that means that we have go into Exchange Admin to change the Send-As settings.Historically in Exchange 2013 you could just add the name of the distribution group into itself and that resolved the problem. Unfortunately you can only add users and not groups in O365.Be great if this option could return in O365.Many thanks

header: Hide chat history from new users
idea_text: The option to hide chat history from new users. This would be useful in many situations. for example we have discussed new team members as part of their recruitment process (interviews) and they have now become part of our team. It would be great to keep the previous conversation private rather than have to go back to delete 'sensitive' content. (I thought this was possible but can't find it). SB

comments.text: (NB this is particularly pertinent for Teams)

header: distribution
idea_text: Since OWA does not support shared personal contacts, and cannot accept shared contact groups from Outlook users, it would be really helpful if either that feature could be added or that Groups could act as distribution lists as well.  It would be nice to easily from OWA or Outlook to email a group and have it distribute a mass email to all members.

header: Naming of Synchronised files catalog and OneNote
idea_text: The name of the notebook and synchronised folder should reflect the name of the Group instead of the generic name.There's gonna be "havoc" when working in several Groups and having several OneNotes with the same title (the generic name).Also shortcuts in Windows Explorer to the synchronized folders will have the generic name +1 which is a BAD way of finding/connecting quickly.

header: Allow groups to be re-ordered in the folder pane
idea_text: Allow groups to be re-ordered in the folder pane so that if can at least appear below actual email accounts.

header: Ability to Add distribution lists to Office 365 groups
idea_text: Or a way for a standard user to add there team/department in one go instead of adding members individually.

header: Yammer Office 365 Groups in tenants with multiple Yammer networks
idea_text: Office 365 tenants with multiple Yammer networks should also be able to create Office 365 Groups with Yammer-feed.The yammer feed should in that case be connected to the user creating the Office 365 Group or the ability to choose network.

header: Drag and Drop (Inbox to Group) doesn't respect DELIVERY MANAGEMENT permissions (Write to 'conversations' even if 'rejected/not accept' list)
idea_text: Dragging and dropping objects from your Inbox to a GROUP bypasses the "accept messages from" delivery management configuration of that group.A user who has not been explicitly granted the ability to post into the group can still deliver a message to the group conversation by dragging a message out of their Inbox into the group.An 'owner' or 'member' of a group should at no time be able to generate messages in the 'conversation view' of the outlook group if they are not included (by permissions assigned a group or direct assignment) in the "accept messages from", or when the users have been added to the "reject messages from".This behaviour has been verified by Office 365 Ticket #30126-7369965 - surely it's just an oversight?  At the very least allow us to disable drag and drop functionality per-group.We have groups that are enterprise-wide 'read only' for all (12000), except the few (10) users to whom the group is writable.  Since the introduction of drag and drop capabilities to groups anyone in the group can disrupt or incidentally expose PII or otherwise regulated information, by accidentally dropping the message into the group.We simply request a way to ensure that no contributions can be made by users who are not explicitly added to a "can contribute" list whether it's by delivery management (accept few, reject all) or another access control method - it just needs to work! (no write permission to anyone not in the accept message from list, when accept message from list has entries).HR is upset ;)It's an Azure AD Group with Office 365 features enabled.

header: Office online selectable setting for Admins: Open file as view or edit mode.
idea_text:
Administrators should be able to choose default setting when opening shared document = "Open in edit mode" or "Open in view mode"Now default setting is: "Open in edit mode" and it is forced by Microsoft.Opening in edit view causes lot of error, mistakes etc. and with auto-save feature you can lose precious and important information if nobody notices the change.My company needs the setting "Open in view mode" desperately and I know we are not only one. 
Please make this happen fast.

comments.text: There are a few other ideas already posted in other categories pertaining to this same topic. I've created a new idea in the general category where I'm hoping we can pool votes. Please vote here -->

header: TEAMS - files columns, should show the Sharing column you get on the OneDrive view.
idea_text: My users get worried about what they see in files and what is being shared.   They do not have a concern in OnDrive as it shows what's being shared.   In Teams files (note these are not Channel files), the column does not exists.  That gives them the feeling hat everything they see there is also seen by many.    I think having the column "Sharing" as OneDrive has will alleviate their concerns, and overall it is a good indicator.

header: See shared files with the Groups in the app
idea_text: We share documents (week plan) with our student who are members in a group, they can't see this shared document in the app, please add this function. If we put the document in the group library the students can edit and we don't want that.

header: The way to recover delated distribution group.
idea_text:
User have delated the distribution group by mistake, and there’s no way to recover it.
It would be really helpful if the delated distribution group can be recovered.

header: General available (and uniform) menu
idea_text:
Make the menu on every page of the group the same and general available please. Now if you enter the file library you don't see the menu for example, and on the planner you'll find the complete structure but on the rest of the group you don't. This makes it very confusing, while it could be a great solution!
What we would like is to have a tabbed experience, where the menu stays on top the whole time. This way users don't get the feeling of multiple IE tabs opening, but instead feel like working on one group (in one screen) for the entire time. It now feels cluttered.

header: Allow Workflows on 365 Group Calendar.
idea_text: Allow  a work flow like  an  "Approval workflow" before a calendar item shows on the calendar

header: Allow any Organisation on Office 365 to link to any other Organisation on Office 365 with admin approval.
idea_text: To be quite honest I haven’t found any value in the Office 365 service. Skype for Business is a total disaster and I pretty much never use it because even other external organisations that have Office 365 don’t bother with it unless they’ve got a few hundred employees where internal collaboration works. There is no proper integration between Skype Consumer platform and the SFB platform which means Skype Consumer users are not interested in addressing the issue from their side. And why would they, it’s not their problem.Putting SFB aside the main and more pressing issue is the lack of external organisation collaboration services. They simply don’t exist apart from some archaïque methods that can be achieved in-house without and expense. YES, Office 365 is great if you are a large organisation and the majority of people you are in contact with or at least need to collaborate with are in-house but the reality is that that type of organisation is a small percentage and most organisations need to collaborate with external organisations for the majority of projects.I figured that Microsoft would have at this stage been able to develop a system that allows any Organisation on Office 365 to link to any other Organisation on Office 365 with admin approval. This way smaller organisations would find some use in and justify the expense of using Office 365. The reality is that it makes more sense for me to setup contacts in external organisations on my Office 365 package than my own employees. At least my own employees sit beside me and I chat with them, probably too much chatting. But is it safe to put contacts from external organisations on my Office 365 package, setting up email addresses for them under mycompanyname.com domain and making them members of Office 365 Groups? Wouldn't it make more sense to link organisations?Thanks for reading my rank/feedback.

header: Add a copy new version trigger in flow
idea_text: I want a trigger in Microsoft Flow which allows us to copy the new version of every file to a specific backup location so that we can see and retrieve all the versions. I dont want to restore all the versions one by one

header: O365 Group members that are external guests that don't yet have Microsoft Accounts aren't prompted to create one on the site's logon page.
idea_text: The logon page when you visit an O365 group doesn't have the "No account? Create one!" link to allow someone who was added as a member of an O365 Group to create a Microsoft Account anymore. This directly affects External Guests who don't have Microsoft Accounts. There is no visible link for them to create one. They don't know what to do as it's just prompting them to logon.

header: Change default tab in teams-channel (instead of Conversations)
idea_text: Today the default tab in every channel is "conversations" It would be great to be able do customize this to what you want. For example a SharePoint landing page.

header: Ability to Nest Office 365 Group Email Address in a Distribution Group via Admin Center
idea_text: Not possible in the 365 GUI at the moment, only can be done via PowerShell

header: Provide a group app for Windows Tablets
idea_text: We were looking at Windows tablets but have (apparently - if we have missed something let me know) discovered that whilst iPADs have a friendly touch enabled app Windows tablet users have  to either use an very touch unfriendly outlook web interface or the even less groups aware outlook 2016.This seems a very odd decision - you seem to be telling us that you would rather the school used iPADs or Android tablets. Even you don't support Windows

comments.text: Office 365 Groups works with Outlook Mobile app for IOS and Android but not Microsoft's own Windows 10 tablets (even those with screens less than 10.1") ??? How are Business Essentials customers supposed to use Groups (we are not all connected to the internet 24/7).  Teams app is no good as it does not support email properly.  So can we have the Android/IOS Outlook app for Windows 10 tablets please.

header: Add Twitter Lists to Twitter Web Part
idea_text:
I can't believe I can't find this here yet, I hope I'm not looking in the wrong place. I've used the Twitter web part on an O365 modern page and it works fine. You get 2 options. Feed a twitter account (like @Microsoft) or a collection (which you create with TweetDeck). A collection url looks like this: 
and is static - you pick and choose individual tweets so doesn't give you a feed really unless I'm using it wrong.I'd like to feed a twitter list. The url is very similar to a collection but no TweetDeck needed. Here's an example if a list url 
Any chance the list option could be added?

header: Add feature to remove user from multiple Distribution Groups
idea_text: Please create a function to remove a user from multiple Distribution groups. Perhaps under the Exchange User Mailbox - Member of tab where we can view what groups they are part of, put in the "+" and "-" symbol to quickly add and remove them from a group.

header: Allow a user to belong to more than 1024 Groups
idea_text: In professional services and especially the legal industry, a user needs the ability to belong to thousands and even tens of thousands of groups.  The concept is that each group represents a project.  We have seen users involved in 45,000 different projects over a long period.

header: Replace folder to label archive management in Outlook
idea_text: Another competitor does it already from years and, given the amount of emails everyone receives today (especially at work), folder archive management in Outlook has been proven not being practical nor useful anymore. Outlook already enhanced the search function, but dropping folder structure toward a more flexible label structure as a default option would dramatically increase the productivity of Outlook.

header: Support O365 Calendar categories in Outlook client
idea_text: In OWA we can set custom Categories in Group Calendars that persist across all Group members - this is great. Can we have this also sync and be available in the Outlook client Calendar

comments.text: This most useful feature has been suddenly disabled and removed in recent windows mobile updates. Why?I'm still in Office 365 subscriber.

header: Remove the ability for a user to leave a group
idea_text: I don't want a user to be able to leave a group without being removed by an Owner or Admin.

header: Allow searching within private groups
idea_text: Allow members of private groups to search within the private group they are members of

comments.text:
Optional workarounds:
    1) Use modern search while on the group site (in the top left)
    2) Use modern search while on the SharePoint home page:

Currently we can only search for things such as documents from within that document library and only that document library.  Try having 5 document libraries and only being able to search in the one you are in at the time. We are currently tempted to have 1 single document library to be able to use our Group site and that is crazy!

header: Filter user per group membership in powershell and graph
idea_text:
Allow filtering by group membership in get-msoluser.
Getting the groupmembers then getting the users from these members is lenghlty when the group has many members (10k+)It would be simplier to directly request all users members of a group.

header: Sort, prioritize and classify 365 groups in overview-page
idea_text: I would like to see all groups (and teamsites) I participate in, in an 1-page overview. And within that page I would like to make my own views, bases in sorting, prioritizing and/or classify. (based on metadata per Group?)This view helps:  But this view is too simple...

comments.text:
Unfortunately I just found out that this view contains a BUG... I shows groups that are deleted... 
You have to manually 'unfollow' them.

header: Fix .url links in Modern List & Library Webparts
idea_text:
Adding links to Lists/Libraries is a very frustrating in the modern experience in both Groups and Sharepoint sites.Requests: 
-Allow us to edit the link instead of replacing the link with title.url. 
-Fix bug where list/library webpart with links embedded in a modern page throws errors when a link is clicked. Browser tries to download the link and says some files may harm your computer. There's no way to get to the actual link from one of these webparts.

header: Flexible Azure AD Group Naming Policies. Support truncated attribute lengths, ie 3 first letters of value
idea_text: We have many "long" names in [Company] or [Department], and would like to have the option to only use n first letters, like previosly supported in legacy Exchange recipient policies, like %3[Company]-%3[Department]  -[Groupname]. Altenatively we could have more than one naming policy and assign this to different group of users to achieive more flexibility.

header: Add a WARNING when someone attempts to Delete a o365 Group.
idea_text:
Just deleted a o365 group.   Not expecting the SharePoint site and all of its contents to go away.  The email Inbox is a given.  But still.I just a little bummed.
Add a Warning dialog box!
Like if only there was a small nag!
Mentioning the site goes away, the email inbox goes away, etc….  Click Yes to continue….Please.

header: Allow the duplication of a Form in Groups / Sharepoints
idea_text: Allow the duplication of a Form  created in Groups / Share-points just as its possible to do when using your own personal one drive. I would like to be able to duplicate many copies of the same form that all sit in the same Group documents share-point.

header: Remove external users from Group if there's no internal users in it
idea_text: It's a security matter. Now person can share Group membership to his external account and use the group with that account even after he leaves our organization. Can we have an option that informs admins if there's a Group that has only external user(s) or remove automatically all external users from a Group that has no internal users left in it.

comments.text: Out of votes, but supporting

header: Allow Group Owner Without Membership
idea_text: I'd really like to be able to have my admin account set as the owner of a group to manage who is in it without having to be an actual member. We recently had to change the owner of all of our groups to different members in our company since they didn't like seeing our admin account included on all their recipients.

header: Unable to edit member in O365 Group via GAL in latest version of Outlook
idea_text:
-It works fine before using the lower version
-Current Version:1808 and 1811
-Works fine in Outlook>Groups>Group Settings;Portal;EAC
-it doesn't work in GAL>Group>Properties>Modify

comments.text: Same thing happens with latest version 1812 (11126.20266)

header: Save attachmens to specific folders
idea_text: I'd like to save attachments directly from the web app to a specific onedrive folder. At the moment it always seems to go to 'email attachments' in onedrive. Is this possible? I'd like to select the destination folder each time.

header: De-couple Teams creation to Plan creation (dependant on Groups)
idea_text: Currently, the only way to control Team Creation in Teams is to disable Office 365 Group creation and allow a specific group to control. That has a knock on effect on Planner (and other services). There should be a way to limit Teams creation without disabling Plan creation.

header: Allow End Users to Administer Delivery Management
idea_text: Currently, the accepted/rejected senders list can only be adjusted by an admin. Nesting a security group here creates redundancy as it requires that current group members be added a second time as authorized senders.It would be beneficial to have this available to end users for more control over their Office 365 Groups.

header: Progressive Reply Dist. Groups
idea_text:
A new group type that distributes the incoming e-mail to one group member at a time, until a reply is sent. Example:
 is a group that holds 12 members.  The group owner would rank one, or many members, a priority level.  They would also set a time threshold.  When an e-mail hits that group, it would dispatch ONLY to the 1st priority member and the timer would start.  If the 1st priority member fails to reply to the customer, before the timer is exceeded, the e-mail is then released to the second priority member.  This process continues until all ranked members have been exhausted.Once someone replies, the chain is broken and the remaining group members are then excluded from the conversation.If nobody from the priority members list replies, the e-mail is then released to all unranked members in the group.

comments.text: I like this idea. To stagger the email chain to end users helps reduce the number of simultaneous replies occurring to the original sender of the email. An example of it's usefulness could be similar as a "Need to Know" basis situation. If the original sender answers the email, then the others don't need to know or waste time reading something that has been replied to. I might even offer the option for a notification that this is/would be a tiered email working its way through the different tiers of recipients.

header: Enable categorization of shared calendar in OWA app
idea_text: Enable the options to categorize calendar items In OWA App for IOS and Android devices

header: Add Like button for NewsFeed Webpart in Modern team site pages
idea_text: It would be Nice if we could add the Like button for NewsFeed Webpart in Modern team site pages.

header: Ability to toggle full details in Teams Desktop client for current status
idea_text: With the transition to Microsoft Teams the users lose the ability to view the "Status notes" underneath the contact.  Users have to hover over the contact card for their contact to see the status notes.  Skype for Business allowed the status note to show up under the user automatically.

header: Teams Files Open URL files properly like SharePoint does
idea_text: In SharePoint you can create a URL to open any webpage as a file in a Document Library. When you do so, and open the document library in Teams, it is confused and doesn't know how to open the URL. here is how to create the URL link in SharePoint

header: Carriage Return in Notes Property
idea_text: After entering text with carriage returns in the Notes property (in Exchange Properties), the carriage returns are stripped when viewed from Outlook.

comments.text: We also have this same issue.  We have resource mailboxes and need to be able to put in notes.  Apparently all line breaks are removed.  This needs to be fixed ASAP.

I just had a support call with the Office 365 team as well. There is no way to make OWA or Outlook notes show the line break or carriage returns. We are using the Contact Information / Notes field for several lines of text about the shared contact.

header: There needs to a mechanism for external users to approve group emails
idea_text:
External users can be added to a the approval group for messages send to a group mailbox.
However they have no way of approving any messages they receive as they are external and do not have access to OWA or Exchange.
There should be a mechanism through which external users can approve an email for distribution, such as replying to the message with the word "Approved" or similar, which would then distribute the original mail round the group.
Otherwise the ability to add external approvers should be removed as it just sets and then fails expectations.

header: Office 365 Groups, Private by default.
idea_text: When groups being created within Teams, Planner and Outlook, the permissions are private by default instead of public.

header: Implement Office 365 Group Expiration Notification on Planner
idea_text: The expiration date of the Office 365 Group is implemented by email, but it is good if the extension operation can be performed on other applications such as Planner.

header: Group Calendar Reminders
idea_text: Change the Reminder functionality from a drop down to configurable options that emulate Outlook 2016 Calendar Reminders functionality. "2 Weeks" is very limiting and sometimesisnt long enough to set as a group reminder for certain things.

header: Add email moderation to Office 365 Groups (as it exists for Distribution Lists)
idea_text: The majority of our groups are Office 365 Groups (the Microsoft recommended option when creating a group) as we utilize the Teams/SharePoint/etc integrations those have, but it's entirely lacking the ability to moderate emails sent to those groups. We can restrict who can send to the groups with Exchange, but once someone has access they can send whatever they want. Please add the moderation process option that distribution lists have to O365 Groups.

header: Moderation time
idea_text: the moderation time as actually is limited to 2 days is not fair. it is not taking into consideration the working days and some key users are always on the go and they cannot reach their laptops. So it would be great to extend it to 5 working days which makes it better. in addition, there should be moderation' action buttons within the mail app on mobiles since many key users use their smartphones while being in meetings or traveling and would like to take action on the spot either to approve or decline a message.

header: Microsoft Teams - create several Teams per O365 Groups
idea_text: I work on multiple topics and projects with the same target audience.  It would be great to be able to create several MS Teams out of a same O365 group. This would avoid creation of duplicate groups, as it can become very messy.

header: Drag and drop mail in to the groups O365
idea_text: It would be very useful to be able to drag and drop emails from his personal mailbox to a group office 365, but for the moment that is not the case. Vote for this solution that could bring some solutions to public folders

header: Ability to merge two Office 365 groups
idea_text: We have found that when swtiching from Google's G-suite to Office 365, it was easier to make a new group and start fresh. However, it would be very convenient and far less time consuming if we could merge the old group from when we had G-suite to the new group - in particular contacts and calendar events.

comments.text: This remove duplicate entries in the office 365 admin portal and reduce time spent have to sort items

header: Ability to customize Group soft-delete recovery period to 60 or 90 days.
idea_text: Currently when an O365 Group is deleted it is actually soft-deleted for 30 days.  We would like to be able to extend that to 60 or 90 days since 30 days is generally too short for our organization.

header: Use the tenant country/region setting for default Office 365 group timezone
idea_text: Use the country/region setting set when creating the tenant to define the default timezone for Office 365 groups. For country that have more than one timezone it may need to default to the most popular. Failing this the option to set the timezone when creating the group or a setting for default group settings that is easier to access would work fine.

header: Add more than one person at a time (multiple names) to a group or classroom
idea_text:
Add people to a group more than one at a time eg
Last 1, First 1; Last 2, First 2; Last 3, First 3;

header: Paste a comma separated list of members when creating a group
idea_text:
When I send e-mail or when I share a file or a folder, I can paste the list of recipients as a comma separated list of e-mail addresses. 
I want to be able to do this very same thing, when I create a group. I have a text file of my group-to-be and I don't want to type them by hand.
All advice I have had so far includes heavy administrator rights as well as skills. But this functionality should be available for everyone capable of creating a group in Office365 for Business.

header: Include a reply-to address when sending mail to an O365 group
idea_text:
When anyone sends a message to an O365 group, the reply-to address is NULL.
This is not good in cases where the group contains guest mail users.Mail gateways and spam filters may block the message from being sent to the intended recipient because the reply-to address is NULL.It would be very helpful to us if the sender address can also be the reply-to address.

comments.text: This is not just a great idea, it is absolutely necessary.There also seem to be issues with 3rd party email footer security systems, that  and sending to a 365 group, where the lack of reply-to address causes spam alerts.

header: Teams guest account
idea_text: Multiple guest accounts for one TEAMS appGot 2+ invitations on my E-mail from different companies. to join Teams. MS created 2+ different accounts for my e-mail and each has 3 levels of authentication including SMS. Now when i'm trying to answer in different chats - it takes more that 15 minutes. Is there  way to merge those accounts or teams\chats?

header: Provice Microsoft Teams with an option to add groups synced from AD to the Contacts tab
idea_text: Microsoft Teams Does not support adding groups synced from Active Directory to teams or to the Contacts. So far, Contact groups have to be populated manually.

header: Be able to send an outbound email from office 365 Teams
idea_text:
Teams are using chat based channels.
This is fine for all members of the team.Team channels have an e-mail address.
External people may send an e-mail to a channel.  This is fine.However it is not possible to reply with a mail to the sender.
This is a minor change that would give our users a major benefit.

header: Allow addition of external users within an Office365 group to an internal Office365 group
idea_text:
Having encountered difficulty in adding some external email addresses to several Office365 groups I recently created, I contacted Microsoft to investigate. They found, by-design, that I could add the following to an internal Office365 group:1. Internal licensed users
2. An entire internal Office365 group (nest one within another)
3. External email addressesHowever, by-design, I cannot add the following to an internal Office365 group:1. An external email address where this email address is used in an Office365 group in a different tenant.Ideally, this should be added, or at the very least the error message improved so the user understands why adding these email addresses is not possible.

comments.text: I am dealing with the same issue. I even tried adding the external email via powershell and that was rejected.

header: Replace Conversations with a Shared Mailbox
idea_text: The Conversations "mailbox" in Office 365 Groups should be replaced with a fully featured Shared Mailbox.

header: Please can the functionality be added to allow Office 365 Groups to be made members of a Distribution List?
idea_text: Not currently possible, as confirmed by Microsoft support.  They recommended raising this improvement suggestion here.

comments.text: i could reduce the number of distribution lists (and member maintenance of the lists) if i could include 365 groups in a distribution list.
This would be very useful for our school. This would mean that tutor groups (office 365 group) could be added to a distribution list which would enable us to email a year group (distribution list)
This would be very useful, especially for school use

idea_text: Automatically add new users to a specified distribution list.

idea_text: O365 Web be able to move/copy from one calendar to another.

comments.text: Show group calendars on Calendar mobile app.

header: online survey
idea_text: It would be great if we can create online survey files in group folders. We are company using O365 and we handle projects. We would like to create lessons learned surveys in one repository which is not a personal drive because people come and go.

This delay confuses the users and causes unnecessary calls to their IT support.

header: Is it possible to apply auto reply on Distribution Group
idea_text: Hi, is it possible to get auto reply on Existing Distribution Group, because some times you want to close the service of the group. So when someone send a mail ... an auto reply sent to the mail id.....

header: I would love to see a "Planner" tab when I open a group on Outlook
idea_text: Most groups we use in my organisation are for specific projects, so we also use planner for each group. And what can be useful for us, is to have also a planner tab (near : conversations, one-note, files,...) that when we click on it, shows directly the planner board for that group.

reaction.note:
Hi, 
As every plan is an Office 365 group, you can just browse through the groups/plans directly in Microsoft Planner.

comments.text: I agree that this makes sense.  Planner is a kind of hub of sorts, for the team, but even more naturally, and successfully, within Teams, but Outlook is my personal hub for all of the things I'm responsible for.  So what you're suggesting as a solution doesn't really fit the need.

header: Internet calendars are not synced as fast as in Outlook (4 hours default on web version of Outlook)
idea_text:
As our contact with Microsoft Office365 Support Team:Resolution Summary : 
Created an appointment in outlook 2016 and it synced up to OWA real time.
Reproduced the issue in my test tenant by signing up for Perfect View CRM service.
Generated the URL for it's Internet calendar and added it to my test account's OWA and outlook desktop app.
Created the appointment in the same the that you were creating and it showed the same behavior.
Informed that this is because our server that hosts your mailbox will get new information from the Internet calendar every four hours. So after you've added a calendar from Internet and adds a new event, that new event will appear in your view of the calendar with a delay of about four hours.
Informed that currently, it is not feasible to change the server settings. I understand it would be convenient and helpful if we could speed up. Therefore, to improve our services, we suggest you submit feedback to our relevant team via the link below. 
Many features have been remodeled based on our customers’ valuable comments. .As discussed, I will go ahead and archive this case believing that the information I shared is sufficient. It would be nice to see this improvement in future updates

header: Enable the granular disabling of features within Groups.
idea_text: The ability to disable granular features within Groups/OneDrive should be an absolute bare minimum within O365. Organisations have a great deal of sensitive data that can simply be run off site via these features.

header: Guest Users Issue
idea_text:
Hi. I have a few issues about guests features.I would like to have a logout button when accessing an office 365 group page rather than just closing the page or logging out on my guest email address. It would really help a lot and our pages can be more secure.Another thing is that guest users can't view or reply to conversations on the group site. They have to go to their emails to view or reply which makes the guest access to conversation incomplete.We would really appreciate it if you can do both of this for us.
Thanks.

header: Unify File Storage Accross Collaboration Tools
idea_text:
There are a number of options for file storage now, SharePoint libraries, Office 365 groups, Team files, One Drive etc. It would be wonderful if these could all essentially be the same place. We're supposed to save client data in that clients SharePoint library but it's so much easier to put it on teams or 365 groups because that's where we're collaborating day to day. Once the project is done however, anyone who didn’t work on it doesn’t know those files exist and it would be an administrative process to download and re-upload those files to the “long term” storage. 
If there was a way to point all of those great collaboration tools the to same SP site/Client library that would be really efficient and user friendly.

header: Export on-premises OU from AADSync
idea_text: It would be nice to be able to export the list of on-prem OU's that are being synchronized with AAD using Powershell (the AADSync cmdlet documentation also needs severe updating). There are currently no available methods to do this via Powershell and it is also not possible via AAD Connect or Forefront.

comments.text: On top of export OU's how about a way to export the events so that they can be parsed and search in the event some change is made that was not supposed to happen, say a sync of a bunch of groups.

header: Adding the ability to prevent users from creating channels, but allow them to upload videos.
idea_text: Presently we have the ability to prevent users from both creating channels and uploading videos. But we do not have the ability to only limit them from creating channels. Ideally we are looking for the ability to have a user be able to upload videos to channels in our group or organization, but we would like to prevent them from creating new channels.

comments.text: In further testing we believe we were able to restrict the user from the creation of companywide channels but this ability does not exist for restricting the creation of group channels.

header: Office 365 Group Retention: Allow option to email members
idea_text: The new feature coming out to allow for expiration of Office 365 groups is great! The issue for us in Higher Ed is that if our group owner's are on summer break or sabbatical, the group will be deleted whether or not the group is actively used.Suggestion is to allow the email to be sent to members, not just owners.

comments.text:
We have the exact same problem. 
Another great thing would be to have more than 30 days to restore the group

header: Microsoft Teams, wiki tab - Admin / Editor lock content
idea_text: Using Microsoft Teams and recording company procedures and guidelines on Wiki Tab. We would need content to be locked and only modified by admin.

comments.text: I would also like to request this and be able to display static text for FAQ, etc

header: Custom Fields and Custom Filters for O365 Groups in Admin Center
idea_text: O365 Groups are great and its good that anybody can create these. Hence number of groups with similar names can quickly get out of control. Robust features to manage these in Admin center are very important.Can we add some custom fields that admins can use to better categorize various groups and make sense of these more quickly? Currently, its not possible to create a custom filter for list of groups in admin center. The custom fields can be used to create custom lists that help identify personal, departmental, project type, open, administrated - various types of groups more easily.
