header: Allow creation of aliases to Office 365 Groups, just like we can in Office 365 distribution lists.
idea_text: Allow creation of aliases to Office 365 Groups, just like we can in Office 365 distribution lists.  This would be MOST helpful.

comments.text: Yes please - and allow an Office 365 group email address to be added to the alias for a Distribution list as well - to enable smooth transition from Distribution lists to Groups.
Duplicate:

header: Groups photo synchronization
idea_text: I think that Group photo should be synchronized on all the different services related to the same group: SharePoint site, Outlook Group and Microsoft Team, and new services that may arise in the future!

header: Give someone access to the group without being a member
idea_text: Need to be able to give users access to groups without making them a member of the group.  An example would be to add an IT director to a Systems Engineers group.  He's not part of the group but needs to be able to get in and see what's going on.

header: Create a folder location ObjectId column of the audit log is not in the correct address.
idea_text: want to when to create a folder to place ObjectId column of the audit log to create a folder in the correct address.

header: Restrict users to create only private O365 group from any O365 services
idea_text: Due to security concern, Can we restrict users to create only private O365 group from any O365 services. or any way to disable/hide public option in Privacy setting while creating O365 group?

header: Be able to categorize calendar events in shared calendars at time of creation.  This used to be a standard feature!
idea_text: Originally when creating a shared calendar entry, you could categorise the event with colours.  Recently this functionality has been disabled with no evident reason.  Can this please be reinstated as it is extremely useful.

header: Browse the office group from Outlook Web in order to attach files when using a shared mailbox
idea_text:
Hi,Please considere the following scenario Sc.1 : 
1. you use Outlook Web App
2. you see the list of office groups
3. you can initiate a new email and attach a file using the feature which allow to browse the groupsResult: great!You have now this scenario Sc.2:
1. you use Outlook Web App
2. you connect to a shared mailbox
3. you can not see the list of groups and can't browse groups when you want to attach a file to a new emailAdditional comment: when you are using Outlook rich client, you can attach a file browsing the groups either you are with your email or send on behalf of the shared mailbox.Strong limitation to Outlook Web Appplease vote to remove this limitation! :-)

header: Call History
idea_text: visibility of calls to Call Queues in the call history section of Teams.Call history should identify the phone number of the caller and if answered by someone in the team, who answered the call.

comments.text: Calls should also be linked to the Contact based on the phone number so we can see a complete history of all calls made and received by contact

header: Extensibility options on the Document Library for Groups
idea_text:
I had two thoughts related to document library for groups -
1. Is it possible to replace with your own library during provisioning of a group? Seems there is no option available now.
2. Any customization options in terms of content types/apps etc.We were exploring building a document management solution around groups (for teams) by utilizing groups, some apps, smart attachments in outlook etc and would be helpful if the above mentioned scenarios can be accommodated.

header: Avoid duplication of Alias attributes when creating a group
idea_text: Alias attribute set in the user created group exactly matches what is set in the admin managed group alias resulted an error occurrence when setting a condition for a transport rule. It would be great to have a feature that can avoid duplication of Alias attributes set on groups created and managed by different type of users.

header: Co-Authoring Worksheets that do not contain objects, shapes, charts, etc...
idea_text: We should be able to co-author worksheets within a workbook that do not have objects, shapes, charts on them. Example: I had a workbook that could not be edited, because of an object on a hidden sheet. We did not need to look at or edit this sheet, but could not co-author at all as a result.

header: Office365 Outlook Webapp - Font
idea_text: Royal Mencap Society uses the FS Mencap font which is customized for people with learning disability. We are not able to use this font in Office365 Outlook webapp since there is no option to use locally installed fonts.this works for Word/Excel Online but not for Outlook.It should also allow us to search or type in the name of the font in Outlook webapp instead of just having a drop down list of pre-defined fonts.

header: Duration until the license will be removed from the user who is deleted from the licensed group
idea_text: Please provide us information about the accurate duration until the license will be removed from the user who is deleted from the group which has group-base license assigned.

header: Prevent users with read permissions to shared calendars from copying calendar entries
idea_text:
We noticed that users with read permissions to shared calendars are able to copy calendar invites either to their own calendar or other shared calendar to which they have editing permission. 
This should be prevented as this can cause security breaches.

header: Modern library view pagination
idea_text: In the SharePoint Modern Library experience, the pagination in the library view is not working!

header: Authorization for a folder only by admin
idea_text: When creating folders in a document library, I (admin) can choose the authorization for each folder. As far as I understand, the aim is, that not every person has access to every folder. But when you have access to one, you can invite/share the folder with another person from the organization which wasn't supposed to have access. I think that only the admin or group owner should have the possibility to invite people.

header: Stop user removal of a group
idea_text: In a corporate environment, stop users from removing an office 365 group for compliance purposes.

comments.text: In my opinion, the administrators should be able to grant or deny permissions to allow users removing themselves of the groups they are included.

header: sort group members
idea_text: It would be really good if Group Members could be sorted based on their user names in both Azure Active Directory>Groups and Office 365 Admin > Groups.  It's really trick to look at group members and compare them to another list.  I know the members can be exported and then sorted that way,but in this instance I was trying to actively edit the list of group members at the same time, so the non-alpha listing made it really tricky to double check my work.

header: Reduce sync time adding members to Yammer group
idea_text: When you add a member to a Yammer connected O365 group, it can take up to 2 hours to sync the user to the rest of the group resources from Yammer. It would be nice if it was more of an immediate sync.

header: Allow to filter view of O365 group calendar based on assigned categories
idea_text: In O365 group calendars I can assign events to categories. But there is no feature to filter the calendar view to selected categories. With high number of events per day and the full-day events being shown on top, important meetings are not visible in the overview. Filter on categories would help us setting up calendar views showing relevant information.

header: Attach files from groups to emails in the outlook app
idea_text: When you click on attachment on the outlook 2016 app or web app, we can select files from our group for attachment. I cannot do it in mobile outlook app.

header: Allow to assign a task in a group's planner to more than 1 person
idea_text: Working in a team/group often implicates collaborative work or shared tasks. Unfortunately, you can assign a new task in the planner of a group only to 1 person. It would be nice to be able to assign a task to several persons.

header: Bug - When editing a Office 365 Distribution Group - w more than one domain
idea_text:
This is a problem.
The issue is that the Office 365 Distribution Group's e-mail address changes to the default domain *if the tenant has more than one vanity domain.If the tenant has @fancydomain.com and @nancydomain.com, and the Distribution Group is current set to , and you select to 'edit' the name, it defaults to the first domain which may be @nancydomain.com.If the tenant has only one vanity domain and the .onmicrosoft.com domain, there is no issue. It allows keeps the currently configured @nancydomain.com.The problem is that if an admin is not attentive, he may change the alias for a DG because the UI has changed from the currently configured option.

comments.text: This issue make some annoy with which tenant have many domains.

header: Remove the ability for users to unsubscribe from a group.

header: Distribution groups are bugged for rules
idea_text: If you have a DG in office 365 and then if your owa create a rule for emails from that group to go to a particular folder, it will also send emails from any members of that group into that folder.  So the rule gets applied to members of the group and not just emails from that group address.  This only happens on Distribution groups not 0365 groups. I didn't see a section for Distribution groups so I posted here.

header: Provide the availability of changing the setting of External sharing on GUI by the Modern site as well as the Classic site.
idea_text:
*English follows Japanese■Title(件名)：Office 365 グループ サイトの外部共有設定についてProvide the availability of changing the setting of External sharing on GUI by the Modern site as well as the Classic site.
***************
■Description(内容):
​Office 365 グループ サイトの外部共有を許可する、許可しないなどの設定は、現在 "Set-SpoSite" のコマンドレットを実行して変更する必要があるが、クラシック サイトと同じように GUI 上でもできるようにしてほしい。Currently, the External sharing of Office 365 group site needs to be executed the "Set-SpoSite" cmdlet to change the setting to enable/disable. In addition to this, we hope the feature will provide the availability of this setting on GUI in the Modern site as well as the Classic site.Thank you for your continued support.

header: Microsoft money
idea_text:
I am an avid office user and windows app developer from the Northwest. I'm interested in a thriving Microsoft therefore, and am more than a little concerned about Microsoft's future, exemplified in its lack of a quality mobile finance app on its App Store. I've started a petition on Change.org to hopefully encourage Microsoft to show its own unwavering support of its mobile platform by resurrecting Microsoft Money as a mobile competitor to Intuit's Mint.  I've also recommended a full version of Money be made available through Office and Office 365. I'd appreciate it if you could check out the petition, consider signing it, and recommend it to your Office user group. A thriving Microsoft is in all of our best interest. Letting Microsoft know that there are still people out here supporting its efforts, may go a long way in keeping all our careers relevant. You can visit the petition here:  It's in its grass root stages, but others have supported the effort, including some Microsoft based news sites like musttechnews and onmsft. You can read some of their well stated support for the effort here: Anyway, I'd appreciate your support.All the best
Jay

header: Allow policy to disable users deleting O365 Groups
idea_text: Currently there's an option to create a global policy (not just via OWA but across all O365 integrated applications) that prevents users from creating O365 groups unless they are administrators or part of an approved exclusion group. This is a great way to limit the ability of users to create groups unsanctioned but we've faced a recent issue where a user was testing out a the new Planner and accidentally deleted the linked O365 groups. Considering the functionality to restore O365 groups has been on the Roadmap for a while not, having the option to block users from deleting them in the first place is critical. We want sysadmins only to manage user control over Groups, either creating or deleting - something which was present in Exchange a long time ago with RBAC.

In that group is another distro  that  is for internal use only.  It would be nice if the internal distribution group woudl accept mail sent to the external one. This would allow us to keep the internal group pure from outside access but still allow one place to manage users in different departments. The reason is that our external groups rarely change while our internal can change quarterly.

header: Simple Way to activate send "as" or "on behalf"
idea_text:
Some of our users want to be able to use the O365 group to send mail "as" or "on behalf".
Is it possible to add a possibility to activate this feature with a simple checkbox on the O365 group to limit the impact in terms of administration?

header: OWA - add multiple contacts from global address book
idea_text: In current OWA on O365 is not possible to add multiple contacts into own address book at same time. From MS Outlook from desktop version is excellent to use advanced filtering for search exactly what I want and add. More is described in this topic.

header: Ability to hide/remove the Join button/link
idea_text: Even though I have hidden groups from the Address List, there are ways to get around so the students can see the teacher created groups. Please provide the ability to hide the Join button on each group. This could be a parameter of Set-UnifiedGroup or a parameter in the AddressBookPolicy.  Either will be great!

header: view group members by name, not email address
idea_text: When I view my contacts they are listed by name and I have some control over the view order. However, in my groups everyone is listed by their email address and I have no control over the view.  It is impossible to view and find group members when their email address does not reflect their actual name.  We should be able to view group members by name, first or last, as we do contacts.

comments.text: I have the same problem. Outlook 2010 displays name and email address whereas 365 just displays the email address twice yet the heading says name.  Why is this? How come this fault wasn't spotted prior to sign off?

header: one group notifying another
idea_text: I'd like to be able to add an event to the calendar that would populate to other group members' calendars without sending multiple notifications and that every member can view if they look at the group calendar. Currently I add to the calendar and then have to send it to the group, where we get multiple emails and reminders, even though I set it to no reminders. We want to use this for scheduling purposes, but without all the clutter. Another thing I've noticed is that, as a member of two groups in our company, I create the group calendar event for the whole group, but my other group (which is not associated with the previous group) sends out notifications about the calendar event. This is also confusing and cluttering.

header: When I create an OOO calendar event on my calendar, i want to invite the office group but don't want the members to get the event.
idea_text:
OK – I wanted to document the use case and be very prescriptive:
As an employee of a company, 
I want to see a calendar that shows when others are out of the office
 so I can plan task delegation and my own time off.
 
•	The OOO employee is required to create an OOO event on their own individual calendar 
•	The OOO employee is required to invite the OOOCalendar so that the event shows up on that calendar
•	The event on the OOOCalendar reflects the same status as the event on the OOO employees individual calendar (i.e. if Away, it shows away, etc.)
•	The viewing employee can click on the OOOCalendar and see the view of all who are scheduled to be unavailable
•	The OOO employee's event does NOT show on the viewing employees individual calendar (i.e. the event is not forwarded to the viewing employees individual calendar)
•	The viewing employee can see the OOOcalendar on any deviceBased on those requirements above, MS does not have a single capability that can do all of the above.  An Office Group forwards events to the end user’s calendar by default, a shared calendar does not automatically accept the event and subsequently only shows the item as tentative, viewing a shared calendar on a mobile device is very clunky.Its too bad the Office Group doesn’t work as advertised in that you cannot keep members from getting copies of events without having the end user make the change on their end.Final simple workflow example:  I’m taking today off but forgot to update my calendar.  On my smartphone, I create a calendar item for today that shows me OOO and I invite the OOOCalendar  as well and send the update.  What should happen is that the OOOCalendar shows me as OOO, my calendar shows me as OOO and nobody in the company gets anything placed on their calendar.

header: Stop displaying long numbers in CSV files as "scientific notation"
idea_text:
Here's a novel "idea", how about just display the user's data as it is without doing something extremely dumb to it?if the user has a long number in their data, don't convert it to 'scientific notation'.This has to be the dumbest "feature" in Excel. I'd venture that .001% of your users are actual "scientists". And I'd venture that .001% of them find this feature useful.You are breaking people's data.For example:
"00115128100161100001"That's a serial number. Therefore every single digit is significant. Don't convert 00115128100161100001 to "1.15128E+17" because that is dumb.Don't convert  00115128100161100001 to 115128100161100000 because that is also dumb. The leading zeros matter. The trailing 1 matters.Jesus. Just display the people's data is it *******. If they want to convert the data to show in a specific format, then they have the tools to do it. Jesus. Don't be ******* dumb.

header: Need a sample script which allows us to export content search results
idea_text:
Although you provide a sample script to create a content search rule, you do not provide a sample script to export a content search result.
For downloading the results, we need to go to the Office 365 Security & Compliance, then Search > Content search > Exports > Regenerate report > Generate report. The Results.csv report contains results for different records such as contents title, sent time and date, received time and date.
I would like to perform the same action by using PowerShell.

header: Office 365 グループまたは Office 365 グループに紐づいたサイトが作成されたら管理者に通知を送信する方法
idea_text:
(English follows Japanese)Office 365 グループに紐づいたサイトの展開が進んでいますが、管理権限のない一般ユーザーによっても簡単にサイトが作成できてしまう点を懸念しています。たとえば、次のようなインターフェースを使用すると、管理者以外のユーザーにも簡単に Office 365 グループに紐づいたサイトが作成できてしまいます。* Outlook Web Access
* Planner
* SharePoint サイト (Sharepoint.aspx)
* Stream
* Teams
* OneDrive (従来の UI)このような現状を踏まえ、Office 365 グループ、または Office 365 グループに紐づいたサイトが作成された場合、管理者あてに通知が届くようなシステムが管理上必要であろうと考えます。通知機能の新設を検討いただくようお願いします。Admin should receive an alert when Office 365 Group / related Site collection is created by non-admin usersMicrosoft is deploying widely Office 365 Group / related Site Collection to the tenants and I am apprehensive that non-admin users can freely create a new site collections. For example, following features enable non-admin users to create Office 365 Group related site collections easily:* Outlook Web Access
* Planner
* SharePoint Site (Sharepoint.aspx)
* Stream
* Teams
* OneDrive (Classic UI)Basing on this situation, I believe alert to admin feature on creation of Office 365 Group / related Site collection is required from administrative point of view. Please look into this.

header: Market Office 365 Groups consistently across all tools and pages (not "Planner" or "Outlook Groups")
idea_text: Really simple request, please market Office 365 Groups under the same label across all tools and pages. Our users have a hard time understanding that the "Planner" if part of Office 365 Groups and that "Create new plan" actually creates a new Group. Likewise, on the OWA page and in the Outlook 2016 client, Office 365 Groups are just called "Groups" and in the mobile app, they're called "Outlook Groups". Please label them as Office 365 Groups everywhere or if too long, come up with a new term like "OneGroup" or "OneTeam".

header: Allow non O365 group members to access more than just conversations in Planner
idea_text: When I create a new plan the group members are often not all O365 customers.  To make Planner work well, I need to be able to allow them access and download files, make read entries in OneNote sections.This goes along with needing the ability to send out emails to group members individually.

header: Ability to view attachments in emails saved to OneDrive
idea_text: When emails are moved from outlook to one drive for backup or sharing, they can be viewed using the web interface.  However, you can not view the attachments within the email.  This seems like a simple enhancement to the viewer that is displaying the email.

header: Share the whole library with the same UI and options as apply to folder in that library
idea_text:
If I want to share all the files in a document library I can either do repeat sharing file or I can make an (old fashioned) folder, move the files into that and share the folder but I can't just share the library.
So I want a share options for the whole library with the same options as the sharing UI for items in the library.

header: Enable update-AddressList in Offfice 365
idea_text:
New address lists aren't automatically updated in Exchange Online. Additionally, the Update-AddressList and Update-GlobalAddressList cmdlets aren't currently available in Exchange Online. This behavior is by design.WORKAROUND   
 
 After you create the address list, make a change to each object that the recipient filter applies to. To do this, use one of the following procedures, as appropriate for your situation.
If you have an on-premises and cloud environment that's using Active Directory synchronization
1.Set or change an attribute for all users in the local installation of Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS) who correspond to the filter objects. For example, specify a value for the CustomAttribute1 parameter. To do this, follow these steps:1.Open the Exchange Management Shell.
2.Run the following commands. The following set of commands specifies a value of "temp value" for the CustomAttribute1 parameter.
$mbxs = Get-Mailbox –ResultSize Unlimited $RemoteMBX = Get-RemoteMailbox –ResultSize Unlimited $mbxs | Set-Mailbox –CustomAttribute1 “temp value” $RemoteMBX | Set-RemoteMailbox –CustomAttribute1 “temp value” The workaround is pretty time consuming in a large organization, so I suggest enabling update address list feature, like in exchange Server

header: Outlook for Mac 15.35 MIME parsing issue
idea_text: For some reason starting 15.34-ish, Outlook on the Mac has developed a MIME email format parsing issue.  I have worked with MS Office Support and they could not offer a fix, rather they suggested I post on this forum.For some reason, my personal email which is based on a IMAP connection to Zoho Mail has all the sudden got corrupted.  I’ve spoke to Zoho Mail Support and after researching things on their end, the issue is with Outlook.  I’ve tried other mail clients, like Mac Mail.App and Outlook on Windows, both work fine.  Also, my iPhone has no issue.  So the issue, certainly seems to be Outlook for Mac specific.  I have even tried a different Mac, and the same issue shows itself.  For what it is worth, I only started experiencing the issue after a recent Office update was applied.  Zoho Mail Support believes that Outlook is not parsing the emails correctly, and hence my request for the Outlook Product Engineering team to explore this problem more deeply and fix it in a subsequent patch.

comments.text: I am having the exact same issue this is not acceptable!  I would like to read my old mail!!!

I just upgraded to 15.36.  Before I upgraded, I went ahead and removed all my old personal mail accounts (***@kgala.com, , and ).  After installing the 15.36 update, I added back all the accounts.  Sadly, the previous behavior you were helping to resolve from ***@kgala.com has now spread to  too.It seems that filed email in IMAP accounts created after 15.3x are not being handled right in Outlook for Mac.

header: Group auto-reply for email to individual members
idea_text: When an employee leaves the organization, the admin should add them to the "quitters" group.  Then when an email is sent to any individual in that group and auto-reply is generated saying "this person is no longer employeed, blah blah."  The admin shouldn't have to configure an auto-reply for each individual who leaves the organization, just for the group.

comments.text: I like this idea because we don't want to keep a licensed user around much after they've left, but to have another 60, 90, 120, etc days to auto-reply without having to keep the licenses assigned to leavers would be great.  Trouble is I DO want those to be unique messages. In the areas of our business that care about the autoreplies, it is important for them to give information out about who replaced them and who the customers should contact instead.

header: Get-UnifiedGroup WhenCreated field should reflect when the Unified Group was created and not changed when moved in backend.
idea_text: Currently, Get-UnifiedGroup field WhenCreated is changed when the group is moved to a different back-end database by Microsoft. It should never change and should only show the date when the Unified Group was actually created.

comments.text: Testing shows this is no longer an issue. The WhenCreated and WhenCreatedUTC attributes do not change when you run a New-MoveRequest cmdlet to change the back end database of a unified group.

header: Custom or additional privacy types

header: distribution group reject permissions exchange online admin WEB GUI issue
idea_text: In active directory / exchange the ability to set DL group attribute permissions to REJECT (unAuthOrig[users],dlMemRejectPerms[groups] specific users / groups exists, however this feature does not exist in the web management of exchange online. The settings are synced from active directory or exchange, but exchange online doesn't support the ability to create DL's with the ability to reject specific users or groups and it also cannot display the synced attribute data mentioned above.It would be helpful for customers if exchange online admin management of groups supported the ability to see the synced rejected permissions of users and groups to a distribution list and also have the ability to reject users and groups for distribution lists created directly within exchange online admin.

header: Teams und Schule
idea_text:

Wie bei einem Kalender mit Spalten für die einzelnen Tage. Die Kategorien könnten mit Farben unterschiedlich gestaltet sein und die Uhrzeit defaultmässig gar nicht erscheinen. Und diese Darstellungsoption sollte nicht nur für den Computer sondern vor allem auch für mobile devices wie das iPad möglich sein. Schliesslich wollen Sie ja, dass Lehrer und Schüler es nutzen sollen.
Ausserdem ist es ein Mist, dass die Kursunterlagen auf dem iPad gar nicht via Teams erreichbar sind, auf dem Computer aber schon. 
Dass im SharePoint bzw. dann in OneDrive auf dem iPad etc. die Dateien, die in Teams erscheinen noch in einem Ordner General versteckt sind, ist auch suboptimal.

header: Allow Different Icons for Different Planner Plans in the Same Group
idea_text: I run a small architecture firm of three people.We work on many projects, but there are only three of us, so we have only one team containing one channel. (If we had a channel for every project, all of us would be on all the channels, and nobody would remember to change to the right channel before posting. It would be pointlessly granular.)So we add multiple Planner tabs to our one channel.The problem is that all of these plans inherit the icon of the channel, which makes finding the right plan in Planner (on the web or on iOS) difficult; they all have the same icon!Please allow plans belonging to a channel to have their own icons.

header: How to handle past employees email
idea_text: How to handle past employees email addresses. When an employee leaves, it is useful to monitor their email address in case customers who previously contacted them, do so again using the past employee's email address. I was able to create a group which received all email for specific users, so such communication could be monitored by a current employee. This is no longer possible as the ability to add email aliases to a group has been withdrawn. Please reinstate this.

header: Provide a way for administrators to disable the option for 'Distribution List' owners to upgrade the 'DL' to a Office 365 Group.
idea_text: Please allow for a tenant configuration under Office 365 Group - Allow Owners to upgrade 'Distribution List' or add an attribute to the DL that would allow the owner to upgrade it.  Another option could be since you can only perform this upgrade in OWA - add something to the OWA Policy all this feature based on your policy.

comments.text: We had a related issue. We are new to Office 365 and in setting it up originally set up a number of DLs. Upon opening the Admin panel the other day, we saw a notification that we could upgrade the DL, but there was no info as to what the upgrade was. Believing that the upgrade was some sort of enhancement, we upgraded the DLs and only found out later that in doing so, it removed the Send As and On Behalf Of permissions. We will enter another recommendation to preserve the Send As and On Behalf Of settings when upgrading DLs to O365 groups.

header: Fix links in Planner tasks so that they can handle URLs with ampersands
idea_text:
According to MS Support, a recent security update now means that you cannot add attachments of type "link" to a task in Planner if it includes an ampersand.
This means you can't link to another plan, a notebook, notebook page, etc. etc.
Obviously there must have been some security problem which made this change necessary.
My suggestion is to find a better way of protecting security, while still allowing us to add links to other content in Planner and Office 365.

header: Deleting an on  premises DL should not delete a group
idea_text: We ran into this problem a couple of weeks ago.  Someone created an on prem DL with an SMTP address that happened to match a 365 group.  They realized that this was a mistake, deleted the DL, which synchronized and deleted the cloud group, along with all the data.  There was no warning about this, and the data is unrecoverable.  This synchronized delete should not delete a cloud group.

header: Teams - Grading history in assignments when assignment is re-submitted.
idea_text: We want an audit trail with history of grades, work, and comments when an assignment is sent back to a student to be re-submitted.

header: semi dynamic membership
idea_text: We would like to merge the capabilities of dynamic membership on O365 Groups along with the group owner able to add/remove users manually. This is both automatic (based on criteria, such as department) and manual, in that an owner can add individuals that aren't dynamically eligible but still need access to resources or be part of an O365 Group (or Team, or other service that uses the O365 Groups). In the meantime we will be exploring a way to do this programatically, but I think it could be very useful in others' environments as well, where it's inconvenient to be manual but also too broad of a method to only use dynamic criteria. We could avoid some of this if a O365 Groups allowed nesting, but it sounds like that's not an immediate option.

header: Enable Office 365 Groups for OnPrem Exchange (Hybrid Mode)
idea_text: We are using an OnPrem Exchange Server and O365 Exchange Online. User mailboxes are completely in the cloud, but the mail flow will be sent to our local datacenter (to the OnPrem Exchange) and this will forward the mail to the cloud mailbox. But our Office 365 Groups have own subdomains. The mail flow of this Groups should be directed directly to the Cloud Exchange. The MX entries are set correctly to the office 365 cloud, but through the hybrid config the cloud exchange send the mail to On Prem Exchange and this one can´t know the Office 365 Groups addresses and the mail wouldn´t be delivered. It would be a great feature, if the local OnPrem Exchange could handle Office 365 groups.

comments.text: I think this is solved. At our On-Premises Exchange Server are all O365 Groups visible due to AAD-Connect settings.

header: UI error when attempting to share a file hosted in a Office 365 Group
idea_text: Here is how to replicate the error:1. Start in Outlook Online.2. Click on the name of a Office 365 Group in order to enter it's "portal".3. Switch to the "Files" view (do not "Browse the Library or switch to the "Site" view).4. View one of the files hosted in the Office 365 group.5. Click on the "Share" button. Nothing will happen.Looking at the developer console in Chrome, you can see that the following error occurs when the "Share" button is clicked:WordViewer.js:2 Failed to execute 'postMessage' on 'DOMWindow': The target origin provided (') does not match the recipient window's origin ('.I've confirmed that this is a reproducable bug w/the support team. They recommended that I post this via UserVoice for additional exposure.FYI: The "Share" button works if you either "Browse the Library" first, or if you switch to the "Site" view for the Office 365 group.

header: Ability to hide the create an O365 Group function in every O365 application
idea_text: Currently, users are still being presented with the option to create a Team, Site, Plan etc in each application even though we've restricted this at the tenant level. As a result users try to create (an O365 Group) and encounter an error saying that it has been disabled. This results in a poor user experience and extra calls to our service desk team. Both of these could be resolved by either 1) only displaying the option to someone who can create a group, or 2) a tenant wide option to hide the create a group functionality. Our preference is #2 as all group creation is triggered via Service Now requests.

header: Make Windows 10 outlook group nitfications open outlook groups - not the store.
idea_text: If you receive a notification in Windows 10 abut an outlook group message clicking on it does not take you to the message but rather to the store page for outlook groups. I suspect this is because you have dropped the app for Window 10 and the notifications engine doesn't know this, looks for a handler, fails and helpfully finds the store app (which won't run on a non-phone - very annoying anyway for tablet users). Basically this is a bug rather than a feature request.

header: Option for Distribution Groups to "send as" someone other than spoofing the original sender
idea_text: We have MANY distribution groups with internal and external recipients. When an external member sends to the group, the message goes back out to all members with the FROM spoofed as the original sender. This causes a problem with many mail systems spam filters (e.g. Barracuda) because it sees an internal address coming from outside their system, and blocks the message as spoofed and sends an NDR. If the external sender is on Gmail, no NDR is generated, and the original sender never gets a copy. Both confuse external users greatly, and generates support calls. I need an option to change a group so the FROM comes from the group (or whatever), the reply to could be the original sender. But there needs to be some kind of option so we are not spoofing external email addresses from distribution groups.

header: Avoid creating groups with the same name. Improve Groups provisioning
idea_text:
Many times my users create a second O365 group because they really wanted to enable Planner on the same O365 Group they already have created... so they create a new plan with the same name like the group they have.
My idea: when they press the Create new group button, they should get a list of groups they already own and are not enabled for that application. So if they click Create new team, they get a list of all the O365 groups they own but are not already Teams enabled and with the option of : Hey, if you cannot find what you need here, create a new Team here! Similar behaviour with Planner and all other apps that generate O365 groups.

header: "Pin" group members
idea_text: We have automated group membership for Office 365 groups based on our HR system. A frequent request from the group owners is to add a member to a department group that does not belong to that department. These exceptions is starting to pile up and get harder and harder to manage.A nice feature would be for the group owners to be able to "pin" members they have added. The pinned members would have a different member type (other than owner or member) when you fetch them with PowerShell or the Graph API. The pin would also show up in the different GUIs for managing group membership.

header: Stop making me acknowledge my own emails in distribution groups
idea_text: I am on team Zero Inbox and it's pretty annoying that when I send an email to an internal company distribution group whether 5 people or 50, that I get a pop-up alert that I've sent an email to a group that includes myself. Even when I turn off those alerts, in order to get back down to zero and do focused work I have to click my own email to acknowledge it so that it goes from unread to read. Outlook should function more like Gmail in that when you reply to a thread, it shows your reply, but your Inbox count doesn't tick up from 0 to 1 requiring you to go "read" your own email to get it back down to 0.

header: How about a way to customize the email that is generated when a users is added to a Team?
idea_text: We would like to be able to customize the message generated when a user is added to a Team.  We would like [it to be company branded and provide some governance info to the user.

header: Allow shared mailbox message be moved my rules automatically to users inbox.
idea_text: I would like to be able to move or copy messages from a shared mailbox by automatic rule to users inbox.  Right now the rule only works if run manually....

header: When deleting an O365 Group, Teams is not mentioned as being affected by the action
idea_text: When deleting an O365 Group, the user receives a warning that several apps will be affected (Planner, SharePoint, etc) but Teams is not listed. The user may not realize that Teams is also affected when the Group is deleted, which will trigger a restore operation.

header: Group Photo Clip Art
idea_text: I would love to see clip art as the default photo for a group instead of the icon with the initials in it.  I wonder if key words from the group name could be automatically searched and 3 suggestions offered.

header: Remove the banner screens displayed when IOS Apps start they waste valuable time.
idea_text: e.g. when you start the IOS Excel App it displays a banner screen with the Excel icon and the MS icon and name at the bottom.  Then it goes to the file list. This wastes my valuable time.  Please go straight to the file list, like it used to.

header: Ability to identify what functionality is associated with a Group.
idea_text: It would be great to be able to see from the admin screen, which functionality is active in a group, e.g. Outlook, SharePoint, Planner, Teams etc.

header: Quickly add all group members to scheduling assistant
idea_text: Add group to scheduling assistant to quickly schedule meetings with large O365 groups. currently I have to manually paste each group member into scheduling assistant to see their availability.

header: Mailchimp connector should accept the other mailchimp events
idea_text: Mailchimp has a number of valuable events that trigger webhook calls.  Currently the connector in O365 groups only supports Campaign result email.   Other useful events are unsubscribe, subscribe, clean, etc.Tried to use the general Webhook connector to capture these, but Mailchimp reported the url was not valid receiver

header: compress conversations/threads like in mailbox
idea_text: I would like to be able to compress the conversations/threads like I can in my mailbox. It would serve users a better overview. I think they are to big on the screen now compared to conversations in the mailbox.

comments.text: Agree! The conversations UI should be changed to look/function more like an online forum/board:  Instead of all the conversations appearing as though they're part of a single, continuous chat... Display a list of conversations, each of which can be "opened" or expanded.Also, the "Start new conversation" text box needs to be moved to the top.  As it stands, its bottom placement reinforces the bad practice of treating the channel as a single conversation.Perhaps this should be offered as a option for the UI's presentation.

header: Guests Need Collaboration Rights
idea_text: Our director uses an email address from our parent organization. That organization also has an Office365 system. I wanted to add him as a contributing guest to one of our Office365 groups, but guests to groups currently are only allowed read-only permissions. I would like to see an option to allow an external guest editing permissions since we can give editing rights to onedrive documents to external guests.

header: Simplify Sending out as Group
idea_text: It is very common for someone to want to send out as the group, I.e. marketing, support, etc.  I know one can be set with send as and send on behalf of rights, but actually sending out from the group interface is very tricky.  It would be helpful to have the ability to change the From address on the Groups interface.

header: No more access to edit group's members by user
idea_text:
Since webmail's options have changed, a user can't change anymore the group's members that he ownsWhy is it not possible anymore ?
It was very important to myself.Thanks

header: Invite group calendar from personal with option to include all members
idea_text:
Some users in our environment are used to inviting a SharePoint calendar for PTO or work from home notices and then members of the team can check that calendar for these. With the move to o365 groups this functionality does not seem available. They are doing this from their Outlook 2016 clients and not OWA1. The user can create the event on their calendar and add the group, but then all members of the group get the invite in their inboxes and the event shows up on their calendar as well.
2. User can create the invite on the group calendar and try to use 'add to my calendar', but there is an unsatisfactory delay for when they would see the event on their calendar that is not ideal.
3. They could add the event in OWA and uncheck the 'send meeting invitation to group members', but that is not ideal either as most our users do not use OWA. The best option is have options to send calendar invites to group calendars where not all members get the invite from a personal calendar in the Outlook client. The event would show on the group calendar for reference but not on the member's calendars

header: Office 365 Groups Calendar display more than three events per day
idea_text: I am planning a shared calendar to combine four categories of group meetings. I have used colour coding to distinguish the four meeting categories but if I have events for all four categories on one day, only three of them appear (all are whole-day events). There is a little 1+ link to show more, but no one is going to click that. Everything else about using a Groups Calendar works well, but this problem means that I will not be able to use Groups Calendar for this purpose. It would be good if I, as an administrator, I could adjust this so that four events are visible in one day.

header: import ICS link to Group Calendar
idea_text:
It would be great to have a single Group/Shared Calendar that is added/imported into the Group Calendar. I have the Shared Folder/Email; no calendar...
I have the Group; no calendar import...What I do have is a Google public calendar ICS link that I can add as "other", but not one I can plan from an internal shared calendar. I would prefer to share an internal resource with the team than an external link.Perhaps it is there, and I haven't seen it or don't know what to look for.

header: Show and edit Group Calendars in Windows 10 Calendar App
idea_text: It should be possible to show and edit group calendars in the Windows 10 preinstalled Calendar App as well.

header: Why do I have to get bills in Euro and not in my national currency?
idea_text: I bought Office 365 Business Premium and got a bill in euros. This complicates accounting for tax purposes, because I have to use a conversion factor every month into national currency. Is it any intent to change it?

header: Make it user friendly to put our clients into groups ...ON A MAC!  It does not work consistently !
idea_text:
I need to separate "buyers" from "Sellers" and Vendors, etc,, etc. 
It is EXTREMELY convoluted process on a MAC!  Too much "point and click" and having to go to so many different screens. We need to categorize/group the client AT THE TIME WE INPUT IT into our system. - not AFTER we input it.   and not from the "group" screen.  365 does not work very well on a MAC ! Needs major improvement to become "user friendly" and more efficient.  I have called Microsoft many times and even your best tech helpers have difficulty.  Also - how about getting rid of the colored balloons?  They take up too much space. This is a BUSINESS platform.

header: Load "Search" Box on SharePoint Site page sooner
idea_text: Presently, the "search" box on SharePoint site pages loads quite late in the process. When it finally does load it causes all of the menu items underneath to shift downwards. This is problematic, as anxious users frequently click on the wrong menu item ("Conversations" instead of "Documents," for instance) if they click before the "search" box finishes loading. Loading the "search" box container earlier in the process would prevent this.

comments.text: Yes please fix this!  It's extremely problematic.  The whole page needs to load quicker and any points offered for clicking MUST not move around before those clicks are processed!

header: reply sender in group post
idea_text: What possible justification is there to restrict a user from being able to reply only to the sender in a message posted in a Group? Currently Reply All is the only option, which includes the sender and the Group. It is not possible to delete the Group addressee. This is unnecessarily restrictive, and results in significant Group clutter with reply messages that are best sent only to the original sender. Previously it was possible to more finely control recipients. This straight-jacket was introduced in the latest 'upgrade' to Web O365. Not an improvement.

header: Enable teams to be connected to (existing) Professional Learling Comminities
idea_text: Enable teams to be connected to (existing) Professional Learling Comminities. In collaboration with Microsoft support we discovered it's currently only possible to connect a new team to an (existing) standard group. Due to the simple fact that PLC's are private by default and standard groups are public by default, we encourage our users (teachers, school management and students) to use PLC's exclusively. We like the idea of having the ability to add a chat-centred way of collaborating for all of our users. Ideally we would see Groups/PLC's and teams as different tools supporting different styles of collaborating on the same information. Therefor we'd like to have the ability to connect and disconnect teams to any type of digital collaboration space in Office 365, currently Teams connected to PLC's and Sharepoint Teamsites are the most obvious for us.

header: Outlook Advanced Search Improvement
idea_text:
Hi All
Outlook Advanced Search has not been improved upon for several generations and I rely upon advanced search heavily as often have to search past emails for a certain topic or name.  
Here are some things to consider
For the field "Search for Names' add two or three of these fields or support Boolean.  This will allow end users to do more complicated searches  on combination of different key words
Provide population of possible names based on recent searches:  MS email has this capability.  Please provide this in advanced search as well.  Currently I have to open an email, search for the name, copy it on my clip board, and then go back to advanced search.  If I just use the name search it assumes I remember how to spell the name - Yeah right. :)
Thank you!

header: Make the sync client work - once, the way it is supposed to.
idea_text: The sync client is appalling. Granted on Windows 10 it seems to work. If you have EVER used the Groove client it appears to be impossible to ever uninstall it and install the new sync client. We have about four different types of user experiences, from "it syncs but the files are not in the One Drive - "your company" folder, to it randomly crashing, to having a One Drive folder and a company folder. You need to rip up One Drive and start again. It is a horrific tool for a business to use.

header: Approval message moderation
idea_text: I think it will be a good idea to have an option to send message to moderators for approval before they are delivered to members of the Office 365 group. Same setup as it exist like in distribution groups.This cannot be done via mail flow rules (tested with Office 365 support and not working). With mail flow rule, you can setup the rule to forward mails to approval, but the problem is that emails sent to the group are delivered to members regardless of the choice moderators made.

header: New Office365 groups vs. project sites
idea_text:
As we know, the will be no more possibility to add a mailbox to SharePoint site (starting from March 2017). This big problem for us because so far we were making separate site (with mailbox) for each case (or others could be called project). I wander then if we will be able to use Office365 Groups as case (project) sites/containers . I know that there is other software Microsoft Projects for this purpose, but many companies needs only to keep so called "cases", where in a case (or project) there are stored only files, links and emails. 
Assuming that we may create any numer (even hundreds or thousands) groups Office365, this should be possible.
But how to display thousands of groups? Or how to search them. 
So called "case" (or simplified project) needs also some information to search. One would be a name of case (here we can use group name instead). But matter would have to be searched with customer/contractor name.
So there would be good if a group (here I understand "case") has an additional filed called for example "Subject".  But the subject name would have to be taken from a list (customers).
Anyway: I hope there may be some better way to work with thousands cases in Grups (or better SharePoint online)

Here Gmail is a medium that connects Outlook for Mac and MS Outlook. The OLM files export to PST.

header: Publick Folder connections and more Transport Rules
idea_text:
Hello Dear,
in our work we use a lot of transport rules in order to optimize the work of mail and strengthen control over the work performed by employees.
We also actively use mail-enabled shared folders.After migration to office 365, we ran into the problem of limiting the maximum number of transport rules, which is extremely uncomfortable for us and we had to change a lot in our work.
The second problem is the number of concurrent connections to shared folders in the on-line collection - many of our colleagues work under the same account and connect to folders under it - as a result, some of them connect to folders.
as users of personal account can be lost to some very popular folders - this creates great difficulties in our work.Therefore, we very much ask you to consider the possibility
1. increase the number of transport rules for example from 500 to 1000 (if no-limit is not possible)
2. increase the number of simultaneous connections to the community folders
 - for one account (under which several users work)
 - for all public folders so that they do not fall off from the team with personal accounts.

header: MS Teams and 'hidden' Groups mailbox
idea_text: I was unaware that creation of an MS Teams site also creates a MS Group 'behind the scenes' including a mailbox for the Group.To an end-user, the email address for such a Group looks just like an email distribution list but doesn't act like one by default; rather than emails being sent to each individual member's Inbox, emails are sent to the Group mailbox. This is counter-intuitive.As we're using an old Outlook 2010 client still, access to the Groups mailbox in Outlook 2010 is not straightforward. Neither is it easy to force delivery of these emails to member's mailboxes - each member has to 'Follow' the Group.It would be preferable to have this relationship much more obvious in the configuration of the Teams site, e.g. allow the Team Owner to specify that specified or all members will automatically follow the Group; allow each Team member to specify if they want to 'Follow' the Group, etc.I would even live with the Teams site not having a Group 'under' it at all but I realise that would require some hefty re-engineering...

idea_text: Given that we can now have multiple plans for a group, it's very easy for task names to be re-iterated.  To be clearer, the emails from planner should include the plan name and bucket name, as well as the task name

header: Use the real name for group mail and one note
idea_text: Just food for thought here - We have so many conversations with leads who do not understand why Office 365 Groups rename features that already have a name like "Conversations", this is a group email, and "Notebook" which is OneNote. Based on this feedback I think it might be easier to understand what these features are, without having to poke around, if they were just named what they are: GroupMail and OneNote. It might seem obvious to a lot of people, but it is definitely confusing for older generations and SMB types.

Now that my organization needs to make that move, I'm hesitant to continue to use those applications.

header: Forbid the creation of a user with the same alias of an existing group
idea_text: Once upon a time we had a working group. Then suddenly we could not see any email thread in it or its calendar, and users could not join or leave the group.We opened a ticket with the support, and it took about 3 months time to understand the root cause: somehow someone managed to create an unlicensed user with the same alias of the group. Once we deleted that user, the group started to work again as it used to.Forbidding the creation of a user with the same alias of a group would have made our life easier and we would have not wasted so much time in debugging an error that can be easily prevented.

header: Create  a new type of group or Limit the members of Distribution or Unified group to 100 or so.
idea_text:
We currently have groups which are made by users who then add hundreds of users there. 
While the user feels empowered to make the groups, it causes more work for O365 admins then it was needed, example unsolicited email send to these groups and it needs cleanup.

header: Improve organization of GroupMail
idea_text: With subscriptions, email is simply piling up in the inbox and not being cleaned up.  If these messages could be organized it could help.Thought 1: Teams utilizes channels for organization.  Could the O365 group inbox utilize these channels somehow?  The group inbox correlates to the channel "general" and then either inbox folders or hashtags could correlate to custom channels?  As a next step, could inbox subscriptions could utilize channels too?Thought 2: If groupmail inbox rules were available, we could create some organization manually.  Perhaps customizing the subscription messages too.

header: Office 365 enhancements needed to improve integration with team sites
idea_text:
Office 365 Groups enhancements needed:
 - enhanced Permissions
 - ability to hide any feature that is not needed (e.g. I would want to hide Group Files ... if you are using a team site document library, you do not need Group Files ... in fact it is confusing to end-users to have multiple places to add files, and interferes with with document management)

header: Add a Groups Timeline View to Help Summarize Collaborative Milestones
idea_text: As a manager, it would be nice to get a high level overview of what is happening within a Group as the collaboration occurs on projects and such. The Groups Timeline View would be similar in visuals to how the Project Summary timeline shows up in SharePoint, but instead of having tasks show up in the timeline, conversations, file additions/modifications, calendar updates, and notebook entries would be visualized as to when they were added and one could quickly jump to that conversation, file, calendar entry or notebook entry just by clicking on the timeline.In addition to visualizing when these pieces are added/modified within the group, the user can also highlight important snippets of information in conversations, calendars, files, and notebook entries and those would show up in the Timeline as "Collaboration Highlights" so that a user can show milestone progress during a Groups use over time.  The Timeline would have these 2 views built in: 1. The addition of the conversations, calendar entries, etc and 2. the Highlights view.The Timeline would be able to dynamically scale and one can zoom in to a particularly busy point in the Timeline as necessary.

header: Allow enforcing O365 identity in external Yammer networks
idea_text: Now that Office 365 connected groups can be enabled for Yammer networks, this feature should be extended to external networks. I understand that the first step here would be having an option to enforce O365 identity in external networks, as currently you can only enforce O365 identity in the home Yammer network.Without this feature, using Yammer in hierarchal organizations is significantly less effective. For example, a global company with offices around the world might want to set up external networks but still have access to corporate OneDrive or SharePoint libraries to share content and collaborate across the company. Without connected groups integration in external networks, content becomes siloed in these networks. Enabling O365 connected groups is a substantial improvement to Yammer, however organizations using external networks are not receiving this benefit. Enforcing O365 identity on all external networks is impractical as there may be external users, however there is value in being able to selectively enforce O365 identity in specific external networks. Please add the option to selectively enforce O365 identities in external networks or find another way to enable O365 connected groups in external networks on Yammer.

header: Groups shouldn't allow SMTP/UPN addresses as display names
idea_text: We recently had an issue where a user accidentally created a group by entering a user's full email address () as the group's display name. Later, when a different user (User B) tried to email User A the message instead ended up in the group's inbox. On investigation, the group's display name was the first thing auto-suggested/auto-completed by Outlook, and User B chose it instead of the real contact.This isn't just a bit awkward, and open to accidental disclosure of confidential information, but it could be exploited by a malicious actor inside the organization to lure unaware users into emailing a non-genuine account. I opened a support ticket to try and address this internally, but their only suggestion was to disable end-user creation of groups. This isn't a workable option in our environment.I did see feedback about Group Naming Policies, but unfortunately it appears that's now an Azure AD Premium P1 feature only.

header: How to create backup for Outlook Data file?
idea_text:
We should know how to store backup for emails, messages, contacts, appointments, notes, etc. if we are using Outlook Application any version including latest 2016. Below are steps which you can use to store backup for Outlook contacts.1) Open MS Outlook 2007 application
2) Click on File Menu
3) Go to Import and Export, from here click on ‘Export to a file’ and 
    click next
4) Select comma separated values and hit next
5) Select contacts and click next
6) Rename the exported file as ‘contacts’
7) Click on next for saving the exported contacts file. By default this 
    files goes to My Documents. You can also choose a preferred 
   location for saving this file by browsing through different locations on 
   your system. Also, if you want these contacts file or the backup file 
   could be uploaded to external drive.
8) Once done, click to Finish your backup creation process for Outlook 
     2007 contacts.
9) Now, for validating successful backup creation, you may visit the 
    destination folder where Outlook 2007 contacts have been saved.Also visit:  to know how to split pst file.

header: Get Act Together on CloudPbx and Skype for Business Licensing
idea_text: Your add-on plans for CloudPbx, PSTN, etc. state the Skype for Business client is included.  Talking with sales confirmed that they believe all the features of CloudPbx (including fundamental features like call forwarding) should be available with a combination of E1 and CloudPbx & PSTN add-ons.   However, if you don't have full Office versions installed under E3 or higher then you don't actually get these simple PBX features because E1 only incluldes SFB basic version.   Tech supports answer was we needed the Skype for Business Full version and we only paid for the CloudPbx service, not the software that would let us use it.  Why would anyone buy the add-on if the simpleset PBX features can't be used?   It's a ridculous answer and position for tech support to take.At the very lest you need sales and tech support to have the same answers.  If tech support is correct then you need to change your sales literature and make it clear that CloudPbx add-on only comes with a crippled version of Skype for Business that won't let you use fundamental PBX features.I think the proper answer here is to simply include a SFB full version install when the Cloud PBX/PSTN add-ons are purchased, regardless of whether or not a local Office install is there.  That way, small customers who only want the online office apps, but still want to use SFB for a phone solution can do so.I've been told by Sales, but have not confirmed it, that SFB Plan 2 does include the full version of SFB.   If this is true then solving the problem could just be a matter of including the same license to deliver SFB with the CloudPbx/PSTN add-ons.  If this is not true, then that is another error to correct on what you are telling customers.

header: Custom Themes, the Change the Look wizard and theme and logo inheritance through Hub Sites is currently broken
idea_text: I have recently noticed that custom themes for modern SharePoint sites created via PowerShell using the guidance in docs () break the Change the Look wizard. The error message 'There was an error while attempting to get the themes' appears.The wizard can be fixed by changing the theme using the 'Classic' wizard and changing the theme.Custom themes also reset to the SharePoint site default, seemingly at random, whilst breaking the wizard.Theme and logo inheritance from a Hub site is also broken.These issues have been reported to Microsoft in tickets: 15868798 and 16203826. I was advised that raising these issues via UserVoice was my only way to escalate. The same behaviour exists in both a test tenant and production, and in both Edge and Edgeium.

header: Allow add/update membership of Office 365 connected Yammer group by the group owner and / or members
idea_text: So this would make Office 365 connected Yammer groups in keeping with Office 365 connected Outlook groups - in Office 365 connected Outlook groups owners can add/update group membership.Forcing the management of Office 365 connected Yammer groups onto Office 365 admins is out of keeping with the pattern of collaboration established by the Office 365 connected Outlook groups.

header: Allow images to be imported to Outlook web - Out of office
idea_text: It would be really useful to allow images to be imported / pasted in Out of Office section of Outlook Web mail. As currently can't add any branding etc like you can in the signature section.

header: Bug: Quick edit in Sharepoint library failed to go to page 2 of the quick edit list.
idea_text: In O365 embedded Sharepoint Quick Edit option, if the list of records flow into page 2 of the list, for example, page 1 covers items 1-30, page 2 covers items 31-60 etc, if you click on the next page option, it will bring you back to the browse default page of the library instead of going to page 2.Have walk through with the Microsoft helpdesk and confirm that its a bug. The classic sharepoint view will work fine.

header: Index Yammer for search
idea_text: Index Yammer feeds along with SPO content for search results. Doing so will allow tacit knowledge to more easily be shared and vetted.

header: Know when the last email was sent to a distribution list.
idea_text: Know when the last email was sent to a distribution list.good morningWe would need to know when the last email has been sent to a distribution list so that these lists can be used.The only solution that Microsoft has given us is to see in the mail flow if an email has been sent in the last 90 days.thank you

header: Allow Project Web App to create a Mailbox email address WITHOUT having to create an entire Group for central email repository for projects
idea_text: Not sure this goes here, but it is the advent of Groups that caused the issue.  I used to be able to create a simple email address for projects on Project Web App.  However, now I am forced to create an entire Group to just obtain an email address.  I do not need the accompanying SharePoint site or Notebook or File sharing areas as I have that in PWA.  Can I just create a simple email address and use it in the PWA Mailbox area.

header: In Excel the keyboard command to insert date in a cell is Ctrl+;. This doesn't work in Office 365 for Mac. It gives you time not date
idea_text: It works as intended in Excel 365 for Windows but not for Mac. Can you correct it?

header: Make a TO DO part of a conversation, not a new conversation
idea_text:
TO DO´s should be attached to a Conversation within a Group and not create a new Conversation every time you create a TO DO. To distinguish them from a regular message it can have a light blue tint, for example. 
To have a new conversation every time you create a TO DO could make the Group unmanageable very fast.

header: Outlook365 on iPad with signed email (s/mime) and further attachments
idea_text:
Unfortunately, Outlook365 on the iPad does not display further attachments if the email has been just signed with a certificate. The real important content has not to be displayed as an attachment.
Today, only the s/mime file is displayed. Further attachments are not visible.Recommendation:
Ensure that the s/mime certificate and all further attachments become selectable to be opened on the IPad app for Outlook365.

header: Add sent items to the default web interface
idea_text: Instead of just having inbox, Junk, and outbox, include a sent items folder in the default web interface.  We are constantly reviewing and resending sent items.

header: Automatically subscribe to all Groups that your invited to
idea_text: If an owner accidentally forgets to subscribe new members to the Group, I would love an option that automatically subscribes to all new Groups I'm added to so I don't have to check to see if the owner remembered to select this option when creating the Group.

header: improve the parameter "site" in get-spouser to only show the actual permissions.
idea_text: If you use this command with the "-site" parameter to pull out a list of people with access to a sharepoint online site, it might include a lot of unwanted results. It will show users that are removed from the site as if they still have access (though they are not visible if you check the permissions list on the site in a browser). If you add a group to the members list, this result of this command includes users in that group whom have accessed the site at some point. Which means that if you have a group that consists of many people, this list can get pretty long.

header: Separate app for Office 365 groups

header: Control de permisos para ver los miembros de una lista de distribucion
idea_text:

Creo que seria conveniente el poder controlar quien puede desplegar y ver los miembros de una lista de distribución, por seguridad y privacidad.
Si se pueden controlar quien puede enviar a una lista de distribución, si no se controla el despliegue de la misma, todos los usuarios pueden ver y utilizar las listas de distribución.

header: OneDrive Library and SharePoint library Integration
idea_text: Firstly, when access SharePoint libraries in OneDrive, "New" does not automatically appear, users will need to refresh the page before ribbon is refreshed. Secondly document sets in the SharePoint library as well as document templates uploaded to "New" won't appear either. In looks like the ribbon is from OneDrive instead of from the Libraries of that SharePoint site. Finally, within a SharePoint library in OneDrive, clicking "go to site" takes the users to the landing page of the site instead of the library. Logically it should point to the libraries view to save users from clicking the whole process again.

header: there is problem with creating office365 group from outlook , it uses only default domain even we have other domains inside tenant !
idea_text:
there is problem with creating office365 group from outlook , it uses only default domain even though  we have other domains inside tenant ! 
after calling support and apply email address policy nothing changed and the support finally said  the problem is with design ! this problem violate privacy between domains , and i suppose Microsoft to change this behavior ASAP  .

header: In Team site document library, disable delete option for one member
idea_text: We have Team Sites for our Office 365 Groups. If this team site have the view only permission for members + visitors, and we give to a member the modification right on one directory in document library, he can add and modify content in the folder, he cannot rename this folder, but he can delete the folder.Is possible to fix this ?

header: Docoment Type Icon Takes Doesn't Update
idea_text: When you create a new folder and you drag a number of files to that folder in a group, the gear showing the progress of updating the document type icon (word, pdf, excel, etc) doesn't update upon completing the upload. For the user, it appears as if the files are still loading and yet that's not the case. This doesn't happen when using the classic view.

header: admin center groups
idea_text:
in the =365 Admin center =>From the Home Active userssection. there are only 3 lookups filtering the database of users, "Display Name - UserName - Status" there is no way from the "Add Custom View" to add more lookups to this screen to better organised and manage users. I need to add Groups to this screen, so that when i put users into O365 Groups, i can quickly select only those users in a specific group and then be able to modify certain data.such as bulk editing passwords, location data, departments etc. currently and for the last few years this has not been possible, the only way is via powershell. We admins need to be able to do this from the Admin UI in O365.
Please can you add this functionality, and any other functionality to organise users from the admin center.

header: Inform users when they are creating a Group what that entails (a.k.a. global address book entry, Planner, team site, etc)

We just want the calendar to hold dates as well as have meeting requests.

header: Hello everyone, Greetings from a Berlin, Germany and have a nice day. I would like to make a suggestion concerning the dictation concept in
idea_text:
Hello everyone,
Greetings from a Berlin, Germany and have a nice day.
I would like to make a suggestion concerning the dictation concept in Word.
What if the machine could learn my kind of speaking and dictating not only online but also offline with certain things I have to read so that the Programm can learn my style of speaking and dictating and can improve in recognising & understanding my speech and voice and so on?
I usually have my systems switched from German to English but use the Programm Word of course in the German language for the usual correspondence with companies and people around me.
Therefore, it is clear that the English speaking, or the recognition and dictation in English is the dominant & focus but I can dictate in Word already when I’m online, but the machine cannot learn and get better while analysing documents or my speech.  So, the quality of the speech recognition cannot improve.
This is a pity.
Can you help in that matter in the future – I would be delighted.
Thank you in advance and have a nice day again,
André

header: About behavior when editing Office 365 group calendar with read-only permission from Outlook Client
idea_text:
About behavior when editing Office 365 group calendar with read-only permission from Outlook ClientYou can grant read-only access to group calendars to Office 365 group members with the CalendarMemberReadOnly option of the Set-Unified Group command.
However, even if you give the group calendar read-only access as described above, it will complete successfully if you edit the corresponding Office 365 group calendar using the Outlook Client.After editing the group calendar from the Outlook Client, when viewing the same group calendar from [Outlook on the Web] or other users, the editing of the group calendar was not reflected.Read-only permissions are applied with the [CalendarMemberReadOnly] option, but I want it to improve the behavior that seems to have been able to edit the group calendar from Outlook Client.読み取り専用権限が付与された Office 365 グループ予定表を Outlook Client から編集した際の動作について[Set-UnifiedGroup] コマンドの [CalendarMemberReadOnly] オプションで Office 365 グループメンバーに対して、グループ予定表の読み取り専用のアクセス権を付与できます。
しかし、上記の方法でグループ予定表に読み取り専用のアクセス権を付与しても、Outlook Client を使用して該当の Office 365 グループ予定表を編集すると正常に完了します。Outlook Client からグループ予定表を編集した後、[Outlook on the Web] や他のユーザーから同じグループ予定表を閲覧すると、グループ予定表の編集は反映されておりませんでした。[CalendarMemberReadOnly] オプションで読み取り専用の権限が適用されておりますが、Outlook Client からグループ予定表が編集できてしまっているように見える動作を改善してほしいです。

Currently, these are the steps...
1. Click on Cog in top right corner of screen.
2. In Settings menu, click on Site settings.
3. Click on Storage Metrics under “Site Collection Administration” heading.
4. Click the top right corner of the screen to see how much storage space you and how much you are using.
It seems clunky and inefficient.
Thank you for your consideration.

header: Sharing Links fail when sent to Hybrid O365 Tenants or those using 3rd Party SPAM Filters
idea_text: When a Shared Link (e.g. document, etc.) is sent from a user in one Office 365 tenant to a user in different Office 365 tenant, the expected behavior is to have the document open without needing to logon.However:When sending a Shared Link to a user in an Office 365 tenant which is either in a hybrid configuration or if the tenant is using a 3rd party SPAM filter (e.g. Barracuda Cloud), use of the link fails with an error of: "User not found in directory".We've looked at the MX records of these users and in each case, the destination tenant does not list Exchange Online as the primary destination for messages (this is expected).I'm guessing the problem may center around the fact that during the process of opening the Sharing Link, the process invokes a DNS lookup against the intended user's email address (e.g. ). Since the resulting DNS lookup doesn't explicitly point back to Exchange Online in these cases, the remainder of the process fails to ultimately reach Azure Active Directory for the user lookup, hence resulting in the error message of "User not found in directory".If this is indeed the case, what can be done to help Office 365 users in this situation?Thanks!

header: Enable shared mailbox in Android phone via web or app
Enable Restore of Group from O365 Admin Center
idea_text:
The steps outlined in this article for restoring an Office 365 group from the Exchange Admin center do not seem to work:
According to the article, when an Office 365 Group is restored from the Exchange Admin center, all of its related content is also restored such as the smtp address, aad security group, shared mailbox, sharepoint online team site, onenote notebook, planner, and Yammer if connected.  When visiting the Exchange Admin Center and hitting the link to restore the group, a pop-up says "You're about to restore a deleted group.  All of the groups conversations, files, notebooks, and events will be available to its members.  Continue?"  When that's clicked, the group changes from "Deleted" to "Active."  However the corresponding SharePoint site with its files never seems to get restored.  I've been testing this with groups in production and in a demo tenant, and the SharePoint site never seems to be restored as expected.  An MS O365 Ambassador advised to run Restore-SPODeletedSite does seem to recover the SharePoint site collection. The MS O365 support folks suggested I place an entry here in OneVoice. I had already posted to techcommunity.  Steps to reproduce
-Create Group from Outlook Client or Online  OR Create Team from Teams Application (for my testing, I tried each way and the outcomes were the same)
-Visit the SharePoint site for the associated Group or Team
-Delete the Site Collection (Gear icon in upper right > Site Information > Delete Site)
-The site collection will become unavailable (HTTP 404 not found), the Group will no longer be available in Outlook, and in the Exchange Admin Center the Group will change from "Active" to "Deleted"
-Go to the Exchange Admin Center, find the deleted group and hit Restore.  This step was first completed with an account that has the global admin role but then I also tested with an account that didn't have global admin but had EXO and SPO admin roles explicitly assigned.
-Wait. 
-Keep checking the site and seeing 404 not found

idea_text:
Dear Mr Shankar Raut,Respectfully submitted through Praful Kamble Sir, Office 365 Team.I quote you verbatim :“ Another issue was with sending emails to more than 10000 recipients in a day.As per the below mentioned article we can only send up to 10000 recipients a day and that is a limitation and its by design.

And that is possible only if @all broadcast method works for groups with even more than 10000 members.
