header: Fix the Group Calendar Webpart for All Day events
idea_text: The display of full day events added in a group calendar is shifted by one less day in the group calendar webpart. Adding the same event from 00:00:00 to 23:59:59 displays it correctly.

comments.text:
This is actually a bit more insidious.  When creating a calendar event, if one selects "all day", the start time and end time are set to "12:00 AM".  Consider this event:Start time: Mon 2/11/2019 12:00 AM
End time: Mon 2/12/2019 12:00 AMThis should be a 24 hour event.  That is literally 24 hours between the start and end times.  Instead, this is stored as a 48 hour event.  The UI is actually setting a "First Date" and "Last Date" of the all day event, not a "Start Time" and "End Time".  Just change the wording and remove the time selectors instead of graying out the and locking the time selectors when the "All day event" checkbox is ticked. The original comment above is the most glaring symptom of this.  In my above example, the calendar event itself, when opened, will show an End time of "2/11/2019 12:00 AM".  If you mouse over the event in your calendar, however, it will show you "2/12/2019 12:00 AM".  This display bug is obviously wrong.  n != n+1That said, if the all day event creation dialog UI, which is the same as the event edit/view UI,  reflected the underlying functionality, there would be no problem.

header: "never grey out the inactive window controls"
idea_text: It is not logical or intuative to allow multiple windows functionality and then restrict the usablilty of that function by "greying out the controls"The user should have the ability to manipulate any window amoungst multiple windows in the order the user decides, leaving all window controls visible at all times.The controls are active at all times if you mouse over and click, so why hide them and make it difficult?I understand the requirement to identify active/inactive windows when multiple windows are open, but the intentional color filter applied here hides the controls - its like taking some spokes out of a wheel - the wheel is just fine as it is, please leave it round.The obvious improvement would be to change the title bar tone as it does, but in a way that does not interfere with the buttons WITHN the title bar, serving the purpose of window state indentification but without hiding the minimise/maximise/exit buttons.

header: Avoid PST Corruption by Splitting Large PST File
idea_text:
Users get the error messages in Outlook due to corrupt PST file and the PST may get corrupt due to virus attack, configuration settings or large size. In most of the cases, it is found that large size of PST is the cause of corruption. To avoid PST corruption we can split the PST file and reduce the size. 
Thus PST size can be reduced by following steps
First, create a new PST file in Outlook
Open Outlook, File, Account Settings and add new Profile
Create a new PST file and save it. Remember the Path of PST
Now the next step is to move data from large PST to new PST
Launch the Import/ Export Wizard in Outlook
Select option ‘Export to a file’ and in next window select Outlook Data File (.PST)
Select folder to move items and in next window click on browse window
Go to the location where PST file is stored 
Click on Finish to export data to new PST.
The size of the original PST will be reduced and the PST will not get corrupt. This is the easiest method to split Outlook PST apart from using PST splitter

header: Conversations about calendar items don't go to members' mailboxes
idea_text: Scenario: A calender item is created directly onto the group calendar via Outlook 2016 and the group is invited. The item correctly shows up on the group members' individual Outlook calendars. HOWEVER, if a member responds to the calendar item (for example, to propose a new time), the e-mail goes only to the group mailbox and does not get forwarded to any of the members, even if the members are all subscribed to the group mailbox. Therefore, none of the members are aware that anyone has proposed a new time and the communication is essentially lost. For more details, Microsoft staff can refer to Office 365 ticket #5426250.

header: Manual Approach to Repair Corrupt Word Files
idea_text:
Most of the user's have come across error messages like 'Word Can't Open This File', some users reported that the file is not available to open while trying to actually opening it. Thus If the MS Word encounters any error it fails to open the Word files. To resolve these error messages here are some of the methods
Open & Repair Method
This is the most simple and easy to use method to repair corrupt MS Word file. If the files recently got damaged or showing error message then it can be easily repaired by this method
•	Launch the MS Word application and go to Files
•	Click on Open and then locate the corrupt MS Word File
•	Select the file and choose the option 'Open and Repair' button
•	The corrupted file will get repaired and you can use it
Change The Word File Extension
This a technique by which contents of file can be moved to new MS word 
•	Go to the Folder where corrupt file is stored and change its extension to RTF or TXT format
•	Now Open these files and move content to new word file
•	Save the Word file to new location
•	The file will be repaired
You can follow these methods to repair the corrupt MS Word File
Try the word repair tool from here

idea_text: Why is group contacts showing as an option when sending an email through the outlook app on a phone or tablet, but the message does not go through to the group. By contrast, the Outlook app on the laptop or the through the web based Outlook app in Office365 works for selecting the group contact list for sending a mass email.

header: Improve sharing files and folders for groups via OneDrive
idea_text:
When you provide access to a folder or file for a group of users, this file or folder is not displayed in the One Drive tab "I have been granted access." This creates problems for users, they do not understand that you must first follow the link in the email in Outlook and only then can they access the shared files or folders.
  This behavior greatly reduces the efficiency of using Office 365 in a large organization, since the system of sharing files and folders is no longer understandable to users. End users may lose access to the files and folders of their groups if they delete an email with a link from Outlook.
  I propose to solve this problem in one of the updates Office 365.

header: Best Way to Convert OST to PST
idea_text:
OST files can be converted to PST format by archive option too. Outlook inbuilt features allow moving OST data to PST format by Archive Option. 
Open the Outlook application, click on File and move to Cleanup Options
Select Archive from CleanUp option and a new window will open
Now, click on 'Archive This folder and subfolders'
Select the data and folders and under archive items older than option select date
Click on the browse button and name a new pst to save this data
Click on OK to begin OST to PST conversion.

header: Allow Indexing to work on O365 Groups connected SharePoint sites/lists/libs where inheritence is broken
idea_text:
I was just in a session at Ignite where we were informed content inside of an area of an O365 Group connected SharePoint site that where inheritance is broken will not be indexed, and thus not searchable. If the group still has access, it will only be unsearchable for users given permissions outside of the Group.  
This will greatly limit our ability to connect existing sites to O365 Groups.  I'm also concerned about the impact on content in Group sites that is then shared with others, effectively breaking inheritance.

header: The Sweep function in Outlook Web Access does not function properly.

header: Groups that have send a copy to inbox checked:  The sender should also receive a copy (currently they do not), please fix.
idea_text: In most ways O365 groups are superior to distribution lists.  Which O365 groups have a distribution list function, the sender does NOT receive a copy in their inbox (in addition to the group box).  Only the other members do.  I am surprised QA did not catch this, or if it was intentional, I can not fathom why someone would want that.  Yes they could check their own sent items, but for people who use their inbox's extensively, this is a very annoying issue with O365 groups.

header: Naming Policy - Bypass Option
idea_text: We currently have a naming policy for O365 Groups that adds a prefix string to a group when created.  However, there are instances where a specific name will need to be used, and it would be helpful to have a "bypass naming policy" option in ECP, so that when owners makes changes to the group via the web interface, that the naming policy doesn't get re-applied.

header: Allow disabling of automatic O365 Group creation for Team Sites
idea_text: I hear that groups will be auto-created along with new team sites (and eventually implemented for old sites) in the near future. It is critical that we be able to turn this off, preferably at various levels (site, site collection, tenant would be nice). For example, we have a couple of sandbox site collections where we create test sites. I do not suddenly want sites created here to have corresponding groups that display in our global address book in Outlook. Groups are far too visible and uncontrolled, I'm worried that this update will push us to turn them off entirely.

header: Public groups only for employee-accounts
idea_text:
We really like the open culture of public groups so that everyone in the organisation can find and work on documents even if they are not part of the group. 
But we'd like to restrict the access to for user accounts that we need for freelancer and partner. It would be nice to be able to set specific filters or groups (based on member-off or other attributes) for "Everyone except external users".

header: Office 365 Stream Captions
idea_text: We need to be able to have a video automatically captioned, but then be able to download and edit that caption file and re-upload it with the video. Then, if needed, we need to be able to download the captioned video, not just the original video. This would allow us to upload that captioned video to our Production environment.

comments.text: We have a similar need. The auto-transcribe is pretty good, but we would like to be able to correct the mistakes, and as mentioned above, download the video with the correct captions if we need to use it for other purposes.

header: Please catch your UI up to standards set 15 years ago.
idea_text: Your current "group" interface is informational, at best.  Where is the UX guy going, now make it usable.I have a company with 100+ groups.  I hire a new user.  This user needs to be added to 25 of these groups day 1.HOW IS IT THAT YOU THINK THE BEST WAY TO DO THIS IS TO MANUALLY OPEN ALL 25 GROUPS AND ADD THE NEW USER TO EACH!!!!!???!?!?!?!Under "Member of" in the users account properties, there should be an "add user to groups" button, with an interface that allows me to checks the groups I want the user added to.I have had this in some form with EVERY OTHER PROVIDER OF EMAIL I have ever worked with.  Seriously, I had this nearly 20 years ago.  Catch up...

header: Indent tasks in filtered view in Task list
idea_text: It would be awesome if we could indent tasks in filtered view in Task list! As of now it is not possible to indent tasks if there is a filter. It is however, possible to edit in quick edit view. I many times, in Projects, use the task list as a Project milestone and activity list, instead of eg. MS Project Online, as it works well for this purpose (and by adding a few columns, and deleting/hiding some). When having many rows of activites it is very irritating that it is not possible to indent activities, or move them up and down, in filtered views. It would be much easier to "sell" the idea of using SharePoint as Project management tool if this was possible! Thanking you in advance! :-)

header: Indirect reports in a Dynamic 365 Group

This would need to include all the direct reports, and the staff that report to them. This would make it easier to create groups and Teams for departments without the need of direct action, and allow us to use them for a variety of purposes.  Right now the only way to get to this point it to create an extremely messy structure or design it outside of the dynamic group and use a script to populate.  Most organizations change structure from time to time, and change staff on a regular basis.

header: Disallow creating groups without members
idea_text:
At the moment it is possible to create groups / distribution lists without members. This has terrible effects:
Someone may send an email to the group / list and the system will accept the mail since the email dress is known. BUT: since there is no member, the mail will not be distributed to anyone.So the sender will not get notified that his mail could not be delivered while the organization does not notify that there was an email.Kind of a black hole where the emails go in...so you should prevent users from creating groups / lists with just an owner = without members or at least notify him about the consequences. Or, i any member is set, you should deliver the mails send to the list / group to the owner. That would solve this problem as well.

header: It is bothering that the default (forced) group is office 365 not what i select in the menu!
idea_text: Don't force the group type and don't force/push the upgrade as it doesn't replace distribution group - no one receive a standard email, the email is only visible in the group conversation.

header: Limit Event Creation to Admin or Group Moderator
idea_text: It seems too easy to mistakenly add an event to the Group calendar when trying to add one to the regular calendar. If only certain members were authorized, such wouldn't be a problem. The discussion component is great however.

header: Add activity overview to shared outlook calendar
idea_text:
To see what is going on for the next week within a larger team is confusing when all shared calendars are displayed at the same time. Using a group calendar is not an option if the people are not all in the same groups. And also a group calendar only makes sense if invitations should go to all members any time. 
Please add a list view or kind of gantt view to outlook that can handle shared calendars. This should show the meetings for e.g. a week regardless of how many people are invited.

header: RSS Viewer in Modern Sites
idea_text: Please add an app to the modern, group sites that enables an RSS Viewer and/or Reader.  I would like to have content roll up like the classic site. Thanks

header: GroupList on OneDrive for Business site page
idea_text: We have a mixture of users who has Office365 Enterprise E3 licence set. The one group has full set of sub licences assigned. Another group has simile but no Exchange licence as mailbox is in process of migration from on premises to cloud. ( It's a long story but few thing prevent use to migrate them all to cloud just yet)  We have few Office 365 Group created for small project team and work group, committees and so on.  It was works quite well jut the people without exchange can not create group  but able to invited in. Belonged group was listed and showed up on left side navigation area for easy file share access.  Short while ago we have receiving some report that those people without exchange licence has lost those link on side. They can access to group OneDrive page if they know the URL. ( ie book marked)  or through Planner. People with exchange licence still seeing and able to use those group link on side on own OneDrive page. Apart from migrating mailbox for those affected users and giving licence assigned,  is there any way to bring those convenient list of groups belong to on each ones' OneDrive page?PS. our non exchange user was seeing their group on OneDrive for Business page but it was suddenly not there.  Hence we get quite bit of complaints.

header: Allow TurboScan to upload PDF files to One Drive
idea_text: Allow TurboScan to upload PDF files to One Drive

header: Create a new group requires moderation
idea_text:
To create a new Office365 group should require moderation by a user. Office365 groups can be called absolutely anything, and this is open to abuse, especially with students. They can call their group any name, for example the name of a senior staff member. Then emails that accidentally get sent to that account get sent to the group instead of the staff member.
To allow creation of an Office365 group, a moderator could be assigned to check the name is acceptable before the group is created.

header: Excel sheet grouping and folding
idea_text: It would be great if there was a way of grouping sheets together, and then hiding and expanding each group with a simple click. For example, if I have raw data in sheet1, and different types of analysis of that data in sheets sheet1.1,sheet1.2,sheet1.3, I'd like to be able to click a button or a keyboard shortcut that would cause Sheets sheet1.1-sheet1.3 to minimize close to sheet 1, and remain that way until the user wishes to expand them again.

comments.text: Ideally, IMO, there would be sheet groups or folders that the user could click on and would expand vertically. I frequently work with large excel models that have significantly more sheets than can be displayed at once, many of them related in groups - being able to consolidate into sheet folders would be a very convenient way of organizing complicated workbooks.

header: Add Asset Libraries to Apps Available in Groups.
idea_text: Currently only document libraries and picture libraries are available to use in Office 365 Groups. We have created a group for a Communications Team and they require a library to store media files (images and videos). Please include Asset Libraries as an available App in Office 365 Groups.

header: Planner glitchy, not synching with Outlook task list.
idea_text: Planner keeps saying it cannot accept tasks. Glitchy. Also needs to add tasks entered in planner to Outlook task list. Without this, but is of no use.

header: Signature on aliases level
idea_text: Aliases (shared folders, also groups - if possible) should have its own signature in presence of at least one "on behalf of" permission. The user signature should be replaced by this.

header: We would like to be able to create a rule to prefix all personal groups with a prefix so they will show differently in the GAL
idea_text: We are having issues with several users creating personal groups which are showing on the GAL.  We would like to be able to determine which ones are created by users easily instead of the Admin Team.

header: Better Snooze Timing on Calendar Reminders - 1 minute before start
idea_text: Hello,I feel like the 0 minutes before start Snooze option for Calendar reminders should be changed to 1 minute before start. The only use-case for 0 minutes is to remind you that you are already late, 1 minute is very useful if you work in an office where the meeting is very close by, or need to jump on a Skype meeting. If you go to a meeting 5 minutes early, your meeting room might be taken, you are sitting in an empty room, you are forced to make small talk, or you are sitting in awkward silence in a room with other people when you really want to be working for those 4 minutes leading up to the meeting.

header: Please sync teams chats with my outlook conversation
idea_text: Please create persitant chat within outlook as as Skype For buisness does...One stop shopping for messaging

header: Bug that prevents adding permissions to a user with an apostrophe in their name
idea_text: Please fix!

comments.text: This is impacting us as well.  Tried substituting with an underscore '_' which didn't work.  Another article I found indicated that the apostrophe may be replaced with the '_' character....

header: Office365 Groups - Owners Modify after disable Create Office 365 DGs
idea_text:
Please allow users who own a group to modify their own group without allowing users to create groups.Example:
I unchecked MyDistributionGroups so users can't create DGs but that's the same that allows groups to be modified by the owner.There is another MyDistributionGroupMembership option that I would like to see the user allowed to modify the group that they own.  Currently this one doesn't have that option.I would like to have my users the options to keep there groups as up to date as possible without them creating new groups.Thank you

header: Make Group Files in Sharepoint workable in Excel Online as offered.
idea_text:
Excel online could not handle Excel Files with 2 mb filesize. 
Although Microsoft recommend to user Excel files with maximum of 10 mb. 
To open this files takes a long time. To add data takes 20 sec and longer per entry. 
MS Support replies that it is caused by network traffic. 
I would be grateful to make Excel online files workable.

header: The ability to revoke an invitation that was send from a group site in SharePoint
idea_text: In a regular SharePoint site there is a way to withdraw an invitation by going to site settings>Access requests and invitations. This is not available for group sites. Would like to have the ability to cancel the invite before the user accepts the invite.

header: Provide a GUI-based way to hide Office 365 Groups from address lists
idea_text: A proliferation of Office 365 Groups clutters up the Offline Address List in Outlook and potentially other places. There should be a quick, easy, GUI-based way to hide certain Groups, and also all Groups at once, from address lists, avoiding the need to use PowerShell. This is because not everyone managing an Office 365 tenant is an IT staffer - some of us are entrepreneurs and we don't really have time to spend on IT stuff.

header: Show internal and External users within a distribution list
idea_text: When internal users are added to a distribution list, we are able to see the names added within that distribution list tab when we search for the distribution list.  We also see them when typing the distribution list within the email, but..If you add external contacts to the distribution list... they are shown when we search the distribution list but not when we type in the email address.It would be useful to have an option where all contacts (internal and external) can be seen as at the moment users doubt whether  the list is actually working properly.

header: Office 365 Groups Calendar
idea_text: Office 365 Groups has its own calendar, which is not working properly. Also can't provide permission to non-members (Such As assistant or PA) to manage the calendar only on-behalf of CEO or others.  If this doesn't work, can we have option to turn of the Calendar or any ideas?

header: Windows 7 favourites
idea_text: Its great that you can change a group file area in the browser to explorer view and then add this to file explorer favourites, but when revisiting this later in file explorer it sometimes comes up with an error so we can't give this to users as its not consistent. Please fix this.

header: Guest/External Users for iOS
idea_text: There currently is no way for external users to use o365 Groups for the iOS app.  I suspect the same goes for Android/Windows Phone?

header: Do not get rid of SharePoint mailboxes
idea_text: My organization depends heavily on SharePoint sites and their SharePoint mailboxes. The fact that we only have 30 days to prepare for Groups, and the discontinuation of SP Mailboxes is VERY discouraging. Also, there is no plan for migration until possibly September? this is unacceptable, in my opinion. At least offer us an alternative, such as a migration tool or conversion tool. Half my data will be in SP mailboxes, half in Groups. Not a good plan from MS, in my opinion. I'm sure other customers feel the same.

header: Enable multiple email addresses to be added to a 365 group
add ability to subscribe to this group by email from Outlook for Mac
idea_text: Office 365 Groups have been added to Outlook 2016 for Mac.  The problem is that messages sent to groups only show in the group folder, not in the Outlook Inbox, which makes it easy to miss messages.  In order to do that, one needs to click on "subscribe to this group by email" on the group webpage.  It would be much easier if we could right-click on the group name in Outlook and select "subscribe to this group by email" (or unsubscribe too).

header: We need to be able to setup a separate retention policy for Conversations in Groups.
idea_text: Currently, applying a retention policy in groups, it is applied to everything in the group.  I would like to setup different policies within groups. So for example Conversations for 2 months, but Documents for 2 Years.

header: Make replication of Exchange distribution lists to Skype near real-time.
idea_text: Today when we modify the members of a cloud DL in Exchange online, it takes 24 hours or longer for the changes to show up in Skype online, both controlled by Microsoft.  This is crazy!  I can replicate changes from our on-prem active directory to O365 faster, but we want to designate owners of DLs so they can modify the groups without involving IT.

header: Users added by approving an access request should be members
idea_text:
When a user tries to access a SharePoint site connected to a group, an access request is sent to the group owners. If that access is approved, the user is granted permissions to the site but is not added to the group.  There should be an option to select what should be done:
- Grant access to site or
- Add user to the group.

header: Allow ability to connect to existing Office 365 Group from all other group objects
idea_text:
Allow ability to connect to existing Office 365 Group from all other group objects like Sharepoint, MS Teams, MS Planner, Power BI WorkSpace, One Note, Stream etc.Example:
While creating  any of the above objects/component, provide option to connect to existing Office 365 group.

comments.text:
Currently this is only supported for MS Teams.
Supporting this for other components would help in reducing the no. of groups created and thus keeping the house clean

header: Share a file with a named guest (i.e. not anonymous) who is not a member of the group
idea_text: I welcome the ability to invited guests to O365 groups but we still lack the functionality to share individual documents with guest users who are not part of the group. I have multiple use cases where a specific guest needs to be given access to an individual file where it is not appropriate to give them access to all files in the library or to Group conversations, etc.

comments.text: 100% agree. The user experience in Terms of inviting non Microsoft guests is so poor. We probably return to simple Drop-Box because our clients already complain about the disfunctionality on share Point.

header: Stop links to documents from downloading
idea_text: Recently links to editable documents in a Group library have started downloading copies of that document to my computer rather than opening up in-browser for viewing or editing. This defeats the purpose of a collaborative system.Please stop these links from downloading automatically.

header: Upgrade Dynamic Distribution Groups
idea_text: Please allow admins to upgrade Dynamic Distribution Groups to the new O365 group capabilities in the same way admins can upgrade regular Distributional Groups.

header: Make the Mac version of Outlook have the same features as Windows version
idea_text: Make the Mac version of the Outlook client have the same features as the Windows client version

comments.text: Kindly make this feature available.

header: Allow control of maximum message size users can send to if total recipients > x.
idea_text: We want to allow some users to send mesages to the entire organisation but we also want to limit the size of the messages that can be sent to a large audience. The current parameters used in O365 cannot be changed and are set too high. What is needed are 2 parameters, 'Maximum Recipients' and 'Maximum Recipients Size' so if a message is sent to an audiuence that is greater that the 'Maximum Recipients' value then the message can only be upto the 'Maximum Recipients Size'. The total recipients must be based on individual users so if groups have been used then the sum of all group members needs to be used. This will help reduce the amount of wasted space and bandwidth consumed as the data could shared using alternative methods

comments.text: Microsoft should develop this feature as soon as possible

header: Supprimer ou pouvoir modifier le quota sur le nombre de groupe de distribution
idea_text: Le nombre de groupe de dsitribution est limité « by design » (selon le support technique) et est assez bas (environ 50 groupes). Il serait donc très utile de pouvoir soit supprimer ce quota, soit de pouvoir le modifier, depuis l'interface d'administration d'Exchange Online d'Officce 365 ou depuis un Powershell.

Now all content is sort by the time it was added to the chanel.
I wolud be nice to have an option to sort it by name, date, size etc

comments.text: Ability to organize videos (perhaps folders) would also be helpful in the individual Video channel.

header: Enable export of Outlook Groups Conversations to Excel spreadsheet
idea_text: Enable users to export Outlook Groups conversations to Excel spreadsheet for additional analysis of conversation content.

header: Allow Users to Select from a List of Possible Prefixes/Suffixes
idea_text: The group naming policy should have the ability to allow users to select from a pre-defined list of prefixes/suffixes as opposed to only using an attribute or single string of text.

header: Emailings to Office 365 Group Owners and Members
idea_text: Please could we enhance the standard mailings that go out for O365 Groups:Group creation: inform owners and members who has created a new group by their nameGroup deletion: inform owners that a group has been deleted and who by. header: Planner - My Tasks needs an ability to add tasks for the owner or sync with other task product
idea_text: My tasks is great at pulling tasks from every team that has a planner attached. I got away with creating this before the IT team learned how to lock it down ;-)  A team of one is not logical however (although it could replace home drives if anyone thought it through ;-)  )

comments.text: My question is, why in Teams in view My Tasks, there is no posiblity to add own tasks to do?

header: skype for business
idea_text: Bring the chat room function of Skype for business back please

comments.text: We share the Lync links with Clients for meeting but the Clients have to install some kind of applet for connecting (which is not allowed in some companies). FOr Skype for business, we just need a link which we can share with customers that connects (like gotomeeting, join me etc.) Else, it is not useful as of now.

+1
Colleagues using skype without Chat rooms is a very unusefull.
We are forced to think about using solutions from other manufacturers that combine these functions
Otherwise, if you use a separate application for each individual communication process, there are too many of them!

Hello Office 365 Support,I found that the chat room is not available in chat for business and we are using the full suite of office 365 for our company. Please help to integrate the function back as it is the basic function of skype for collaboration and it is even available with skype personal.thanks

It is unusable:
- No partner import function
- Very complicated
Make it eassier to add external non-business Skype contacts. Now they need to link to an Outlook account. I cannot request all my Skype contacts to do this...
search Persistent Chat.  it has to be enabled server-side but it's very handy - my group uses it daily.

header: Allow users to modify installation to disable individual apps in Office 365
idea_text: I'm running 64 bit office 365. I want to disable Microsoft Access 64 bit. However, Office 365 doesn't allow me to disable individual components and therefore I can't disable MS Access on its own. This used to be a feature in MS Office but is no longer the case. Help!

header: Enable hashtags in Outlook Groups conversations
idea_text: Provide ability for users to tag Outlook Groups conversation posts by hastags. Please also allow searching of conversation posts by hashtag filters.

header: Microsoft Teams: Ability to set a post as a Question (similar to Important!)
idea_text: When starting a new conversation or replying it is possible to set the post as Important, the word Important appearing in red bold text. Additional options can be made available e.g. Question (potentially highlighting the post), Idea (appearing with a light bulb) etc. Enabling team members, at a glance, to see what posts they need to engage with, and others that can be left for later. We have many use cases where visitors can post questions to a team, requiring an answer, and visually separating these would make the process more efficient.

header: Add One Drive Groups onto new One Drive dashboard page
idea_text: Should not have to keep going to Classic One Drive to access Groups.

header: Remove multiple groups from single user
idea_text: When creating a new user or an existing user under Exchange Properties and member of, I would like to be able to add and remove groups for that single user. If it is not in that area just under edit user there should be an option somewhere, where I can add and remove groups under the selected user.

comments.text:
Could you also add this feature for shared mailboxes 
Remove User from multiple shared mailboxes

header: Prevent Unsubscribe by User
idea_text: Would love the feature to have an Global Admin prevent a user from unsubscribing to an Office 365 group.  This would be nice for groups that require all people in the company.If users had the ability to unsubscribe from critical groups (usually by accident especially when the link is in all the emails), then it would defeat the purpose of the group.Thanks!

header: Adding feature like - Mark Response as Answer to Groups.
idea_text:
Moving to Groups is providing great advantages and I was wondering if there are possibilities to add certain more features or recommendations from end users like to make Groups more impactful.  Problem Statement:Inability to track mails which are answers and how many hours it saved. While the features like “Like” and “Number of Responses” provide details around responses liked by community members and most talked topic over communities group. We have below gaps currently: 	
Unsure which specific answer has helped resolving query
	Unable to track mails/queries which are unanswered
	How many hours were saved by specific response Suggested Solution:What we need:	
“Mark as Answer” – Response helped resolving query. 
	"Hours Saved" - This feature might be tricky to get added, however we need to understand feasibility as it would be of great impact. This is low priority requirement :).
	Reporting - 
			
Tracking whose responses were "Marked as Answers".
		Percent of conversion from Response to Answers
		Most liked responses
		Most responses by individuals(excluding the name of members who are posting queries)
		List of Unanswered mails for 24 hours
	
	What we have already:	
“Like” – We have it already (members can like questions/response/information)
	“Count of responses” – Tells us most talked topic in Groups.  Advantages: 	
Effective Reporting & Quantification of Communities Impact
	We can be focused on picking up mail queries which are unanswered and reach to focused audiences/PG/SMEs to get it answers.

header: Office365 groups permissions to modify membership
idea_text:
Currently, you have to be the owner the Office 365 group to add or remove members. The problem is that you also become a member of the group and will receive all the groups emails. Another problem is that the owner can also remove another owner.
Please give us a feature where we can give a user permission to Add/Remove members in Office365 group without becoming the owner or a member of that group.

header: Revise the Office 365 Groups purpose and separate email from the group
idea_text: Many company don't want to clutter their Office 365 Group by only allow admin to create the group. It means that the whole purpose of Office 365 Groups shoule be revised.Trying to "simplify" things by connecting Office 365 Group automatically actually make things more complicated than it should be. And also the security issue when Office 365 Group also can be used to receive emails. Any user can use it to create virtual email to register external services, abuse the system. At least, you should separate email from Office 365 Group, this allows user to create any group they like, without affecting to the company security. Only IT can link a group with an email address.Apps like Planner also make thing worst. Yammer connected group cannot be used in Teams and Mail. A lot of confusing things. When you call it an Office 365 Group, you must have a central place to create a Group, then every service use it by linking or sync (or creating a page which allow group creator to enable/disable services for the group). Do not allow apps to create group. Yammer should allow user to create Yammer group and connect them to Office 365 if they want, not force. Yammer is a social network and it should have it own groups.

comments.text: Absolutely agree.  O365 Groups have completely cluttered our Global Address List.

This is Nanda from Useready Technology, I am an global administrator for Office 365 account for my company. We have a recurrence town hall meeting every month with the organisation, we would like to have new joiners added in the Town hall meeting list(This is Recurrence meeting). Hence we use the Distribution List based on location and we add in the new member to the DL, this DL is been used for town hall meeting invite.Folks  who are recently added to the location base Distribution List are not able to see the future recurrence meeting invite in their calendar.Expectation: We would need to ensure that recurring calendar events sent to a large mail Distribution List (including newly added users),  everyone should be able to view the future recurrence invite in their calendar.Looking forward to hearing from you.Thank you in advance.Thanks & Regards,
Nandakumar.

comments.text: I too am experiencing the same issue - our organization all staff distribution list is updated often, and it would be really helpful if existing reoccurring calendar events could pull from the current list.

header: disable
idea_text: Office 365 Groups + team sites integration, how to disable? In enterprise environment, we have lots of governance around creation of team sites and groups. Microsoft should always consider that when introducing new feature, enterprise customers should have option to decide if they wanted to deploy the new feature or not.

comments.text: O365 Video previously, O365 Groups, now O365 Teams...the default option for any new app should be *opt-in*,  not opt-out.

header: Upload photo to Group OneDrive
idea_text: You need the ability to upload photos from the mobile application directly to the Group OneDrive.

header: External Contacts to User Group Distribution More Effectively (Send on Behalf Of)
idea_text: As companies are "outsourcing" their services and external emails can be added to the contact section and added to the group distribution list, unfortunately at the present time, an external email user cannot "Send on Behalf Of" or "Send As" under group delegation. Only those with same domain name can be added to the list. We want feature for external emails that are added to the distribution group to be able to "Send on Behalf Of" or "Send As".

header: After block office group creation in tenant, we are looking for the best way to warn our users of the new procedure
idea_text: For good change management, when users are trying to create a new group, we want to let our users know what they need to do to create a new 365 group through office applications when the administrator blocks the native function. We are looking for the possibility of modifying the system warning message, generate an email to the user or capturing an event via a Graph API ...

comments.text:
To make a good change management, I'm looking to change the system message "Your organization's global admin has turned off the ability to create new Plans ans Office 365 Groups."
or get an activity alerts from Graph. It is seem not possible to do that.

With FORMs, we created a new self-service process to create office groups that include many validations.
How can I redirect my users to the new procedure that I created?
I have to inform users when they try to create groups by mails, with a pop-up message or any other way...

header: Add Planner view to the Groups mobile App.
idea_text: Please add Planner to the Groups mobile app. We are able to see group conversations, group calendars, group files and link to group notebooks but not group planner tasks.

header: Group Document Alerts
idea_text: Thank you for adding Alert in groups document, i think its nice way to monitor activity. My suggestion is here to add some more Alert option especially if someone try to download any folder or file.Also,add some more security future to protect folder and files from Group document.

header: option to enable/disable Mail Notifications to Users
idea_text: When we add a new member to work space in Power BI an automated notification mail gets triggered to the recipient. There could have been an option to disable this mail notification

header: Office 365 Groups: Allow CONTROL OF VISIBILITY in Outlook for group inbox/calendar
idea_text:
Current state: When you belong to a group, the group inbox appears automatically in Outlook, and the calendar does NOT appear unless you "Add to Favorites".I would like to have the ability, as a user or as an admin (configuration) to manage visibility of inbox or calendar.Scenario 1: As the CEO of my small organization, I belong to almost every group.  I simply don't need to have that many inboxes visible in Outlook.  We use groups for "shared inboxes" (e.g. IT support, info@, etc.) and I don't need all of those cluttering up my Outlook 2016 UI.  In this case, I'd like the ability as a user to hide groups in the navigation node.Scenario 2:
Sometimes, a group needs ONLY a conversation (inbox) or ONLY a calendar.  Currently, for example, we use a group for our "" inbox--the calendar will NEVER be used. We use a group for our company calendar--the inbox will NEVER be used. I'd like to hide those elements as an administrator, so that users' Outlook UIs are not cluttered up and they're not tempted to drop something or do something in the wrong place.

comments.text:
Oops I forgot SCENARIO 3:
Calendar visibility should be made much easier for users - the fact you have to "add to favorites" FROM YOUR INBOX in order to see the calendar IN YOUR CALENDAR is silly :-)

header: Add an Out Of Office or AutoReply for Office 365 Groups
idea_text: Sender (internal or external) will receive a mail when they write to the O365 groups. By this way, we could use Groups more like a shared mailbox, and send communication in case of holidays, events, or just to inform the sender we well receive his mail.This feature is really missing for me.

header: Allow SharePoint workflow tasks to be assigned to an Active directory Security group
idea_text: We would like the ability to assign a task from a workflow to a AD security group.  Right now we can only use SharePoint groups and that means we have to recreate the security group in SharePoint.

header: Allow importing of .pst calendar data for guys like us who are migrating to O365 and need a place to upload their existing calendar data.
idea_text: O365 groups are nice and show up "automagically" for OWA users UNLIKE shared mailbox folders that have to be added manually.  They are also easier for regular users to administer.  We just need a way to import .pst data to them.

comments.text: This is a very fundamental part of the Calendar/Contacts/Mail portability. Why on earth was this feature not included I shout to all the gods in the universe! WHY? on earth was this not released as fully supporting tool just like the existing ones? We are all used to backing up calendars. Renaming calendars and recreating calendars in a company it's a very basic function without this functionality it becomes very troublesome and makes us look like we have proposed a Half-a-TeaSpoon Solution! Guys please! hurry to make this a full blown solution!!!!!!

header: version history
idea_text: Provide the option to view Version history for a file in a group. This is available in 'Classic OneDrive' view for a group. It is helpful to have it readily available.

comments.text: please add an automatic restore option with version history to the folder level not just individual file level.  would like to be able to restore multiple files and folders at one time.

This is very confusing at the moment, as the search results from the office help pages give instructions for the OneDrive collection, and these features cannot be accessed without swtich back to classic OneDrive. The Classic OneDrive interface then has a link for returning to share-point classic which users accidentally click thinking this will return them to the modern onedrive. This is very confusing and could be addressed quickly by adding a restore link to the version history list which appears in the latest OneDrive view.

header: Please allow the ability to type spaces when adding someone to a group in Office Admin center preview
idea_text: this ability was removed recently, you can still create groups with spaces in them but cannot search for them.

comments.text: This is a much need feature, it is no fun searching through group list to find what your looking for why there is a couple hundred entries. Tell Bill to let it ride

I agree - this functionality worked up until very recently.  It is odd that it suddenly stopped.  I can still *create* groups with spaces in them and I can search for groups in other locations using the 'space' character, just not when editing group memberships from the Azure User section.  I think this got removed by accident?

header: Control Office 365 Group Deletion
idea_text:
there is no way to prevent user from deleting O365 group and there is no alert or notification if the O365 group deleted.
 so we need featured to prevent user from delete O365 group and alert

comments.text: This is much needed functionality from Governance perspective.

header: Make Office 365 group creation a setting in services & addins and not require a license
idea_text:
Delegation of group creation should be a setting under 
Admin Portal -> Settings -> Services & Addins -> Office 365 GroupsAs it stands now, it requires additional licensing to prevent users from creating groups which is ridiculous. It also requires powershell knowledge which not everyone has.

header: View Planner Taks in Timeline
idea_text: It will be a very good Idea to see the tasks in a TimeLine.

comments.text: This has been requested in multiple requests.  When is it scheduled for deployment?

header: In Microsoft Planner - recresh of content extracted from attachments
idea_text:
When uploading an attachment (eg excel file) - an image of the content is generated and displayed on the task. When this attachment is updated/refreshed, the image should be regenerated to reflect new content.
This will enhance the planner for displaying team KPIs

comments.text: Great potential for simple offline dashboards

This functionality is important if planner shall be an option to be used as a score board for teams. To much hassle deleting and importing again will make users search for better options. When updating shared files online - graphics imported from the file should update in accordance with the last saved changes.

header: Bulk changing of domain of existing Office 365 groups
idea_text: In short we are changing domain, we currently have over 80 groups. There is no way of changing the domain of all the groups. Only method is currently via power shell one-by-one, as 365 support can't assist with scripts.

header: Users cannot delete or edit other users contributions (For Education)
idea_text: To use Office 365 for teaching we need additional control and features for teachers.We would like to see a feature for staff to provide non editable feedback to students on their resources.For example a student could add a resource to a group OneDrive for the teacher to mark. The teacher could then add some feedback and notations to the document.We would like to make this content non editable by the non Admin user.

comments.text: Yes! Plus the ability to add to a shared document, but not edit or delete. For example, we've talked to teachers about creating a shared Excel document with their student list so each student could drop in a Sway link for viewing, but we want them to NOT be able to delete or edit what anyone else added.

header: Allow guest/external users to see calendars via a Sharepoint web part
idea_text: It makes sense (somewhat) that guest users don't have access to the full calendar in a group, much as in the same way they don't have mailbox access. I would have thought that by adding a Calendar web part, which is a read-only view of a group calendar, guests could at least see events posted to the main calendar. Yet when attempting this, guest users are unable to see calendar events, instead getting the message "The group calendar is only available to its members". Is this the intended behaviour?

comments.text: Not being able to share a calendar with external consultants is very limiting.  The whole point of Teams is to collaborate and in today's world, collaboration crosses organizational boundaries more than ever before.  I really hope this gets fixed.

This is a big disappointment.  We really need calendar access to collaborate with Teams that have external members.  I agree with @George Preston below.  Major fail on this.  I am able to share a Planner Schedule/Calendar view externally as read only but not the Team calendar.  PLEASE FIX THIS

Hello. It used to work as George has described. Just double checked this and in fact the bahavior depends on whether the guest account is in External Azure AD (invited email is O365 user) or not. The web part works for external O365 accounts and not for other (LiveId accounts).
(it's a pity that between Sharepoint, Groups and Teams, I have no way of collaborating on a calendar with a supplier, and instead have to use Dropbox for business)

header: Allow group owners to better manage conversation/calendar subscription for existing group members
idea_text: If "automatically subscribe new members" is not checked when a group is created and later turned on, the existing members are not automatically subscribed to the group though new members are. It would be very helpful if group owners or Admins could manage subscriptions to the group for existing members as well, or even see who is subscribed and who is not.

header: Gruppenkalender Termin nicht automatsich in Privtem Kalender übertragen
idea_text:
Termine die im Gruppenkalender eingetragen werden sollten nicht automatisch auch im Privaten Kalender eingetragen werden. Es sollte die Option Termin im eingene Kalender übertragen geben.
Danke für eue tolle Arbeit

header: Require O365 Groups to have more than one owner at creation time
idea_text: To avoid the condition where an O365 Group becomes "orphaned" when the Owner leaves the company, apps that create O365 Groups should require that the creator add at least a second owner to the Group. This will prevent expiration/renewal notices from being sent to an Admin account, and increase the odds that there will be an Owner to respond and renew the group.

header: Custom subscription option
idea_text: It would be nice when subscribing to a group you could subscribe to just the mail or just Calendar or both.  That way you don't have to have your personal calendar cluttered with events from the group, or better yet when subscribing it should create another calendar so you can decide to overlay it or copy events to your personal calendar.

comments.text: You should theoretically be able to subscribe to each resource in the group. Email/Conversations, Calendar and/or Files. This would allow flexibility to use a shared calendar resource for things like schedules without creating a meeting request for each member who may only want to get notified of new conversations/emails. Etc...

header: Add functionality into a conversation to 'acknowledge' that the item has been read and understood
idea_text: When using groups it would be great to include functionality similar to a 'read receipt' to ensure that everyone has read the conversation and furthermore, being able to provide visibility of this to either the person who started the conversation and/or the group owner. This way you can ensure your message has reached your audience, or alternatively know where to close any gaps.

header: Publish documentation on admin roles of the Unified Group
idea_text:
We're trying to change the default smtp address of a Unified Group.  We would expect our Exchange admins to be able to manage this.  When following this documentation, , we discover that the admin must be in the following role groups:Organization Management
Recipient Management
Id Admin
Service_accountAfter this failed, we took the case to Office 365 support.  There they instructed us that this must be done by someone with Global Administrator role.  The only documentation for this reality is located here:  This article makes the following general statement.  "While users can create an Office 365 group from Outlook or other apps, as the global admin, you may need to create or delete groups, add or remove members, and customize how they work."So far this is the only documentation that can be provided that backs up the claim that only Global Administrators can change the primary SMTP address.When asking support to feed this feedback to the product team, they directed me to UserVoice.Thanks,

reaction.note: Good feedback, thank you.

header: Keep credentials alive when mapping drives in Team site
idea_text: When trying to map the Teamsite with Explorer, when user change O365 Exchange password for a different one or turn off and on again the Computer, lose credentials and users need to login again on Teamsite (SharePoint) with IE 11 (no other browser). Let me explain: We are replacing our File Server with Office 365, but don't want to lose the familiarity and ease of working with your files through mapped drives and file shares. So we wish a solution something like Zee Drive to find out how it makes Office 365 work as our new file server.

header: Allow the group delegate(s) to send meeting requests from the calendar without inviting themselves
idea_text: If, as the delegate of a shared or resource mailbox, I send a meeting request from the calendar of that mailbox, the meeting request comes from the mailbox and - more importantly - I am not invited to the meeting (unless I choose to invite myself).For O365 groups, this does not work quite the same way in that if I create a meeting from that group's calendar I can send the request from the group mailbox (only via OWA, though - see below) but I am always added as a meeting attendee.Additionally, if I send the meeting request from the calendar in Outlook desktop (Windows 10, v1708 build 8431.2270 Click-to-Run) the meeting request always comes from me and not from the O365 group mailbox.

header: folder permissions
idea_text: we need to be able to edit folder + sub-folder permissions within an office 365 group document library but it is currently not possible and greyed out even if parent inherithence is turned off. please fix this.

header: Allow 'Group Owners' to enable/disable a private group from receiving mail from non-group members in the tenant
idea_text: Currently, anyone in the same tenant as a private group can send unsolicited email to that private group, even if they are not a member of the private group. It would be a great improvement to O365 Groups if group admins could enable/disable their private groups from receiving email from non-group members. A similar option already exists for allowing/preventing folks external to the tenant from being able to email a group, public or private.This is not asking for system admin functionality but asking that group creators/group owners are enabled to decide if the group is **really** private.This idea was posted by  back in Jan 2016 but without properly responding that idea has been closed.  So this is asking that the idea be re-opened.

comments.text: This would be very much appreciated.

header: Move the location of the subscribe link
idea_text: Make the subscribe link more accessible. It's currently 3 menus down inside the group. This needs to be on the main page of the group

header: Decouple Apps from Groups or allow the option to create a Group (specifically Planner)
idea_text: I like the idea of apps being tied to planner but some are too tightly coupled with Groups. Our users should be able to create a private plan in Planner without having to create an Office 365 group and SharePoint site. Not all plans are collaborative. This also applies to most apps in Office 365. There should be an option when creating a SharePoint site, Team, Plan, etc to either create JUST the resource in that specific application or to tie it all together in an Office 365 group.

header: cross tenant shared mailbox
idea_text: Given Company A and Company B each having a O365 tenant and they would like to work closed together on Mail. So please allow users from A to be added to B's shared mailboxes. This would allow multiple benefits - including more cross-company collaboration with the Business features, while maintaining security. In addition, company A & B could share a internet mail domain.

header: Shared mailbox - give it real usability
idea_text: The idea of a shared mailbox is to have a simple fast way to maximize you resorces. If the useres have to have to Outlook Web Apps open to have full functionality of the shared mailbox, half of its value goes away... they should simply be able to send msgs in behalf of the sahred mailbox from the main Outlook web app windows, and the mails sent that way save in shared mailbox sent itens. That would be the correct way of shared mailboxes to work!

header: Enable Office 365 Groups Calendar to be shared with external  guests on SharePoint pages
idea_text:
Enable Office 365 Groups Calendar to be shared with external  guests on SharePoint pages This has definetly worked and external partners could see the agenda of  the Office 365 group  in a SharePoint page. Imagine you have a Project and you have assigned engineers at this customer and they want to see the occupation!
Now its not possible anymore and after escalated this to Microsoft , I have been told this is by design after I had tested and  implemented this and now its disabled.

header: Restrict Ability to Create Duplicate Team Names
idea_text: While MS Groups restricts the ability to create duplicate names, there seems to be no such restrictions in MS Teams?  That leads to duplicate names in the Global Address Book (and in Groups) which is leading to confusion. This may just be a bug which is already planning on getting fixed.

comments.text: It Might also be helpful to know which workload created the Group, Planner, Streams, Teams, Outlook, etc.
it would also be important to include the group naming policy that will be applied such as a ny prefix or suffix to the email address, (group ID).

the difference appears that when you create a group via Outlook the unique identifier is the email address which is included. via Teams you do not see the group ID (email address) so you do not see the extra characters that are added via the workflow when a group is created via teams. I would suggest that each service, (Outlook, Teams, Planner, etc) include the group ID(email address) so the interface and functionality is always the same.

header: Whitelist external sender addresses for organization-internal mail groups
idea_text: We'd like to be able to send autogenerated mails from a number of systems to our internal distribution groups, without opening the lists to the public. In our case, the source addresses are very limited, so a simple whitelist where addresses that can bypass the "internal only" filter of Exchange would suffice.

header: Don't get email for conversation replies
idea_text: When someone replies to a message it 'threads' the replies underneath the first post. It would be good to have the option not to get replies to that particular message thread unless I @mentioned for I have replied to the message at some point. or if I was the OP. Pretty much how any social network posting works.

header: When changing the title of an Office Group, the theme color of the underlying site changes randomly (the line below the icon of the site).
idea_text: Simply don't change the color, when changing the name of the office group. Logged a ticket at MS at they said it was by design and should post this here.

header: Ability to un-tick 'send meeting invitation' to entire group when assigning a room to a group calendar
idea_text:
CURRENT IMPLEMENTATION:When you attach a room to an event then select to save that event to a o365group calendar the event will auto tick and then grey out the "Send a meeting invitation to group members" option. This sends out invites to every member of that group to attend the event whether you want to or not.WHAT IS TRYING TO BE ACHIEVED:
To be able to book out a room so it can't be booked by anyone without filling up a members personal calendar with these events and showing them on the group calendar.
In our organization a room can be booked/used by outside agencies and has no attendees from our organization. However we still want the room to be displayed as being in use on the calendar/schedule assistant.   FUNCTIONALITY REQUIRED:
The ability to untick the "Send a meeting invitation to group members" option so these invites don't get sent.

reaction.note: Please see:

comments.text: I have this same need. I want to schedule meetings from my group calendar but control who is invited. Is there a date for this feature?

I want to be able to invite only specific members of the group to specific meetings, but still have these meetings visible on the group calendar. There are 6 sub-groups and I want each of the sub-group's meetings to show up on the calendar without spamming the entire group.
I agree very frustrating I added and event then wanted to add a room but I could not uncheck the box

header: Enable new posts on Yammer home again
idea_text:
End users expect to see a text box at the top of the page where they can post. This is how Yammer worked previously and how all other successful social media sites work.
End users do not know how to find the 'All company' group where it is possible to generate a post in the text box at the top of the page. They do not identify with the 'All company' group as our domain works with academic institutions. Also, it is well-hidden at the bottom of the list of groups.
We are trying to engage end users in Yammer and this is becoming increasingly difficult when basic functions, like writing an original post, are not straight-forward.

header: "One click" enable message moderation
idea_text: Make it easier to enable message moderation on a O365 Group mailbox. This is just too many clicks: With this it would be easier to replace a mailing list server, like sympa, with O365 group mailbox.

header: Allow more places to follow and unfollow groups in Office 365
idea_text: It is very difficlut to find and follow groups on Office 365. Now that the new SharePoint homepage is set up, finding some sites is very difficult. In some cases the only way is going back to Outlook or OneDrive and looking in the left-hand pane for the group. Please add the ability to search for Groups and follow them from the SharePoint homepage. (The look and feel of the new homepage is great though!)

comments.text: You can use this link as a workaround.     We added the link to Featured Links and made a custom tile for Groups.

header: DARK THEME! It would be great if we could have a completely dark backgroung on the Outlook Web App.
idea_text: Almost every application or program has the capabilities to have a completely dark theme, why not Outlook Web App through Office 365?

header: Access to all groups from Onedrive
idea_text: When entering Groups from OneDrive it is not possible to see all Groups in the left menu. It is when entering from Mail. Please make easy access to all groups. Now you have to switch to classic to see all groups. Or follow the link "More websites". It is in our view unnecessary with these extra clicks.

comments.text: Groups should be easy to find and multiply available because who wants to use Sharepoint when you can pound Groups into a viable alternative to Sharepoint.
Clicking the favorite button worked for me. However, this should be automatic but still have the option to unfavorite.
Thank you. Tried that but it didn't work all the time unfortunately.

I figured out how to make any group appear in OneDrive:1. Go to the group's page you'd like to have appear in OneDrive
2. Click Files at the top of the group
3. At the far right of the page, click Browse Library
4. In the page that opens, there's a star in the top right of the page that will likely say Not Following; click it to follow the group
 
It should now appear on OneDrive. The same steps can be taken to remove groups that are appearing in OneDrive that you do not want to see; instead of clicking Not Following you will click Follow (to unfollow the group). This does not remove you grom the group, it just removes the group from your sidebar in OneDrive.

header: Use same color for clickable options in a same screen
idea_text:
I would like you to improve a view to edit data from Office 365 Portal > My account> Personal info.
The Cancel button is shown in black but the Save button in white, so the Save seems like an unclickable option. This is hard to understand.
It would be great that the same color is used for the Save button  as that of the Cancel.
I would request that clickable buttons in a same screen should be shown as same unified color.

header: Enable send voice note in microsoft teams
idea_text: add voice note send in Microsoft teams application ( phone application and web interface)

comments.text: Hope this feature will be available soon. Our team will be much more productive with this!
This would be a great feature basic 2019 messaging app support

header: Allow group provisiong of SharePoint to be optional and vice versa
idea_text: What we like about groups it provides a standard set of services with limited configuration.  When SharePoint is also provisioned as part of the group, then there are more governance considerations.  there are times we don't want a SharePoint site with a group or a group with a SharePoint site.

comments.text: Totally agree with this suggestion. We already have highly-organised Team Sites in SharePoint for our Departments that need to confirm to our governance, so forcing more SharePoint Sites to be created along with Office 365 Groups for us is a barrier to entry and we cannot adopt Groups.

header: Search inside Sub-Directories using partial word under Browse Library
idea_text: In O365 Groups under Browse Library, allow the ability to Search inside sub-directories using a partial word and highlight that word.If I type "relo" to search for "relocation" or "relocate" I want to be able to find all files and folders that start with "relo" inside all of the sub-directories.If I were to use Search under Files tab (where it shows most recently modified files) it would highlight that partial word for those files. This does not happen when searching sub-directories under Browse Library.

header: Disable team creation for users without Azure Premium license
idea_text: we need to disable te possibility for all regular users to create a Team. It should be done without powershell en without an Azure Premium license.

comments.text:
There seems to be no easy way to control who can create a Team in the Teams’ admin center. I have tested this, and it only seems to work if you have Azure Premium Licensing plan 2. There is no way to stop student from creating Teams that I can find. We have Office 365 A3 for faculty
Enterprise Mobility + Security E3 licensing and there is no way to stop students from creating teams without other ramifications. The steps that Microsoft gives are cumbersome and don't always work. This is an issue when students have the potential of misusing this for bulling or private conversations with their peers.

header: Let group owner choose which apps are available to the group
idea_text: Currently, when a group gets created say in Stream, a group email address, calendar, planner, team site, etc..  Many users want to use a group to manage permissions for the video in Stream but have no use for, say, a planner plan. Not every group needs all those other apps. It should be possible for a group owner to add them if needed.

comments.text: Agreed.  In many of our business use cases, departments only want an O365 group in Stream so they can have sub channels within the group.  This provisions a SharePoint site, mailbox, etc.  And these end up not being used.

header: Teams guests to search through documents in Teams app
idea_text: For cooperation with externals in Microsoft Teams it would be very helpful if externals guests which had been invited to join a Team could search through this Team's SharePoint files within Teams app. When logging into SharePoint Website it works, but not within Teams. Would love if this feature could be implemented into Teams app. Thanks for votes!

header: See only their groups in Groups list in Outlook Web App(OWA)
idea_text: Through the Outlook Web App a user can Create a Group. The user sets it up as a private group and then the new group that was created is in the Distribution Lists for everyone to see. Hide these groups so that only group members can see them.

header: Allow us to hide Favorite Group Calendars from left hand pane in Outlook!
idea_text: Allow us to hide Favorite Group Calendars from left hand pane in Outlook!

idea_text:
Good day, 
in Public Group, when you create a link in view, we suppose it will works as only view, instead it gives the possibility to modify online. The possibility to modify online is not good for end-users who expect to work as views. 
Is it possible to modify, the way of working in this case, in order to guarantee, view means only view? 
Maybe there is something to change on the authomatic permissions added into Public Group (like "Everyone except External users").Thanks a lot for taking into account this request.
   Have a nice day

header: Addition and removal owner of Office 365 Groups, who is not a member, via powershell
idea_text: Addition and removal owner of Office 365 Groups, who is not a member, via powershell

comments.text: From the issue I logged on Docs:The PowerShell command forces you to add a user to the members list before it can be added as a owner. The UI in AAD or the M365 admin portal does not enforce this. This restriction should be removed from PowerShell or it should be documented as to why PowerShell is enforcing this.
This anomaly needs fixing. It's very useful to have a non-member as an owner of the group for the sole reason of accepting access request. You can do it in the GUI but not via PowerShell

Yes and you cannot remove a member who is an Owner (but you can in the GUI)
And you cannot add an owner without making him a member (but you can in the GUI)
The documentation also says you can add multiple owners in the new-unifiedgroup but this is not possible for me.

Adding an Owner:This has to be done in 2 steps, first member, than owner:
add-unifiedgrouplinks -LinkType member -Identity [groupname] -links [Accountname]
add-unifiedgrouplinks -LinkType owner -Identity [groupname] -links [Accountname]Removing has to be done also in 2 steps:remove-unifiedgrouplinks -LinkType owner -Identity [groupname] -links [Accountname]
remove-unifiedgrouplinks -LinkType member -Identity [groupname] -links [Accountname]
