header: Remove Teams Groups
idea_text: We recently had one of our tech to accidentally delete the Office 365 Group associated with a team in Microsoft Teams.  This deleted all of the data and link to that team and it no longer shows up in the Teams app.  I had a support representative from Microsoft walk me through a few PowerShell Scripts in attempt to recover the lost data with no avail.  So, what went wrong?  Well, our tech was trying to add a distribution group to another distribution group and thought he selected a distribution group but instead selected the Office 365 Group (associated with the team) and deleted it.  This should not happen.  Maybe I misunderstand the overall architecture here, but Teams is a totally separate product that is intended to be an instant messaging and collaboration system for teams to communicate with one another.  Why in the world it creates a simple Office 365 Group is beyond me.  Now, what do I want changed?  I want one of two things:1) Hide any Office 365 Group associated with Microsoft Teams so that someone can't delete it from there.  The action of deleting a team should be in the Microsoft Teams application, not the O365 Admin Center.or 2) Change the type of group created to something easily identifiable to the user so that they don't accidentally delete it.  In our case, make it something like Office 365 Teams Group or something similar.Seriously, our team lost a little over a year's worth of data due to this simple mistake of identification due to the fact that Microsoft designed this half-*** Teams product.  It is no where near ready for production and should have been in testing longer.  Sorry for the griping and moaning, it's just I expect more from Microsoft.

header: Allow tracking/monitoring of access levels for guest access accounts
idea_text:
Today, we have the ability to look at 'Guest/External" accounts across our environment but the details are very limited. It only provides you the EmailAddress and DisplayName. It would be much better if we could have the following:
Email Address
DisplayName
What they have access to
What type of access they have
Who granted the access to them
When the access was granted
The ability to set expiration on the guest account to notify invitee if still needed.

header: Nominate a new owner
idea_text: In an instance where a Group only has 1 owner, but that owner leaves the company the Group becomes somewhat orphaned.  Please add a more automated way to select a new owner such as allowing current members to nominate a new owner.

comments.text: @Jeremy, I think you should somehow involve 'Office 365 Group' into the name of your idea. It wasn't that easy to find yours, and I wanted to publish the same therefore.

header: Enable Group Assignments in Teams
idea_text:
You can only use individual assignments in Teams. We really need group assignments, because students work together on some assignments. When only one student of a group hands in the group assignment, Teams has to recognize that it is a group assignment and that feedback and grade has to be delivered to all group members.
A class is divided into groups of students.
Without this addition, Teams is not useful for our university of applied sciences!

header: Journaling for Office 365 Groups
idea_text: To be able to journal the Office 365 Group emails to an offsite journaling service. This feature is available for user mailboxes, shared mailboxes and distribution groups, but not for an Office 365 Group mailbox / email address.

header: Provide a compact task list for Planner
idea_text: Provide a compact view that can show 50 or more tasks at a time.  The Board currently only shows 12-16 tasks on a typical display.  Fine for small projects, but we typically have 40-80 active tasks.  Some competitive products offer a traditional task list as an alternate view...this would be good for traditionalists.  Allowing the Board to be tailored to reduce white space, hide/show assignments and due dates, or similar would also be helpful.

comments.text: I agree this would be useful and dramatically increase readability.

header: Fix the New Distribution Group option in Exchange Admin Center
idea_text: Both options, Office 365 Group and Distribution Group now open to a wizard to create Office 365 groups in the Exchange Admin Portal. There is a tiny link at the top to revert back to basic Distribution Groups but the main link should be changed back.  It is causing problems with our teams creating the wrong type of groups for our needs.

comments.text: Completely agree. I use simple distribution groups all the time for alerts, licence and service purchases, etc. To be forced to use a feature that completely is not what is required is ridiculous. Microsoft's marketing geniuses need to realise that creating new features is great, but don't deprecate existing features that have been used for years that your new feature will not replace. TBH as a Microsoft partner for over 20 years, and an early adopter of BPOS/O365, I really am getting sick of this marketing driven new features every 5mins BS.

Agree. This has caused us operational issues, it was raised with MS and we told this was design as Office 365 groups were the new strategy.
However there will always be a place for DL's where people want the notification delivered to their own mailbox, take Infrastructure/system alerts that people see on their phones when not in office.
Very disappointed in how this has been introduced, MS ideas are great but the implementations of these new features are very poor and not thought through.... How more people has this caused issues for.
Imagine a user is a member of 4 DL's that means they would now have 5 mailboxes to view and check ... if they were office 365 groups.

header: Allow us to change the domain of an Office365 group.
idea_text: As it stands, you cannot change the domain of any existing groups in Office365. Our new director requested the domain change and to update the whole company on it. We can update the distribution lists, but not the groups. It seems really short sighted to let us do it on one thing, but not the other when they are listed in the same area!

header: Send notifications to event creators when group members accept events
idea_text: Currently it appears that when a user creates an event and group members accept there isn't a notification that gets sent to the creator letting them know that team members have accepted.  The only way to see accepted attendees is to go into each event separately.  This can be very time consuming.  There either needs to be a notification that is sent or an easier hover display that you can quickly see accepted attendees.

comments.text: Any update on this? It will be nice for the Organizer to receive notifications via email

header: Support Synching Notes Field in Groups
idea_text: ADConnect is successfully synching the notes field from our AD to 365 (Distribution Lists and Security Groups); however 365 does not "consume" the field according to Microsoft support.  When we used ADSync this field did sync to 365 and was available in Outlook.Our users look at the notes field to determine who is the group manager/owner.  Then they can ask the manager/owner to add/remove members.  Now they can not easily get this info.  Please bring this back.

comments.text: This is a need requested by our Human Resources and Executives of Multicare Health System
Please sync the notes field of distribution list from On-prem AD to O365. Our company user notes field to record history and permission of the distribution list
I want to add that this is a catch-22 because you cannot edit the Notes field in 365 with on-prem synced groups.

header: Fix erroneous display of Office 365 Group Calendar appointments when opened via Outlook GAL
idea_text: When opening an Office 365 Group Calendar via Outlook, Open Calendar dialog, and picking the group from the GAL, the calendar displays many Busy/Tentative/Out of Office appointments that do not exist in the group calendar. This issue has been reproduced and acknowledged during a support ticket escalated to the Senior Escalation Team, ticket SRX616112591871609ID. This method is apparently 'not a supported way' of opening an Office 365 Group Calendar; nevertheless it is possible and users have no way of knowing that the appointments displayed are bogus.

comments.text: I'm considering removing the group address book to remove the possibility of this occurring.

header: Allow open with explorer view
idea_text: Allow open with explorer view

header: Update admin settings to disable e-mail copy to members by default EVEN if it is an invitation for an event sent to the group calendar
idea_text: Since one or two weeks if you invit a groups in an event, all members of the group receive an e-mail invitation in personnal mailbox depsite the fact that you chosen to not subscribe members by default. They receive invitations and response by default. We wish to be able to disabled this by default and not sending e-mail or invitation sent to a group in each personnal members mailboxes. Please update the way to manage by the owner of the groups to unubscribe all emmebers by default from all notification outside the common conversation groups discussion.

comments.text: This is an ongoing irritation for our Office 365 Group members.  The primary way our employees use the shared calendars in Groups is to post vacation days or other reminders.  Frequently, they forget to un-check the option to notify all of the other group members.  Since we have so may Office 365 Groups, our employees are getting spammed by these entries.We need a way to administratively set the default action to "not notify group members".

I am also having this problem of the Group calendar defaulting to sending a calendar event or meeting invite to everyone in the group by default. This occurs even when I specifically tell the group calendar not to send this invite to the whole groupThere are times when everyone in the group may not be in the same meeting, and having them receive all the group invites by default is confusing and unnecessary.

header: Group name or logo cannot be modified after creation
idea_text: When group name is edited, the update is not applied on the Group sharepoint site where the name is still set to the original one. This also happens with the logo.Changes on the Group (title, logo,...) should be correctly applied to the Group sharepoint site.

comments.text: In certain environments the need for consistency of naming needs to be there, Azure AAD Premium is a good first step however there needs to be the ability to prevent renaming
Microsoft documentation states that this should be possible to do within the group site: However, the option isn't actually enabled/visible.

header: Easier emailing to channels from Outlook
idea_text: It'd be really cool to be able to type a Team name in Outlook to message the team and have that generate a fly-out menu with the different channels to which to route the message appropriately. Allowing for proper threading between Teams and Outlook users would also be awesome.

header: Planner - Allow attachments directly from my tasks
idea_text: When trying to add attachments to the tasks from "My tasks" it's grayed out. Please allow us to add files to the tasks directly from that menu.

comments.text: Same as , I suggest to vote there instead.

I agree, this option shouldn't be greyed out. 
The user has access to the group/plan files and should be able to access the files through "My Tasks" also.

header: Groups expiration e-mail translation or multi-language support
idea_text: Currently the generated "Office 365 Groups expiration" e-mails, are English. I would like to send this e-mail in a alternative language. If possible this should be changed in Azure (select language).The e-mail body and also the "renew group"-button should be translated.

comments.text: Due to the big impact, we need to inform users in alternative languages.

header: Please bring back delay sending email message
idea_text: It seems that lots of people will want this facility

header: Ability to disable the creation of Private groups in Yammer
idea_text: We need the ability to disable students from creating private groups in Yammer. The ability to create groups has been disabled in O365 for them. O365 & Yammer are integrated.

header: Enable the general user to make requests to the owner to delete other users.
idea_text:
*English follows Japanese■Title(件名)：Office 365 グループの一般のメンバーが、他のメンバーを削除する方法Enable the general user to make requests to the owner to delete other users.
***************
■Description(内容):
Office 365 グループにつきまして、所有者の権限を付与せずに、メンバーの管理をさせたいと考えています。
プライベート グループでは、一般のユーザーが他のメンバーを招待すると、所有者に承認が求められる動作となります。同じように、一般のユーザーが、他のユーザーの削除を所有者に依頼する事が可能となる動作を希望します。​​Currently, we are considering to manage members without granting the authority of owner in the Office 365 group. In private groups, the owner's approval is required when the general user invites another member to the tenant. In addition to this, we hope the feature will be available that the general user can make requests the owner to delete other users.Thank you for your consideration.

header: Enable sending mails from the iOS Groups App
idea_text:
Remember to include "Send As" option
Enabeling members with "Send As" permissions to send external mails as the Group

header: The ability to expand group when you are creating a new meeting, in calendar and scheduling assistant. Cannot open to view users today.

comments.text: I just ran into this scenario.  I wanted to send a meeting invite to a group but needed to expand the group list so that I could look at individuals calendars to help me judge when I can schedule the meeting.

header: Being able to setup an auto reply on an Office 365 Group in cloud.
idea_text: Being able to setup an auto reply on an Office 365 Group in cloud.

header: Need to be able to sort group files when adding them as attachments to email in OWA
idea_text: In OWA, when you try to attach a file from a cloud location, and choose a group file, instead of a OneDrive for Business file or a recent attachment, whose views ARE sortable, you get name and subject columns that are not clickable/sortable. Please add this feature.

header: Enable the Content Organizer Feature for use in O365 groups.
idea_text:
Currently this is feature is disabled in O365 Groups.  Enabling this feature would allow document drop off and routing, providing a much needed feature for a some up coming projects.When attempting to activate, the follow message is returned.The Site scoped feature being activated has a dependency on hidden Site Collection scoped feature 'FeatureDefinition/15/0c8a9a47-22a9-4798-82f1-00e62a96006e' (ID: '0c8a9a47-22a9-4798-82f1-00e62a96006e'). Hidden features cannot be auto-activated across scopes. There may be one or more visible Site Collection scoped features that auto-activate the dependent hidden feature. That hidden feature is....

header: offer options to hide membership for Office 365 groups.
idea_text: Certain features require setting up Office 365 groups for being able to utilize these with external guests. And example of this is when using Azure Information Protection for encrypting email content, you are required to select the group that has permission to open the content. The only way that works is to utilize an Office 365 Group, as even mail enabled security groups do not work for this. In these situations, when you add a guest user and they accept the invite, they are able to see the other members of the group. This is a GDPR concern as it displays things that GDP classes as PII (the email address) and can cause issues. Per:  this had a roadmap entry last year, but no longer is listed and also not implemented.

header: Give us a workaround for AOL/Yahoo Guest users and DMARC
idea_text:
The new Guest Access feature for Office 365 Groups is great, except that it's unusable when you have AOL and Yahoo users as guests.Because AOL and Yahoo both use a DMARC policy of p=reject, users cannot send/receive properly through distribution lists, or Office 365 Groups.For Example: 
JohnDoe@yahoo sends an email to the Group. The group simply redirects that message, as is, to , who is a guest member of the group.  will not receive the message, since it violates the Yahoo DMARC policy and is thus rejected.If Office 365 Groups would modify the from: and reply-to: fields appropriately, it would resolve this issue. But they do not. The only current options are setup a smarthost or setup intermediate mailboxes for every DL/Group with yahoo or aol members. Both options destroy the user-friendly features that Office 365 Groups are supposed to offer.

comments.text: Having external users in any type of group does not work well for email delivery.  Even if you setup mail contacts for external users, if an external sender emails the distribution list, delivery to the external members typically fails due to anti-spoofing.

header: Classification based external setting for Office 365 groups
idea_text: There have been many cases where IT wants to provide Office 365 groups that are for internal use only. This would prevent users from inviting external users or sharing group´s sharepoint files to external users.Now that Office 365 groups have classification, it would be great to map those classifications to different group templates.For example if we have Internal and external classiffication. When you select Internal classification for the group, it would set the AllowToAddGuests=$False for the group and set-sposite -SharingCapability Disabled for the group´s SharePoint site.When you select External as classification, you could set that the group can have external members and SharePoint content can be shared outside.This would reduce user errors greatly.

comments.text: I agree, also we'd like a option to set AllowToAddGuests=$False for all newly created groups by default so we can selectively enable them through our own internal process.

header: Outlook Groups - Pop out Conversation
idea_text:
Create a possibility to pop out the conversation in a group for reading.
Scrolling is possible but is not handy...

header: merge old office 365 group with a new microsoft team
idea_text: we have groups already made but would like them to exist as a Microsoft team with the added benefits.

comments.text: This functionality already exists. When you create a new Team, you have the ability to associate it to an existing O365 Group.

header: More granular permissions on Office 365 Groups and Teams
idea_text:
We need more granular permissions for O365 GroupsWhile group collaboration is awesome, there are some items that need to be addressed. Just because you are a member of a private group does not mean I want you to be able to modify files, add calendar items, or other types of activities.1. Owners can do anything
2. Members.
3. Read-Only Permissions. (Similar to Guest users)
4. Read-Only Permissions to specific areas, such as files, channel creation...

comments.text: We have a request to allow people access to only the calendar of an O365 group and nothing else (not the Inbox, Files, etc.). And the users should have view-only access, not full access. As far as I can tell, it is impossible to do this. So the manager will have to set up both an O365 group and a separate shared or resource calendar.

The distinction between owner, member and guest is too simple. We need more granularity. For instance, a kind of super user who can admit and manage members but not change all other settings for the group.

header: Search for a part of the group name (UI and API)
idea_text: Currently you can only search on the start (startswith) of a group name. But with the new naming policy (with prefixes that users don't know) it should be possible to search on a part (substringof) of a group name as well to make it easier to find a group.

comments.text:
I'm shocked that this isn't a more highly requested feature. How are any admins able to manage their groups if there are hundreds and you need to see if a group already exists with a particular word in the name? It seems nearly unthinkable to me that if there are groups like:Laser Software
Robot Software 
Software DevelopmentIf you search on Software, it will ONLY find "Software Development" and report only 1 match, because, as Mike (OP) pointed out, it only searches on the start of the group name. Especially now that we're automating Group creation with Teams, this has suddenly become critical so we can search to find if Teams exist without necessarily knowing the specific word order used to create the Team.Please ensure that Group names are indexed on all words in each Group name so that in the above example searching on "software" would return all 3 results.

header: Enable Automatic Replies from O365 Groups
idea_text: With O365 Groups taking over functionality of a shared mailbox, it should have more features of a Shared MB, including the ability to set up Automatic Replies from the Group.

header: Assign Task to guests in Planner
idea_text: As guests could be invited to join a group, it would be appreciable to assign them a Task via Planner.

comments.text: Completely agree with the following

idea_text:
'description' attribute value of [Distribution list] and [Mail-enabled security group] are shown on Office 365 poral but not Azure AD Portal.- repro steps -
1. [Office 365 portal] -> [Admin] -> [Groups - Groups] -> [Add a group]
2. create [Distribution list] or [Mail-enabled security group] 
3. check the created group's details in Office 365 portal and AzureAD portal.

header: Allow Planner tasks to be assigned to existing teams or groups
idea_text: It would be nice to have the ability to add task assignments to a pre-existing functional team or other office group.

comments.text: yes , got same query from our customers, not selecting again and again single persons
Personally I would also like the feature to allow you to choose multiple people to assign to a task (not just through the groups system). Or allow aspects from the Task list to be assigned to people.

header: Consistent Send As/on Behalf of across all apps and platforms
idea_text: Send As/Send on Behalf of (Group) is far too difficult and inconsistent across platforms.Outlook 2016 can change the 'From' line to Send As/on Behalf of a group and Outlook Web App can do this too, however, there are BIG problems with both.First, it doesn't do it by default when you reply to an external e-mail.Say for example I host  in an Office 365 Group, as the Knowledgebase Article nicely describes.  A customer sends an e-mail to the group and I reply.  By default the reply would come from my personal e-mail address, not the group, and subsequent replies from the customer come to me, bypassing the group.  I can change the 'From' address, but again only if I remember and only if I'm using Outlook 2016 or Outlook Web App on the PC.  This behaviour is not available in Outlook Web App from my Phone because groups aren't even displayed in the Mobile UI of Outlook Web App.  If I do remember to change the from line I must also CC the group, or again, the message will be in my sent items folder bypassing the group.  In other words, there's two (2) manual steps which must be taken for every single message in order not to bypass the group.Next, the Outlook Groups apps on mobile devices don't allow Send As/on Behalf of at all, so this prevents me from replying to customers on the go, particularly with the fact the Outlook Web App doesn't display groups in the mobile UI (mobile web browser set to request Mobile friendly web pages).

comments.text:
Brad, you wrote:
"If I do remember to change the from line I must also CC the group, or again, the message will be in my sent items folder bypassing the group".There exists an add-in for Outlook 2016 that automates this process. Every e-mail sent as or on behalf of Office 365 group is BCCed to that group and become visible for all members. Google for BCCtoGroup.
Please consider voting for this similar idea:
We need a way to force this behavior as an Admin, such that ALL email to External recipients shows only the Group alias, either by way of 'Send As' or 'Send on Behalf of'

I agree. Send as Group/on behalf of Group    AND     Reply from Group/on behalf of Group should be easy to access.
It can be done now but it is not user friendly, thus users turn away from groups.

header: Office 365 Shared Mailbox Default Alias
idea_text: It appears that right now the behavior is to create an alias automatically at the primary domain, so when you set up an email address with the same name but different domain, you get a error that prevents creation.

header: Enable Excel web part in Office 365 group site
idea_text: The Office 365 group site should have the same features as SharePoint Online. For example, we are not able to enable Excel web access web part in O365 group site because custom script is by default deny and it cannot be enabled .

comments.text: we use Groups in Office 365 in our corporate, to collaborate with and easily set up a collection of shared Outlook inbox, shared calendar or a document library, projects and task list, and we need Excel web part in Office 365 group site, to unlock the potential of our task list data, bring data together to see the meaning behind the numbers, and help us showing comparisons and trends much easier.
I agree

header: Provide support for links
idea_text:
Being part of a group allows you to reply in conversations, when entering text it is not possible to make a link clickable. Therefore if you reply with a link a user has to select that link and copy paste it into the browser to navigate to that content. 
It would be nice if you have to option to add links or links are automatically rendered as a link (maybe with the same integration your e-mail client renders a preview of the link).

comments.text:
+1 for this request.
Please support preview for all kind of links as you do now for youtube.com-Links for example.
And to be clear, I am talking about the OWA interface

header: Office 365 Group Calendar error with "could not be updated" when displayed in your calendar view and there are greater than 20 members.
idea_text: Office 365 Group Calendar error with "could not be updated" when displayed in your calendar view and there are greater than 20 members.  This a known limitation by Microsoft. The limitation in this case is strictly related to O365 group calendar. If you do a Fiddler trace when opening an O365 group with greater than 20 members, it will display, "There are more users in the distribution list than the allowed size. The allowed size is = 20". Microsoft states this is by design.

comments.text: Microsoft states they support up to 2,500 members in groups.  They need to support the same number of members when an O365 group calendar is displayed in your calendar view.

header: EXO Dynamic Distribution Group shold be able to use wildcard as 1st character in Set-DynamicDistributionGroup -RecipientFilter
idea_text: when set up a DDG in cloud-based environments, we can't use a wildcard as the first character as we did on-premise. For example, Sales* is allowed, but *Sales isn't allowed. Wildcards are valid only at the end for cloud-based environments and only at the front or back of words for on-prem environments, this is very in-user-friendly

header: Apply default quota
idea_text:
Now Office 365 Groups have the way to apply the quota against "existing" Groups via Set-SPOSite PowerShell commandlet.
IT admins expect to be able to apply the default quota which means every new Groups use this quota after apply this value by IT admins.

comments.text: Is the tenant property OneDriveStorageQuota tied to the group default quota for groups? If so, can we have a separate property that governs groups over OneDrive For Business?

header: Add an optional 'Subject' line to Groups' messages
idea_text: It would be great to be able to add an optional subject line to group messages. This is mostly needed when sending to external parties so that the messages appear in the inbox with a 'proper' subject line rather than the first line of the message.

header: Excel Online Survey - Allow mutiple answers with choice questions
idea_text: Excel Online Survey - Allow multiple answers with choice questions. Using the online Excel survey feature, it would be great if the respondent could select multiple answers. I realize this is tricky getting the data into the Excel cell, but it would be good if the user did not have to manually type the data.  Thanks!

header: Automatically archive groups that are no longer being used
idea_text: Self service means that groups are created that may not be used, create a process that determines idle groups, asks if anyone I still using it, and if not puts it into an archived state where messages and files are preserved but group is otherwise closed.

reaction.note: Hi,As A. Auras has mentioned, this is in our roadmap and in development.We’re currently looking how how you can create and manage preservation and deletion policies that affect Office 365 Group mail and files.Keep track of this on our roadmap:

comments.text: Very keen to see this feature appear to bring groups under control.
Actually this is already in development:
I've created a similar idea but hopefully more general (not restricted to automation) to attract more votes. See here:

header: Automatically add/remove users from groups at set time
idea_text: Having the ability in the admin o365 portal to set a time and date to add/remove user to group at certain time. To allow users to not receive unwanted emails while away or take over someone else's emails while away.So someone who is away will not get unwanted Support emails what will be dealt with by other people while they are away.If someone who deals with Sales email is away somebody else can receive these emails for the duration of the holiday and take over their duties.

comments.text: Great idea

header: The possibility to repalce the standard onenote with onenote for class or onenote for staff
idea_text: Every office 365 group comes with a standard OneNote attached to the group. There are alot of schools,  which use OneNote for class and OneNote for staff. I would be a great feature if you could repalce the standard OneNote, with the the one OneNote class that a given class use.  Then the teachers and students, would have benefits of the calendar and announcement in the group and still have access to the right OneNote within the office 365 group

comments.text: With the release of the PLC Group type, it'd be great to see the addition of a "Staff Group" type as an option which would provision the Staff OneNote notebook instead (similar to how Classroom provisions the Class OneNote)
Related:

header: allow add group to another group
idea_text: Every time I create a new group I only have the option to click check boxes for individual users to add them to the group.  I would like to be able to add groups as members.  We have state, office, department groups.  It would be nice to just add them as a member of a new group/team...

reaction.note: Can you please tell us if your other groups (state, office, department, etc) are Security Groups or are they other Office 365 Groups?How would adding this group help your O365 Group experience? What type of information will be shared and how does it improve the flow of communication or management? Thanks!

comments.text:
Microsoft - Please refer to the other Feedback item that is a year older than this and has over 1,400 up votes!
As for use case - Think of an organizational chart. I have 'Sales Team East' and 'Sales Team West' but would like to add them both to 'Sales Team All' so when doing permissions in things like SharePoint, I can add Sales Team All to the page instead of individual groups OR if I need to send an email to all team members, everyone gets it!I know this is a small example, but scale this up to a company with hundreds of users - maintaining multiple group memberships for users is a very hard thing to manage

His is not the only use case. I have a hierarchical set of on-prem AD groups which are meant to map to O365 groups.There are two key overarching goals:1.	To onboard and manage personnel with least amount of overhead and widest propagation for both security and email distributions. 
a.	Management should be bottom up, meaning a team should control its own members. 
2.	To foster communication and collaboration within our practice.1.	As a product owner, I want a single team member change to grant access to all relevant resources and subscribe to all relevant distribution lists. 
a.	At my firm, the widest propagation is via US domain. We’ve set up universal domain groups nested similar to a chart I can't seem to attach to this post but have emailed to you guys before. 
2.	As a product developer, I want to ask every developer working for Partner1 if they’ve encountered a problem I’m dealing with. 
a.	Because we can’t do dynamic domain groups, we have an “alternate” vertical domain group hierarchy for the topics. As an example, ProductA (BIZ) is simultaneously a member of ProductA and Partner1 (BIZ). Partner1 (BIZ) rolls up to FinTech (BIZ). 
b.	We’ve created O365 groups to parallel the nested domain groups. The problem is that adding the FinTech QA domain group as a member of the parallel FinTech QA O365 group would expand all the members and break the link to the domain group hierarchy. 
3.	As a QA tester, I want to have chat channels, shared files, and other shared resources across all Fintech QA. 
a.	Teams is very isolating. We want our teams socializing, cross-pollinating, and collaborating rather than evolving apart from each other and – almost certainly – reinventing wheels. 
4.	As an account manager, I expect product teams to collaborate closely when dealing with a client licensing multiple products. 
5.	As a partner, I want to have chat channels, shared files, and other shared resources across applicable to my entire group as well as a workspace for group-level reporting.

header: Problem with Groups calendar 'add to my calendar' feature
idea_text:
There is a serious UI/UX issue with the group calendars 'add to my calendar' feature. 
When a user creates a new appointment in a group calendar they have the option to "send an invitation to the group" (the default) or deselect that checkbox. 
First of all there is a bit of a UX issue with the terminology as a user can easily take this to mean this will send emails, meeting requests to all members of the group, which is not the case.If a user deselects this option the appointment is created, but when any member of the group tries to use the 'add to my calendar' feature, it doesn't add the event to the users personal calendar. 
Instead of creating a personal calendar entry, an email is sent to all members of the group with an calendar item as an attachment which does not function as a meeting request. The only options for the attachment are to download or save to OneDrive.Not only is the 'add to my calendar' feature broken for this event, there is no clear way of undoing the problem short of deleting the event and creating it again with the "send an invitation to the group" selected.I think the wording of the "send an invitation to the group" option needs to made clearer to explain what it is actually going to do. And the 'add to my calendar' feature needs to work properly if the "send an invitation to the group" option has been deselected.

comments.text: I totally agree.I also noticed there are FOUR duplicates of this exact same question here (linked below), each with different vote counts. Would an admin PLEASE merge these?

This is a huge issue in my organization.  This needs to be reconsidered by Microsoft as it's causing a lot of confusion with the end user community, and is definitely is a negative end-user experience.

There is a serious UI/UX issue with the group calendars 'add to my calendar' feature. 
When a user creates a new appointment in a group calendar they have the option to "send an invitation to the group" (the default) or deselect that checkbox. 
First of all there is a bit of a UX issue with the terminology as a user can easily take this to mean this will send emails, meeting requests to all members of the group, which is not the case.If a user deselects this option the appointment is created, but when any member of the group tries to use the 'add to my calendar' feature, it doesn't add the event to the users personal calendar. 
Instead of creating a personal calendar entry, an email is sent to all members of the group with an calendar item as an attachment which does not function as a meeting request. The only options for the attachment are to download or save to OneDrive.Not only is the 'add to my calendar' feature broken for this event, there is no clear way of undoing the problem short of deleting the event and creating it again with the "send an invitation to the group" selected.I think the wording of the "send an invitation to the group" option needs to made clearer to explain what it is actually going to do. And the 'add to my calendar' feature needs to work properly if the "send an invitation to the group" option has been deselected.

header: Remove meeting room from the location field if the room declines the meeting
idea_text: If a user creates a meeting and invites a room that is not available (or they are not authorised to book) then the meeting room stays in the location field. As attendees see the declined room they believe that is where the meeting is happening and report that the meeting room has been double-booked. The room has not been double booked, it's just not clear to the attendees that the room declined the invite.

comments.text: Please fix...issue is confusing and disruptive
This is causing lots of issues in our company. Please fix it.
This is happening to us to - please fix!  Users do not click in to the invite details to see that the room declined.
This happens with our room resources frequently. The user sees the room booked on their calendar and never even looks at the decline message.

header: Set Default File Type to Avoid User Dialog on first start of Word
idea_text: On every first start of Word in "Office 365 ProPlus" a dialog box appears for the user to select the file type ("Office Open XML formats" or "OpenDocument formats"). It would be very helpful, if this could be set by default. For example with a group policy or the installation xml.

header: Add ability to sort Planner tasks by label.
idea_text:
Right now tasks can only be sorted by Bucket or Assigned To. Having the ability to sort also by label would be very helpful.
Thanks!

comments.text: This option now exists, not sure if it did in 2017.

header: Integrate Groups Calendar with Outlook App Android
idea_text: I would love to have a central calendar Administration Tool such as Outlook for example. I would appreciate to be enabled to administer all my calendars with only one App. Outlook App would be fine for this.

reaction.note: Thanks for the feedback. We are planning to bring group calendar to Outlook iOS and Android app in the near future.

comments.text: Very frustrating, I only need to share group calendar with 2 people on their iOS and Android phones and cannot do it. PLEASE provide this functionality soon!
You are pushing users into using Teams and Groups, and you do not have it available on the phone, its been a year, what does near future mean? Please hurry!
That would be great. Currently I can not schedule meetings when on the road - because I have to use my laptop to make arrangements since I need to see both calendars

Hello,
Any updates to this? Group Calendars are sorely needed on mobile

header: Change group visibility mode at any time and add moderated level
idea_text: A feature available in a similar tool allowed group owners to set visibility as public, moderated, or private.  Add a moderated level and allow owners to change visibility at any time, for example from private to public.

reaction.note: Moderation is a feature that we’re working on, but it’s not tied to the privacy type since all groups should be able to be moderated.Public to private conversion released last week.

comments.text: Great idea! Hop it will be developed

header: Synchronize Team Conversation with Group Conversation
idea_text: It's confusing to have such feature overlap between Teams and Groups.  When should a organizational group in a company communicate via Group and when via Teams?  I think the Conversation in Teams should be the same data as the conversation in the Group of the same name.  Perhaps the Group conversation could be the same as Teams General channel while Teams permits additional channels where Groups just have the one.

comments.text: My program also would really like this feature. Everything is shared between the Outlook and Teams' interfaces for an O365 Group except the conversations and each platform has its own advantages. Outlook Groups easily allows non-members to email the group and the ability to cross post to multiple groups while keeping the thread together. Teams is brilliant for collaborating around projects. But if we have both we end up with split conversations and information silos. Finish integrating these products by having conversations shared between the Outlook Group and the General channel so people can chose the interface that best works for them.

Basically the second part of this statement: "The Outlook group provides an email address people from outside the team can use to send email to the entire team. However, you can't post messages or view channel conversations from Outlook." is a issue for us. Since Outlook does not show what is going on in the Team. 
()

This is critical. My team is confused about where to communicate. We have guests users in teams but not groups and they miss out on key information shared via outlook, and staff miss out if info is shared in teams.

Need the same conversation folder that shows up in outlook for Skype for business to also show up for teams when in team group chat. Its needed for compliance to have the conversation folder recorded to another program which always worked with the Skype for business conversation folder. Need the same process for all teams and groups.
would be really nice to get some clarity on where Microsoft and the O365 and Teams team are heading with this.Currently very confusing to the end user.

header: Remove Calendar Event Notifications from Correspondence Feed
idea_text: Remove (or make configurable) the display of new Event notifications from the correspondence feed.   When setting up a large number of events, this kind of takes over the correspondences and impacts usability.

header: Allow Group calendar appointments  and Including a user  without notifying everyone in the group
idea_text:
Currently I can create  an event on the group calendar  I can deselect "send and invitation to the group ".  This is great when I want to add an event  without  notification.  However if  I add an attendee (eg notifying my supervisor) it selects  the send invitation and greys it out".  
If you could allow attendees and group calendar notification in one 
 appointment ,this would be a easy " Out of Office?Vacation"  system

comments.text: I would love to see this too!

header: Enable creation of subfolders in Office 365 Groups
idea_text: Public folders are very slow, Office 365 Groups are fast. When migrating public folders to Office 365 Groups we need the ability to create subfolders in Outlook to structure the mail data.

comments.text: how can creat subfolder in  office 365 Group in Outlook

header: Allow people to share a link to a public group as a way of promoting it within the organization
idea_text: To allow users to click a url to be able to visit a public group page to be able to join it would be fantastic!

reaction.note: Good idea! We plan to address this by giving owners the ability to share a link to join the group. If you want to share a link to a public group’s conversations today, you can just copy the link to the group’s email conversations from the browser address bar.

comments.text: Is this the same as "Office 365 Groups: Invite To Join"?  If so, it is currently in the Rolling Out stage on the roadmap.

header: Migrate SharePoint calendar (list) to O365 Group calendar (Exchange)
idea_text: Migrate an existing calendar in SharePoint to O365 Group calendar. We understand SharePoint calendar is a list however there is no export option to easily import events into the O365 group calendar. When attempting to import .ics files into O365 calendar it only allows to import user calendar and no option for Group calendar.

comments.text: To migrate Office 365 Public folder migration to SharePoint or SharePoint to office 365, you can use Kernel Migrator for SharePoint software. Try it from here:

header: Allow to change group expiration email intervals
idea_text: Currently emails are sent 30 days, 15 days, and 1 day prior to expiration of the group. In some cases the 30 days is not enough and custom solutions are needed. It would be great if we could change at least the first email to be sent for example 60 days prior to expiration.

header: Show Groups in Outlook 2016 without caching
idea_text: A few months ago we had the ability of using groups in Outlook 2016. We were in the middle of a migration and ready for the usage of groups. Apparently, the groups disappeared from Outlook 2016 and can only be turned on when using caching. Using cached-mode is not a option for us as a school. We are also using VDI/VmView-environment and having cached-mode on would certainly bring a lot of problems to the table. I've spoken with a MS technician and the answer was this is by design behavior. We would like to have the option at least to cache groups and not the whole mailbox or have the groups back in Outlook 2016 (and beyond) without caching. I can't find a explanation as to why this has been changed?

comments.text:
The same idea was posted here: 
It's been declined, but there's not even a comment explaining why.
Yes, please fix this!

header: Can not manage synchronized "Office 365 groups" from Azure AD in our on premise AD
idea_text: We can not manage synchronized "Office 365" groups from Azure Active Directory to our Local AD. We have a hybrid environment and the management of groups is done in Local, the groups "office 365" can not be modifiable (even if we modified them the changes do not synchronize towards Azure AD).

comments.text: Faz muita falta esse recurso no ambiente hibrido.
A on-premise group that sync with Online, the owner cannot manage this group synced by Outlook APP
We need to have same ability of management as the other types of groups like Distribution and Security groups and to be able to manage Office 365 groupes on premise and in office 365 as well.

header: Increase character limit and escape commas for Group.Unified SettingsTemplate.ClassificationDescriptions
idea_text: The character limit for the SettingsTemplate.ClassificationDescriptions attribute is 255 characters.  Also allow a way for commas to be escaped.

comments.text: I would like to echo the comments below.  Increasing the character limit and adding support for commas in the descriptions would be very helpful.  Also, please update the documentation so customers don't have to call support or engage a DSE for assistance with something so trivial.  Thanks!
Please fix this to a realistic limit
Also please update the documentation to show such limitations.

header: Create a searable archive instead of deleting a Group
idea_text:
Our company is doing a lot of projects, each project is an Office 365 Group. Once the project is done, the owner of the Group copies the most important files / conersations / OneNote pages etc. to a file share and closes the Group. 
Other users can search through this archive whenever they are doing a similar project. This is working fine but quite a bit of work.
How cool would it be if there was a way to mark a Group as ‘Archived’ and all the latest document versions from OneDrive/conversations etc. will be marked as ‘Archived’. 
Once marked as ‘Archived’ these files/ conversations etc. won’t show up in searchresults, Delve or Groupslist except when the user toggles a switch which enables him/her to browse through the archived Groups?

header: down to top administration of all kind of distribution lists, Groups, security groups, Yammer Groups
idea_text:
The typical tenant of worldwide companies are hybrid tenants with ADSync to a local AD structure. Please add local and Azure AD Groups the option to tag the Group:
1. Yammer Group
2. Groups Group
3. distribution Group
4. security Group
5. Teams GroupYou can switch off or on all or two or three or only one. If you switch on Security, Yammer and Teams the group will be deploy. If you turn it off, the group will be delete or archive.Behind a Yammer and Teams group are only one SharePoint Online Site and Exchange Online.  -> all of the administration is possible OnPremise in the local AD and in Azure ADThank you very much!

header: add option to disable feedback button
idea_text: Add the ability for owners to disabled the feedback button or configure it to send the feedback to them.

comments.text: Now the Feedback button can be partly disabled through the command "UserVoiceForFeedbackEnabled:$false", but it only works for Modern Pages and not for System Pages like the Home Page for SharePoint. The Office 365 Support says that this is beyond the support team's capability and they directed my request to this page.This is still a major(!) GDPR risk and the Feedback button should be disabled immediately.
Please add this option to hide the button for Site Visitors and Site Members.

header: Allow on-premise groups to be memebers of an Office 365 group
idea_text:
I use a particular security group for admin functions on the on-premise domain and have mail enabled that group for ease of contact. I would like to be able to add that on-premise group to an Office365 group so I am only managing membership in one place.
The on-premise group retains the rights it needs and the Office 365 group including the on prem group manages the email and group files.

comments.text: We have location based on-premise security groups (i.e TorontoStaff, RedmondStaff etc). These get automatically populated by HR system and sync to AAD using AAD connect. We don't have on premise Exchange so group write-back is not an option.We are noticing stale groups and users are hesitant to be the owner of a group because they would need to manage membership.If O365 groups could auto sync with on-premise managed groups, it would definitely increase the adoption of O365 groups/Teams.  It can be a simple interface that would allow group owners to list groups that they want to sync from.

header: Ability to change the default icon that represents a Group or Distribution List
idea_text: An admin should be able to change the default icon that Microsoft uses to represent a Group or Distribution list within Office 365 since others within that organization will see that icon.

comments.text: I am a admin for our company, and I need the ability to decide and change the icon for the group that I create.  Fix it!!

If you are a normal user and own a Group, you can change the Group picture if you open the Group in Outlook or OWA. In Outlook select your Group and in the menu click Edit Group and in the dialogue box where the Picture is Shown, click Edit. This will open OWA where you can change the Picture. If you open the Group in OWA directly, just hover over the Picture and click to edit.

If you are an Office Admin, go to the Administrator portal (the new portal experience), click on Groups > Groups, then select your Office 365 group or distribution list. This will show you a pane on the right hand side with the details of the group or distribution list, and here, you will see the letter-based icon and below it, a link called "Change". Click here to change the image.
I swear I was able to change the icon from the default letters to an actual picture.  But now I can't?

header: Increase Sharepoint storage allowance
idea_text:
The fact that each person in the company has 1tb of personal onedrive space is awesome! It becomes a little less awesome when they start to move or copy files into a 365 group which uses up sharepoint storage which is a bit more of a premium.
Since OneDrive and sharepoint are becoming closer siblings, the data allowance should follow suite. Even a 100gb per user contribution to the Sharepoint storage would be a great improvement.

comments.text: I couldn't agree more.  Your claim of unlimited storage is intentionally misleading... 1Tb per onedrive acount is not the same as 5Tb of company storage    We are an organization, not a bunch of individuals.  If you are going to offer 5Tb of storage to an organization, give us 5Tb of storage!  Not 5 1Tb storage boxes.  This is unworkable and we are switching back to one of your competitors who does offer truly unlimited storage.  Please correct this and we'll come back.

In E3, E5, and SP Plan 2, you get "unlimited" OneDrive storage but SP storage is still limited to 1TB. If you look at OneDrive's URL, it is essentially a part of the SP framework. So, it makes absolutely no sense that Microsoft can offer "unlimited" OneDrive storage, but not each individual Site Collections/Sites. What is the difference if you are already offering unlimited storage?If a user has one of the premium plans, give the users the option to store "unlimited" content in either OneDrive OR SP Sites, depending on their needs. Let SP be what it is supposed to be, a collaboration tool for any organizations of any size. That means having unlimited storage in Site Collections and Sites.Jimmy C. - I agree the additional SP storage pricing is outrageous. Btw, that $200 is per month, so $2400/year, for 1 TB! I might as well sign up for another Office 365 account for <$100/year and get another 1TB worth of SP space. Therefore Microsoft, please don't tell us you can increase your SP storage by buying additional space, the pricing makes no sense! Just give users unlimited SP storage if they are on a premium plan!

I have to believe that many organizations are like mine in that we do most of our work through Sharepoint so that everyone in the office can have access and participate. Our individual users don't need near as much as 1TB of individual OneDrive space when almost all of our work is being done in Sharepoint.To get around this, I'm going to have to create a new "dummy" user to save a portion of our files to get an extra TB of storage for only $12.50. It'll work but it's not nearly as convenient as Sharepoint.

Yes, this is crazy - it makes no sense to allow 25tb of storage to a user's onedrive as part of a sharepoint online Plan 2, but to leave the sharepoint site collection limit at 1TB. Plan 2 should come with 25tb of usable storage in Sharepoint Online sites.

I saw the 25 TB limitation on SharePoint, I was is fine for my user having around 1.5TB data in his Dropbox, after a call to Microsoft found out that SharePoint only adds 500MB per user license and the price to increase the size is outrageous!! $0.20 per GB = $200 per 1TB, what was Microsoft thinking when they set those prices for his SharePoint?We need more storage and I agreed with at least 100GB per user contribution to SharePoint would be a great improvement and REDUCING the ridiculous prices per GB would to!

header: Add 'Tags' to help define O365 Group purposes
idea_text: Office 365 Groups only allows basic tagging for data classification. We would like the ability to add additional custom tags that our organisation defines to help us better organise our Office 365 Groups.These tags might be group purpose - Project Group, Office Group, Team Group, Community Group etcBut they might also be sub business (we have 16 individual businesses), might be core office locations, might be regions, etc.This is important as we get audited frequently and may be required to provide all our project information to an auditer. With the flat structure in Office 365 groups at the moment, it would be an impossible task to determine which groups they would need access to.

comments.text: would like these tags to also apply to documents in the files library.

header: Need the ability to lock or disable an O365 Group
idea_text: Working in a large enterprise, we have governance around the process to create and manage groups.  So, we need a way to lock access to the group if the process isn't adhered to.

comments.text: Any update on this?  As a large enterprise we need this ability!

header: When opening a file or folder that is "Shared with Us", open in a new tab
idea_text:
Now that we can share a file or folder with an Office 365 Group, it appears in the Shared with Us view of Groups Files. When we open the file or folder, we are taken away from the context of the Group to the file/folder location. The only way to return is to use the browsers Back button.
I demonstrate in this video - 
Please open files and folders in the Shared with Us view, in a new browser tab or window, so we can easily return to the Group.

header: Be able to create sub-groups
idea_text: Allow the admin/group creator to create sub-groups to allow different portions of the group to be called upon ie. project managment, administtation, project inspection, billing, company managment

comments.text: This would be very useful for my use!  To take it a step further, how about allowing the Group Files to be shared differently among the sub-groups?  When a user is added to the Group, they would be assigned to a sub-group(s) and then can only access the files that have been shared with that group.  The Admin sub-group would be able to access all the files.

header: Integrate (Group) Meetings and Calendar in Desktop Teams Client
idea_text: In the desktop Teams client, I would like to have one unified Meetings and Calendar function for general groups/teams instances. Meetings are a limited tool, while Calendars offer more functionality. However, personal Outlook calendars serve a different function than general teams/groups-wide planning tools. An option to offer a calendar view in Teams, using Groups functionality would be very welcome.

header: Open Groups calendars in the default calendar app (on smartphone, tablet, etc.)
idea_text: Currently you cannot see a groups calendar on a smartphones default calendar app. With all the people doing lots of email and scheduling tasks on their phone or tablet, it should be basic functionality to see the groups calendars there next to the personal calendars. How can you schedule an appointment if you only have half of the information or need to switch between your personal calendar in the calendar app and group calendar in the groups app?

header: Allow Admins to Create O365 Group Template For New Groups
idea_text: Allow Admins to create a Group template that is used whenever a new Group is created.  Right now, we have to manually adjust the settings for the document libraries, timezone, site features, site layout, etc. every time we create a new group. It would be great to be able to create a template that preconfigures new groups to whatever specifications we set.  E.g., We want east coast time zone, specific columns in our doc libraries, metadata activated, planner and calendar links in left menu, specific quick links pre-set at the top of the site's home page, etc.  Having to customize every new Group to include features and layout that we know we want in every Group is an unnecessary inefficiency.

header: Add Quick Steps, Quick Parts, and Categories to Office365
idea_text: Outlook 2016 has 3 features that allow highly efficient handling of email. The office365 does not. If you would support Quick Steps, Quick Parts, and Categories that would be great.If you would allow one to synchronize them with an Outlook 2016 desktop application that feature would be worth purchasing the service by itself. This would also allow many Outlook users to migrate to the Office365 services.

header: Saving Outlook Attchement to Teams instead of in Groups only
idea_text: Saving Outlook Attchement to Teams instead of in Groups only.

comments.text: I've struggled with saving files to Teams. Had to save the file locally and then upload to Teams.  If we could save directly to Teams that would be much more efficient.

Yes!  Users need to be able to select which channel they want to save the attachment in, as well.  Also, make this feature work in Outlook Online, Desktop, & Mobile.  Not just in Outlook Desktop client.

header: Notify group members by email when a file is shared
idea_text: Currently when a file is shared with an Office 365 Group there is no notification to the members that a new file has been shared. This means that you have to browse to the groups Files section and discover these new shared files. When you share directly to an individual that individual is notified by email. I think it should work the same way to Office 365 Group members. It works this way for mail enabled security groups so it should stay consistent and work with Office 365 Groups. Our users have come to expect seeing an email when a files is shared.

comments.text: I agree that this feature should exist. You should have the option to notify the group when uploading/sharing a file (especially if the file is stored within the same group). You can attempt a round-about solution by choosing the "Email" option when right-clicking an uploaded file, then you must enter the email address of the group manually. This process should be automated and included in the upload process (in OWA/SharePoint/OneDrive).
Our Legal team requested this and it seems pretty easy to do.

Important point - waiting for a resolution.
Information that is posted must be notified to persons in the group. If it isn't automatic it would be nice to have a manual process built in for until then.
Yes please, this is a weird shortcoming in the current implementation of groups.
I completely agree with this observation solution.

header: Ability to select language for default language upon a request to create an O365 group site (spo)
idea_text: Is there a  way that we could configure default language for an O365 group site when we request to create a new site?

comments.text: Ans also for teams creation in MS Teams

header: o365 Group email notification
idea_text: no email notification to o365 group, if file shared from one drive for business

comments.text: Make it possible to optionally send email notification when adding user to O365 group. Also make it possible to modify the email that is send.

Disabling the email notification that gets sent automatically when adding people to Groups within O365 is the only way groups can successfully be used to replace distribution lists. 
I have Non-IT group owners (like admin assistants) that need functionality of a shared, self-managed distribution list.
We're no longer supporting public folders, so groups are the next best option. However, the admin assistants aren't on board, because they don't want the full functionality of the group and are worried about confusing users with the notification when adding them at group set-up.

The normal Share process does not send the link/invitation to members of the Group.It is necessary to use the Outlook button on the first Share box and enter the Group mail address. What is needed as a simple way to notify Group members that a document has been added/changed.A "Publish" button after selecting the file - enter message - Send (group mailbox) would be great. Example, think of a simple way to "Publish" the uploaded agenda for next weeks team meeting.

Currently you can't share OneDrive or SharePoint documents to a group even though there is no indication that it hasn't done it. Coupled with the fact that you no longer get copies of your own emails when you send to a group, there's no indication to the average user that the item hasn't been shared as they intend.

header: Let users change the color of their circle icon with initials.

comments.text: I agree, I've had several people create a 2nd group by the same name just to get a different color.

Yes, I think this changing the color is a personal thing and people will opt to do this on their own. Please consider letting them to do this so people will feel more comfortable using and talking about how good outlook mail really is! Thanks for listening. Best Wishes, 
Ron Ajemian
Creepy guy pointing at me is

header: Group Admins should be able to Subscribe/Unsubscribe existing members
idea_text: If there are existing members in a group, the admin has no way to subscribe or unsubscribe them from receiving messages sent to the group.

header: Option to embed microsoft teams into sharepoint
idea_text:
Love microsift Teams, love the live app. But: it exists outside sharepoint (too much) ...
the team comes from a team site but the conversations and documents do not revert back to sharepoint
can we make it so that:
-  the documents tab in ms teams can be linked to a document library?
- the conversations are also stored in sharepoint (as a new web part for a better more evolved discussion board?)

comments.text: I like the fact that you can show a Sharepoint document library as a tab in teams. It would be utterly brilliant to be able to do the same in reverse - ie show a library view from a Microsoft Team in a Sharepoint Online site for true two-way integration .
For the most part I think having the capability of integrating Teams into SharePoint would be the complete package for the ultimate collaboration solutions!

the disconnect between teams and SharePoint has almost become a deal breaker for our company - we're looking at other, more integrated solutions at this point, unfortunately.  We originally moved toward the teams/SharePoint solution hoping for seamless integration, but it's anything but...

I second this request - this would be an excellent feature that bridged the need for my users to understand which tool was serving up the functionality - it lets our users focus on the topics rather than the tools required to discuss/work on a document/etc.  (thanks!)

header: Create multiple boards per plan in Planner

header: Ability to set Unified Group timezone
idea_text:
I have this scenario:1. A group calendar has an event
2. A new user is added to the group
3. The new user gets an email about an upcoming event in the group calendar. Problem: the event time in the email body is in PST and at the end of the email there is a message "Dates and times are based on the group's timezone setting: Pacific Standard Time."Both the SharePoint site of the group and the user's profile has the timezone set to UTC+2 (Helsinki), these settings don't seem to have any effect. I also tried to access the timezone settings of the group's mailbox via PowerShell, but I get an error that the mailbox doesn't exist.

comments.text: I manage Office 365 for a nonprofit and I am also experiencing the issue where group calendars are not matching the Regional settings of the SharePoint site, the admin settings for the organization nor the personal settings of the individual user.Please fix this issue.

Same issue here.  I've tried setting the Sharepoint sites associated with 365 groups/Teams to EST and that didn't work.  It's nothing to do with user accounts either.  Pls fix this so that the notifications use the individual users' time zones, Microsoft!  It's created a lot of confusion for our organization.

header: Need ability to turn off Excel's May 2017 update called " Keep the Copy ". This is for Excel not de-selecting cells.
idea_text: Need ability to turn off Excel's May 2017 update called "Keep the Copy". This is for Excel not de-selecting cells.  When you click in another cell, Excel does not de-select the current cells.  Escape seems to be the only release key. This is confusing a lot of users.

The persistent copy (copied cells remain active after paste) is a real pain to previous users who did not ask for a persistent copy as other users have requested.  Why is it one way for all, and if it is changed to satisfy some, then all have to also take the hit?It completely mystifies me why an option was not provided from the start.  Someone had to have the brains to realize not everyone would appreciate the change.PLEASE add an option to turn off the persistent copy, the cell's selected for copy with the "marching ants" is deselected once any other action besides a paste is performed, or after the paste operation.  Either one.  But give us an out to having to every single time having to hit the "Escape" key, which is just driving some of us crazy since it is so often required!!!Give us the option to TURN OFF!!!

header: Planner users need more control over notification recipients
idea_text: Planner users should be able to choose the level of notifications sent out when carrying out updates etc. This would need some way of specifying team structure but should be practical.  We stopped using Planner because my colleagues were constantly being bombarded with emails relating to peripheral items in the project.  The should receive what is important and relevant to them, not everything.  We should not have to resort to email filters to do this.  Would the admin team send out an email to all staff when they received a new consignment of printer paper? They would send this to their colleagues, not the whole business!  come on MS sort this out, my employer paid a lot of money to use Planner and it's not working for us.

comments.text: Also, we need to be able to have more control over which events trigger notifications and when we receive notifications to reduce the number of unnecessary emails I'm getting from Planner. Examples: I add a comment to a task (don't need this email, I know I commented), a task will be due soon (it isn't due yet, won't be due for two weeks, don't need this reminder).

header: Prevent users from adding hidden Distribution Lists to Teams.
idea_text: Right now, any user can create a new Team and add a hidden Distribution list to the team, this would include a hidden distribution list of all employees.  Even though the distribution lists are hidden, they are showing up in the search result withinTeams.  It seems as though Teams is not looking at the msexchhidefromaddresslists attribute even though it is set to TRUE.

header: Enable group calendars in Macos and iOS calendar apps
idea_text: The group calendar needs to be available in the native calendars of Macos and iOS, so I don't have to use separate apps or be confined to Outlook for the group calendar.

comments.text: Group calendars need to be able to be viewed on other devices.  Forcing people to log into a web browser to see group events is not a good workflow as people rely on their calendars on whatever mobile device they have.  All Calendars (User, Group, team, etc) should be able to sync for the user to their preferred calendar viewing app.

We currently have users on macOS and iOS using the native calendar and reminders apps.  Being able to integrate the Office 365 group calendars would help them with their scheduling and avoid a bunch of retraining (and other such hassles - users want to use the tools that work for them, not learn a new one).

header: Allow simple export or migration of Groups emails
idea_text: Right now there is no way to archive the message thread of a Group. It would be nice to be able to convert a Group to a Shared Mailbox, or easily export contents to a PST. You can't copy messages to another folder in Outlook, all you can do is forward individual messages. When we're done with a group, we often want to archive the messages. It would be nice to be able to take all the messages and dump them into a folder in a Shared Mailbox, or even convert a group to a Shared Mailbox.

header: Separate naming policy for O365 groups and DLs
idea_text: Please separate out naming policy for Office 365 Groups from the Distribution Lists that are coming from on-premise AD via ADConnect. Currently the same policy applies to both O365 Groups and DLs. It would be better to have separate policies for Groups and DLs. Also note that email address does not get the policy prefixes applied.

reaction.note: see this

comments.text: This is related:

header: Allow daemons using Graph API client credential flow to create/edit/delete calendars/events/membership associated with a Group
idea_text: The Microsoft Graph API is supposed to allow programmatic access to Office 365 features. We'd like to use it populate staff and student timetables, where each module being taught would appear as a separate Office 365 Group.  To do this, we'd need a batch process (probably nightly) that could take information from our existing timetabling database and then use this to update the calendar associated with each group.  As this would be done in the wee hours by a daemon process for all users in the University, it needs to use the client credentials OAuth2 flow (ie its allowed by the admins to access resources, rather than individual users granting rights).Unfortunately, whilst the Graph API does have client credientials flow support, and I've got Perl code that uses it, it does not appear to support this OAuth2 flow when dealing with Office 365 Group calendars. The response to the query raised on Stack Overflow was that it is "on the roadmap" (.Without the ability for daemon processes to access Office 365 Groups without an individual user explicitly authorising them, we're sunk in our idea of using Office 365 Groups for timetables, which is a bit of a stumbling block from moving from Google Apps for Education for students where the calendaring APIs work fine.  It also stops other backend scripts leveraging Office 365 Groups in similar ways, making Groups less attractive to us.

header: Cannot turn off the reading pane in groups, like you can in normal Outlook folders (Outlook version 1802, build 9029.2054)

comments.text: This is an irritating problem because the reading pane shows the messages in the reverse order than other messages. Very confusing! When you open the message the order is normal again (oldest message lowest and newest on top), but for some very unclear reason MS thought it would be a good idea to show this reading pane with the newest messages at the bottom. If you could reverse that to the normal way of showing (or if you could have a setting for all of Outlook to choose how you want to see the order of the messages) than not being able to disable the preview pane would be less of a problem. But now the order is inconsistent AND you cannot disable the reading pane I find the groups part extremely frustrating!
Meanwhile we are at version 1902, build 11328.20368 and still the problem is not solved. It's really a pity that this can't be changed.
Really reduces functionality of groups; I abhor the reading pane...
please do something here!!

header: Enable Ability to Whitelist External Sharing Domains for Each Office 365 Group, Similar to SharePoint

This is a feature much required for better control of Teams and Sharepoint Team sites (with group).

without this feature the groups-calendar is not really useful
